text:
I love this place. They need to open up more cafe's. 
When i come here i always get the bizness salad. Before this ive never had; kale, lemon vinaigrette, chickpeas, lentils or quinoa. And they've all changed my life lol. Sooooo good, ive also tried there complicated sammich also good. If you havent came here you need to. Awesome customer service, nice atmosphere. Love it!!!!!

Went here on a recent trip to Vegas.  Almost didn't find the place because of its location inside of a community center and has no sign of its existence on the outside of the building! 

 Was with a party of 10 with 3 children and the found accommodation for us all.  The staff was beyond helpful and made sure to go over the whole menu so we understood everything.

Had THE COMPLICATED ORDER sandwich and THE BIZNESS Salad.  Both selection are some of the best eats I have had in Vegas EVER!!

You need to leave the strip get out of downtown and bare the outside neighborhood for a lunch trip and go to the Bronze for a relaxed meal.

Bronze Cafe all the way! Went Monday and we had such a great meal.  Everything was served wonderfully and the staff very helpful I had chicken salad San and it was a party in my mouth with all the floors. I went with vegan gluten free family and they had soup sandwich and cheesecake wow how great they finally have found a place they can enjoy we are spreading the word!

BEST VEGAN CAFE EVER - MUST GO!!

Went here 3 days in a row during a trip to Vegas and was delighted by the incredible food and friendly staff each day! :) 

SETTING:
Located in the LGBTQ Community Center and very inviting and clean. I was pleasantly surprise by the modern design/furniture and constant flow of traffic. Plenty of seating and not crowded feeling at all.

FOOD:
Amazing for vegans and meat eaters alike!
The sandwiches, pitas, salads, soups, smoothies, coffee...tried them all and was very pleased with all of them. I don't think there is a single flaw in the menu! 

All around an amazing cafe that you need to check out! Wish there was one near me...too bad only 1 exists.

A Great Culinary Experience!

I never write reviews.  I mean, ever.  But I feel that these guys deserve a review, no, they deserve praise!

The food was exquisite and the service was superb.  Imagine a small sandwich shop with four star food and service couple with a hip atmosphere. Truly an experience you have to see for yourself.

I had a sandwich called "miss piggy".  An appropriate name for hardy meets healthy.  I never thought healthy can be both scrumptious and filling.  I can still taste it and can't wait to try it again.

I tell everyone I know about this truly under-rated cafe/restaurant I have ever encountered.  Somehow, I feel enriched by the experience.

THIS IS A MUST EXPERIENCE.  Take your friends, family and business associates for I guarantee all will enjoy!

I love love love this place so much! So good and fresh ingredients daily! I love the California Turkey i order it every time i go! Love it!!! Friendly and professional staff! Would recommend this place to anyone!

Finally made it in for lunch today after hearing great things about it from left, right and centre.  Awesome food.  I ate the Tree of LIfe sandwich and my two friends had the southwest salad and the Bronze version of a BLT.  No one left a thing on the plate.  Lovely food, lovely service (they gave us lots of samples), lovely atmosphere. Oh, and loads of vegan selections.  Yum.
I orders the tree of life pita- AMAZING!! I also ordered the vegan superfoods smoothie- also quite tasty. I will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas! Maybe even before I leave...

I really don't understand the positive feedbacks that drove me here. I was looking for a quiet place to avoid the sand storm outside. I went to this indoors cafe expecting good coffee and a nice place.

- We took a Mocha Latte and a Hot chocolate. Both were terrible, any coffee from the 7-11 next door would have been better.
- Also, there pastries look like home-made (a little messy), but are just average in taste.
- The prices are high for bad quality beverages.
- The coffee place doesn't have its own place, it is shared with the Center Lobby, which means : you're just sitting in a place with a lot of coming and going of people not even taking anything in the coffee.
- You keep seeing the center officer reprimanding people in the space for not sitting right or whatever, like in a Library.
- There was a Wifi access point that said Bronze Cafe but that one was "not open to the public" ... so, you had to use the center Wireless, which doesn't work that well.

Well, if you want to relax, this coffee doesn't deserve the effort. You can have a better experience by taking a coffee at the 7-11 and enjoying the free wifi and seats at the Center in front of Bronze Cafe, or simply by looking to one of the numerous better places !

This will now be a favorite stop for us whenever we are in Vegas! Fresh, high quality food and great staff! We shared the David's Special salad with yummy quinoa salad, avocado salad, chickpea salad, and beet salad atop a massaged kale salad with a flavorful vinegarette dressing. We also shared the tree of life pita-flavorful mixed greens with avocado, red peppers, tomatoes, cashew cheese sauce, Brazil nut crumbles, etc.  on pita. A wonderful choice! Try their green tea vegan/gluten free cheese cake!!!!

Good sized portions. Wonderful food! And, so good for you! I want to try everything!

Vegan options are amazing. The vegan treats are even more amazing! And you can get them warmed up. Coffee is super strong. There is a huge loungr area that belongs to the center. But you are allowed to lounge.

One star off because they kinda expensive
The yummiest David's Special salad, and sandwiches and scones and HUMMUS! Really great food!!

STAY AWAY FROM AZTEC COOKIE

Couldn't get thru one bite. 
Seriously spicy is a understatement. 
Wasted 2.75

The strawberry cookie was okay 

Really Don't think I'm returning

Since my first time here, I've returned 4 times in a time span of 1 week... I just can't get enough.

Located at the center, this place offers a great selection. My personal favorite is "the bizzness" with chickpeas, curried quinoa, and beet salad. You get the option of choosing any three of their sides. Their brussel sprouts are good too. 

Whether you choose from their mole sandwich, good earth, green goddess, or LGBTQ, you won't be disappointed. 

Don't skip out on dessert. Get their peanut butter snickerdoodle cookie and warm it up. You won't be disappointed. 

Friendly staff and great area to sit down and get some work done.

Eating food is an experience, and the staff at the bronze delivered. I ordered the compacted order, which is an amazing sandwich filled with great food. 
But the staff made it even better. This place had the best service of any restaurant that I have been to. 
Definitely try it when you come to Vegas.

In fairness, Ive only had take out and deliver.  The food is delicious, but it is not cheap for delivery. The food is always fresh, and good. But the charge is a lot. You would have to decide if it is worth what they're giving. I like it, Im going back and ordering again.  Ill have to try the sit down sometimes.

This place is a gem! I've been here 3 times and the customer service has been phenomenal. I tried the Thai noodle salad.....SO DAMN GOOD! I inhaled the container! Instead of grabbing fast food in the area, stop by this cafe, your body will thank you for the delicious nutrition.

Wow. Delicious! I ordered through uber eats. had the tree of life pita, complicated order, beet salad, and a variety of the fresh baked goods including a perfect banana loaf, and a bacon scone. The portion sizes are hearty, ingredients are fresh, and the flavors are well-balanced. I will definitely order again!

Bronze Cafe is a must. The menu is so diverse. Huge selection of Vegan options. All items fresh and refreshing. The "What What" sandwich is my most favorite. The bakery selection is as sweet as the staff. I always enjoy my experience at the Bronze Cafe!

A fabulous place with quality food and ingredients! I have tried just about everything here and my favorites are the Beet and Goat Cheese Salad(full size), the LGBTQ, and Good Earth. Everything is filled with flavor. I come here quite often because of the food and friendly service.

I had the Green Goddess Chicken Salad Sandwich, which was way too tasty for me to remember to take photos of how pretty it looked. Service was excellent. I had it delivered to my home. Mmm! All around good. :)

Best lunch place I've eaten in a long time. I was at a meeting nearby and googled potential lunch places. As a vegetarian I always have to plan in advance. I had scoped this place out and even decided on the LGBTQ in advance. At the last minute a non-veg, more conservative colleague decided to join me......awkward moment.....however it all turned out to be non issue except in my head. Colleague loved his Tree of Life, I loved my sandwich-could not eat whole sandwich. Wish I could have stayed longer to enjoy bookishly bohemian layout and a coffee, but had to get back to work. My kid went crazy over the leftover sandwich and begged me to bring her there. So, you go to Bronze Cafe, you'll love it too.

When a coworker said there was a new spot downtown that had good vegetarian and vegan offerings, and some really good salads (which is all I ever want in this heat!) I was super excited to try it. 

Parking was plentiful, and the cafe space inside The Center was bright, clean, inviting and comfortable. 

I chose the Good Earth Vegan sandwich and the cantaloupe and turmeric water. The Pita sandwich was huge, and loaded with mushrooms, egg plant, peppers, sprouts, lettuce, tomatoes and some amazing hummus. It was served with a nice, fresh little side salad with a lemony dressing on it. The quality was fantastic, and the price was quite reasonable. 

I'm already perusing the menu, deciding what I'm going to get when I go back.

First time here and the food was excellent. Lots of options, especially if you're vegan and gluten-free. I got the green goddess sandwich which was a chicken salad sandwich. The chicken was excellent, flavored with pesto and delicious veggies. The bread was very good as well. Wanted to try the vegan pastries but was a bit full after my delicious meal. Great place for food and the workers were pretty great as well. Very accommodating and ready to answer any questions.

This place has some of the best food and customer service I've ever experience in the Las Vegas valley. Albert and Yishay run the place like a 5 star restaurant, not to mention the place is very well kept. The food is made to perfection with high quality produce and the flavor in each dish shares its own unique taste that will hit the spot every time! Love the food and the atmosphere!

LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE! THE FOOD AND DRINKS ARE AMAZING!! 

We eat there or take out several times a week!!! = )

My personal favorites are the Good Earth sandwich on Pita - no mushrooms

The Whey too good for you shake and of course the strawberry cookie 

=)
Great food, and David couldn't be nicer. As a vegan it's so nice to go somewhere and know with certainty the ingredients in all of the items. Just can't get enough of this place.

Freaking amazing! I had one of the pita wraps! A hidden gem inside of the LGBT Center- I completely drove past it because you cannot see it from the outside and there is no signage. RECOMMENDATION- Have some signage on the outside of the building!
Very good salads, a little bit of a wait but worth it for sure, also a bit pricy but it's good size portions.
Quick delivery, big portions, and absolutely delicious.  Just had the tree of life and cant wait to have it for lunch again tomorrow! :)
I would say this place is underrated but judging by the amount of reviews, I'm happy to have discovered it. Used a groupon and I will definitely be back. Amazing food & friendly staff!

Truly great desserts!!! I have no willpower in the face of their excellent selection. Staff is really nice, too! The location at The Center is great too, such a beautiful new facility.     
Great place for a mixed crowd vegan/nonvegan eats!!

Had the Good Earth sandwich and a bowl of the Thai soup.  The soup was excellent - spicy and sweet at the same time.  Filled with huge chunks of veggies.  I am usually NOT a fan of grilled veggie sandwiches (chef cop-out in my opinion) but this one was better than others EVEN if they forgot the hummus and sunflower seeds as described on the menu.

Friendly staff and quick carryout service. It's amazing what's been done to a former paint and wallpaper store :)

One thing I do object to is that the plant based sandwiches are a dollar MORE than the animal sandwiches (which makes absolutely no logical sense).  AND charging $3 extra for 1/2 c of diced seitan.  Too much nickle and diming for my liking.

So a sandwich and maybe 6oz of soup cost me $20.  Wont be back for that simple reason.
Friendly service and good quick food near downtown.

Wow! Blown away by the quality and service at this place, located in the center! The menu is so friendly to meat eaters, vegans, and anyone who loves amazing pastries! they have a bacon jam that goes on their LGBTQ BLT, and it's crazy good. YOU HAVE TO GO!

The Bronze Cafe has truly been my favorite place to visit in 2013. Their vegan options are some of the best. Everything is absolutely delicious and the Tree of Life Pita is seriously one of the best sandwiches I've ever had in my entire life. Chef Peter and David are culinary geniuses and are so wonderful for offering the vegan community in Vegas so many amazing options. If you go, don't leave without the strawberry cookie! And trust me, if you ever thought you weren't a fan of brussel sprouts, you will be after trying their roasted side dish. I blame (thank) the Bronze Cafe for my current obsession with brussel sprouts. lol SERIOUSLY GO RIGHT NOW!

Very nice place.  My sandwich was excellent, it was a regular turkey sandwich with avocado, tomatoes, bla bla bla, but they put a very delicious lemon vinaigrette, that made all the difference.  The flavored waters are as delicious as the pastries they have behind the display.  Staff very friendly. Oh, and they have a LGBT library in the corner.  Just come and check it out for yourself.

Great little cafe and excellent customer service. It was very easy to find and there was plenty of parking. 

I tried The Tree of Life pita and it was amazing! Delicious! I'll definitely be going more often as I am already craving that pita.

In Vegas & struggling to eat healthy? Yeaa, me too. Bronze Cafe is our answer. Here for a week on biz and enjoying my time eating here for lunch & dinner - everyday. Staff is cool, down to earth & friendly. Nutrition for mind, body, and soul. :)
Best food in Las Vegas if you want clean and healthy I eat here every time I stay great smoothies and they have a gluten free menu
One of the best vegan lunches I have ever had. I had the good earth pita sandwich, so amazing. The staff is extremely friendly and happy. So excited to go back soon!!

I like the ambience. It's relaxed and the cheerful workers are accommodating and a delight.  They have a bookcase filled with books for your entertainment. For pastries go with the savory scones or loving v. Virginia (chocolate chip cookie on top of brownie).

 As for the sammies.. I recommend getting a (v) vegan sandwich (tree of life, guac and mole, good earth) and adding bacon jam for like 1.95 more. I think the LGBTQ needs more flavor and textures. Although the complicated order is an advanced LGBTQ with avocado and chicken on ciabatta, both of them are still the equivalents of blts and turkey clubs, whereas the vegan sandwiches with bacon jam are unique and packed with flavor and texture. Eat your vegetables!
Exceptional customer service by the staff here and I definitely recommend it.  Had the LBGQT and it was scrumptious.

Can't believe we stumbled upon this place just looking for "lunch" in north Vegas! The Green Goddess sandwich and the Complicated sandwich impressed us with great presentation and flavor. The only complaint, if it can be called that, was the comparative boringness of the brussel sprout salad.

The iced coffee and fruit water were also pretty great.

Regardless, they had us at LGBTQ sandwich! We will definitely be back!

Absolutely amazing!!! We read the reviews and knew we had to try while visiting Las Vegas. The Complicated...bacon jam...that's all that needs to be said. Great sandwich. Also had the Tree of Life sandwich. Completely on the other side of healthy and delicious. The sandwiches are so big that you just need to commit and not put it down until your done!!! This will not be the only visit while in town.

Bronze Cafe is a peaceful haven with friendly atmosphere and genuinely good food.  Its central location puts it right at the heart of Downtown Las Vegas so that it is conveniently accessible from anywhere in the Valley. I commute between Downtown and the Strip, and I always stop by to refuel from the heat with their refreshing juices and smoothies. I have tried all of their blended fruit juices and highly recommend them each and every one. My faves are watermelon with chia, and honeydew-cucumber -I just sit there and cool down to the core. It's also great to-go in my scooter cup holder.  

I also appreciate the fresh food menu offered throughout the day. I especially enjoy visiting in the morning for fresh pastries (I recommend apple spice cake and cream-filled "lobster tail"). It's a good place to lounge around and kick-start your humor. The staff are among the friendliest I've ever encountered in Las Vegas. They're just incredibly spontaneous in their interactions, and not at all in an artificial way.  Simply love it.

Great vegan options at this place and for great causes! I loved the sandwich/wrap I got and the baked goods. My companions got salad and some of the other sandwiches and they also loved it. Very friendly workers too. The atmosphere was nice, with books, clean tables, and sitting area with information packets.
Finally got to try this place out last week and everything and everyone was Devine! Tree of Life left me wanting it daily. Vegan cheesecake was the bomb.

Do NOT miss these guys!  We had them cater 3 evening meals for 10 picky adults at the house we were renting.  To the person, everyone raved about the entire meal - from appetizer to dessert.  Evening 1 was outdoor cookout; Evening 2 was thai and Evening 3 was italian.  What they put on the table was consistently exceptional.  And, they prepared and served with finesse and warmth.  They did not mind that we darted in to check what was under development.  It was great fun having them spoil us; don't miss your opportunity!

OK- I was recommended this place for a business lunch and I have to be honest: terrible for a business lunch. Seating was limited and right in the middle of some computer banks and so on- library/ student quad vibe.  I scheduled it based on the representations on the web but not a good place to meet with clients. I has a public library vibe. So, getting that out of the way, the blt was really good as were the fruit waters and friendly service. Just not a fit for a business lunch. Sorry guys.

Great Cafe with wonderful staff and delicious, healthy options!!! Love coming by on my lunch hour during the week and can't wait to bring my husband to try it! The Green Goddess sandwich and the Good Earth pita are my favorites.

I LOVE this place, not once have I had a disappointing meal / drink here.  My favorite is the tree of life pita and the mole and guac Sammie.  I don't care where I live in Vegas, I go out of my way if need be when I get a bronze craving.  Plus the vibe is so nice and laid back. 

Keep it up guys!

I adore this place... Finally had an excuse to check out The Center. I'm shy! Husband took me here on a whim, I almost cried with how delicious the bacon jam was on my LGBTQ... I did cry when it was over. I get the same thing each time, LGBTQ and pineapple mint water. I love the brussel sprouts too, perfect combo of sweet and sour. 
I always giggle loudly when they ask if they can toss my husband's salad.
There is nothing like waking up early, grabbing some grub from here and going on a hike or a day trip. 
The worst is when they don't have pineapple water or bacon scones, you sleep in you lose out. Now I can enjoy vegan food, between this place and randomly finding dole whip around town I am one happy human. I haven't found anything I didn't like here yet.

Love the flavors and freshness of the food. I eat here regularly and will amp up the visits when ever the Clerk of the Supreme Court is in town. We both love the food so much that we suggested 3 Supreme Court Justices give it a shot! They ordered, salads, soups and desert from Bronze and loved the food. My favorite is the Tree of Life sandwich that is made with a fresh, soft pita bread, fresh salad fixings, a creamy cashew spread (yum) and pickled onions (double yum!). You HAVE to stop by and try Bronze Cafe! This is how good the food is ... I love the food and I'm not even a vegetarian

This is a couple days late. We went on Friday night. Small cafe in The Center. I didn't know about this place before. But there is a jewel inside if this building. 
We were cheerfully greeted by "Ye-shay"  (sorry don't know how to spell his name). This was our first time there. He described the items very well and even gave us some samples to try.  Food was very good. Fresh and tasty!  Loved the baked goods too!!! Cookie/brownie thing is a must have!!!  We received excellent customer service from this young gentleman!  Very nice to have him on the front line.  First impressions mean everything to a business.  My husband and I will definitely be back. We want to try everything!
Love this place. Great service and awesome food!!!! Did I mention the coffee is the bomb :)

Best service and amazing sandwiches! Love everything they offer but of course my fav is the LGBTQ! Also hummus or babaganoosh is only $2.25 more with a sandwich or salad purchase! Soup of the day today, butternut squash, was good too! Love this place
Excellent vegan soup - tomato purée with ginger. Chopped Cobb salad was good. Definitely will visit and explore other parts of the menu.

This is one of the most delicious and innovative food places I've been to.  Located in a community center,  the food maybe under estimated.  The food is made fresh and there are lots of vegetarian, Gluten and dairy free options. We tried the baba ghanoush and the humus which tasted great.  My husband had the turkey sandwich which he's still raving about.  The pineapple chia drink was very refreshing and I'd want to come back to Vegas just for their coconut water almond butter drink. They had gluten and dairy free cheesecake in strawberry,  Chocolate and pistachio flavors.  My husband doesn't usually like gluten free desserts but even he loved them.  The crust was made of dates and coconuts, absolutely delicious.  In short,  don't miss this place.
There are no words. Food is beyond amazing, service is so good it will put a smile on your face even if you're having the most terrible day, and vegan everything.

Great food with excellent fair pricing. It is so nice to have a healthy alternative that Actually tastes good. Everything on the menu is fabulous. The staff are respectful, friendly, fast. The atmosphere is clean and inviting. I will defiantly be back! Tell all your friends and don't miss out on this great find in Vegas.
Excellent quality, fresh food, wonderfully seasoned. Staff was very friendly. Lovely, lovely, lovely. Even if you are not a vegetarian, you will love the quality and the portion size.

The guy (cashier)who helped us was awesome. We tried the vegan chili. Yummy. The tree of life pita...oh my. So good. My brother who is not vegan loved it. I got all kinds of bake goods too. All of them good. I recommend the brownie chocolate chip cookie. Everything was awesome. Definitely coming back. :) Thank you to the cashier guy who was wonderful. :)

I had the tree of life pita with seitan and it was amazing! Completely vegan, everything that is in the sandwich is just amazingly balance to crazy a very tasty, healthy vegan meal. Will definitely go back!

This place is the best. So much vegan goodness. I only found out about it recently and I've already been back so many times. Cheesecake was amazing. Tree of life pita = amazing. Bizzness salad = you get the idea. Plus the staff is cool and we all played cups!! Go see for yourself.

Great food and great service; so hard to find quality places in Vegas that serve healthy but delicious and fresh food.  the Bizness (David's Special) salad is the best salad I've tried in this city. I only wish Bronze Cafe would open up on the Southwest side of town!  We could use more locations!

This weekend my husband and I were pleasantly surprised to come across the Bronze Cafe!! As we stood trying to decide what to order, out came Howard. Howard was seemingly able to read our tastes immediately.  He recommended the pineapple mint chia drink for my hubby and I had the watermelon chia, BOTH ARE AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!  I then ordered the tree of life sandwich that he suggested. It came with a side salad of mixed greens caressed in a delicious lemon vinaigrette!  The Bronze Cafe is my new desert oasis.Howard you are my new best friend!! Thank you for the great cafe experience.

My first time eating a Vegan meal and I was absolutely IMPRESSED! Had the "Its the Bizness" with spicy chick peas, curried quinoa and beet salad. Sampled both the green tea raw vegan cheese cake and the mocha-chocolate raw vegan cheesecake...the only disappointment is that they were sold out of the mocha-chocolate cheesecake when I was ready leave so I could not bring a piece home!

Tried Bronze Cafe for the first time a few weeks ago and was absolutely pleased with the food.  I heard the wait can get a bit lengthly so I ordered online through Yelp.  Great experience and will definitely do it again!

It's an easy decision to drive from Summerlin to Bronze Cafe at The Center when you know there's such DELICIOUS food to be had.  My husband and I love the Tree of Life and Roasted Veggie Sandwiches, accompanied by a watermelon chia drink, and topped off with either (or both) the vegan cheesecake and vegan strawberry cookies.  Our son loves the LGBTQ sandwich.  All the sides are yummy as well.  I can't wait to try the rest of the vegan options on the menu.  Again, totally worth the drive!
Love this place. I've yet to try something I don't like. Also love how many options they have for vegans.

I admit I was hesitant about trying this place, although it had awesome reviews, they say they are Vegan and well I am anything but and tend to be skeptical of anyplace that is proud of catering to Vegans. Nothing against Vegans but I love meat, and well fat = flavor, and how many vegetables have fat in them. I was surprised by how much I liked this place. I ordered the LGBTQ. It did not disappoint, it had bacon jam which was slightly sweet, maple bacon and plenty of it, lettuce tomato and some sort of aioli.  It also came with a small side salad which was just spinach, however it was tossed in a light, slightly tangy lemon vinaigrette which was ever so good. The price was a little over $9. The drinks are a little pricey, $1.50 for a can of soda or $1.95 for water or San Pell which I had. But I guess you can't have everything. I was also surprised by how crowded it was, we got the last table. There are couches as it is a community center that were free.   Also, if I didn't make this obvious for anyone out there like me, the bacon was real it was not faux bacon and they have other real meat while also offering options to the vegetarians and vegans among us.
The food was delicious and the staff were very pleasant. So happy there were nonvegan options for those vegans who love meat eaters

Bronze Cafe is THE BEST! The food is exceptional - healthy, delicious, generous portions. The service is equally amazing - everyone is always friendly, welcoming and kind. Definitely one of the hidden Vegas gems.

I have never found a cafe as good as this one. 
I didn't expect that much when I went here the first time, to be honest, but I was blown away by the food and the service! The LOVELY chefs and baristas let me sample the food and I was left so stuck on what to get, everything was so good. I am a big fan of their pastries and drinks! I recommend the malted chocolate chip cookies to anyone who goes here. Plus, the prices are surprisingly decent!! I can't help but smile when I go in. They even recognize me now and make me feel comfortable. Always a great experience eating at their cafe. I would ask what the secret ingredient is, but it's obviously love and acceptance. :)

perfect gem inside The Gay & Lesbian Community Center of Southern Nevada! what a great little cafe, with a huge menu - definitely some of the best and most original food, and so healthy too!

I got "The vegicated" sandwich (delicious!), my boyfriend got "the complicated" (so good!), and we shared a side of sweet potatoes and onions (yummmmm). and we're stuffed!

At first we had a difficult time finding this place because it's inside the LGBTQ center.  Straight people, don't feel intimidated by going here...everyone is welcome.  The staff is sooo friendly and knowledgeable about the food they serve.  

We started our meal with the "Vegan/Gluten Free Zucchini and Banana Brownie"  it was served warmed and was gooey and delicious.

For our lunches we had the Guac Mole vegan sandwich and the LGBTQ sandwich.  They both came with a side of greens. Both were the best sandwiches we've ever had.  For real.  We drank the iced brewed coffee and it's really special, prepared in a cool drip device and the cantaloupe turmeric fruit water was refreshing.  

Fantastic experience.  We'll be back.
The food was delivered to our hotel in less than 45 minutes.  We ordered a large variety of food. That pita is the truth! A most order.  We will definitely visit again.

Ever so often a downtown business rewards you for living in and being a Downtown Las Vegas booster. The Beat, The Container Park and the new Grand Hotel are all on a quickly growing list of places to hang and spend money. The Bronze Cafe ties with Mingos as my I could be there everyday spot. The food is amazing! The staff couldn't be friendlier and the owners are two people truly deserving of success. They provide the best fresh food prepared in innovative ways. Oh yeah, I forgot to mention, everything I've had has been so tasty that I highly recommend the spot to everyone without worry that I'll get back a text saying,  "meh." And they cater! Please come check out and support this fantastic addition to the downtown experience!

it was amazing. I had the tree of life pita, delicious. 
The soup of the day: wild rice and mushroom was also delicious 
Customer service: the gentleman that was helping me was polite and patient 
I will be going back and recommending it to everyone.

First time and the atmosphere was pretty dope..from the art work to the literature for lgbt community.Staff was friendly and very knowledgeable about their menu. We bought pressed juice ,coffee, and desserts to go along with it. Will definitely be back with the kids.

Very clean, very spacious and very good! The menu is a bit to look at, but they're so much more inexpensive than Panera Bread. They've got the manager's special which I'd recommend (half a sandwich with a soup or a salad).
I was surprised this small cafe would have such great food. The Tree of Life has a citrus taste, may not be for everyone. The Good Earth Pita is also amazing. Sandwichs come with a small side salad
located inside the LBGTQ center, best vegan salad we had on our road trip, amazing! also has coffee, sandwiches, pastry. go here if youre sick of all the other stuff...
My absolute favorite place to eat in town! They are extremely food allergy friendly. Always have great service. Excellent desserts. 5 stars all around.
Its really impossible to dislike this place. They offer fantastic food at dirt chep prices and also deliver. I have to refrain from eating the bacon sandwich... A+++

Fresh, delicious, and inspiring food. The customer service and atmosphere are also amazing. Really glad to leave the strip and pick up the Tree of Life Pita. Melt in your mouth flavor!

Service was minimal and expectedly so with a casual place like this but the staff was very friendly and informative. I will definitely come back here again.
pricey but was my favorite place to go for lunch until its recent closure.  loved ms. piggy - oh well, must trek to the other location now.

Went to Bronze Cafe based on a yelp search for vegetarian food and the many raving reviews. And I have to say, my food was delicious. I ordered the Tree of Life pita and it was absolutely wonderful. I actually started with the mixed greens it is served with and I had to eat all of them first because they were soo good! The lemon vinaigrette is just wonderful. The wrap itself was so full of flavor and very satisfying. The crushed nuts were a great addition and added a nice texture. I really loved that it didn't fall apart all over the plate as well. I was also given a complimentary vegan (and i think gluten free) raspberry cheesecake due to a little incident of a decorative display falling on me (it didn't actually hit me). I don't usually go for vegan desserts (since I'm not vegan and prefer the real stuff if I am going to indulge), but it was pretty good. Wasn't much like a cheesecake but still tasty. And I certainly appreciated the gesture!!! The staff was very friendly and helpful, gave recommendations, offered samples, brought me my order, etc. I will definitely be going back for more.

Loving the variation here... However the bacon jam is giving me the acid reflux. If you are young and exercise daily, it might not be a problem.. Otherwise.. Staying with the light snack might be a wise choice.

The Bronze Cafe' is my favorite little gem in town!  From the chef,  the staff and food you will never be disappointed!  Everything is made Fresh with the highest quality products!  I have dined in,  taken out and catered and without fail each time was phenominal! You will never be disappointed!  They offer GF, Veg, Vegan, Healthy and homemade.. try a sandwich or make a sandwich into a salad.. the "bizzness" is YUMMY and the vegan "cheescakes" are to die for! Make sure you try this little cafe' that will surely become your favorite place too!

What a little gem! I was looking online for a spot to eat healthy and this café was highly rated on many reviews. This eatery is set up like a food court, only without any other restaurants. 

I opted for the soup of the day - fresh veggies and kale, along with the California Turkey sandwich (Turkey breast, avocado, mixed greens, tomato, red onion, basil aioli, lemon vinaigrette, on Ciabatta bread). What's the word for 100 times more than just yummy! The sandwich came with mixed greens - so tasty and fresh I imagined they were picked today.

Kale can be bitter, but the seasoning and texture of the soup brought out its best flavor. They had an intriguing method for making coffee (which I hardly ever drink). Ice cubes in a glass container dripped water over coffee grounds, which then filled a coffee pot. I couldn't resist. And since I drink coffee so rarely I had to get a dessert to go with it - right? 

A mango cookie with a dollop of apricot in its center seemed like a good choice and - just to make sure I ate every crumb - stuffed as I was - it was heated slightly so it was just a teeny bit soft and oh so marvelously delicious. 

The service matched the food. Everyone couldn't be nicer, more knowledgable about every detail of the products, and eager to make your experience memorable. Though I had black coffee, I was offered home made almond milk - a first for me. Should have had a glass of that - but I'll save that for the next time. Lots more on the menu for me to enjoy.

One last word - this spot is owned by a gay couple and is located in the Gay and Lesbian Community Center of Southern Nevada. Didn't bother me in the least, I found the atmosphere quite friendly and welcoming - but if that puts you off - sorry to say you'll be missing a really good meal.

I loved visiting the center today. There was a gender neutral bathroom that was refreshing to see. Restrooms were very clean and well-kept. I purchased the California Tofurkey sandwich and I'm pretty sure I'll be dreaming about it at some point after today. It was DELICIOUS. The food was fresh, homemade, tasted amazing - the restaurant has a diverse and delicious vegan menu that I was pleased to find. I just wish that there were more locations closer to my house! Or maybe inside of my house, would be even better. The service was also excellent. I don't see why anyone would not want to eat here at any point. Great desserts as well, I got a giant vegan chocolate chip chocolate cookie that tasted great. Also options for meat eaters.

I had the Complicated One sandwich. OMG the maple bacon jam is fantastic! The sandwich  was huge and came with a small salad. The banana boi bait for dessert was delicious. I will definitely be coming back.

Couldn't pick a better time to begin yelping! 

The food here is nothing short of excellent and along with impeccable service I think I'll be eating here weekly. Healthy infused fruit drinks give me that second boost when I'm off to job #2. 

Every meal is made to perfection, from the oven crispy bun to the mixed greens and everything in between is simply awesomeness and deliciousness forcing your taste-buds to explode in pure ecstasy. 

For a detailed list of everything on the menu please see the other 66 reviews ;)

I ordered from here and was very pleased. This place has some of the best and freshest food consistently. They have a great selection of healthy fare. It is a little difficult to find it in the community center but well worth the effort. One of my top 5 restaurants in Las Vegas that wont break the bank. The food is just so good you can't pick something you wont like and they have a nice eclectic menu. The juices are great as well. This place is just hands down wonderful.

I have always enjoyed ordering from the Bronze Cafe. Unfortunately today there was a piece of plastic in my lettuce.. I ordered the good earth pita. I never had any issues, but paying $10 for there to be a piece of plastic in my food was disappointing.

!!!!!! LOVE!!! This place is amazing. I love their Vegucated sandwich. All of their sides are amazing and the cinnamon roll warmed up is bomb.com. I always used their delivery service and was very impressed how well they packaged everything and delivered it in a timely manner. The food travels well too. : ) Happy to have found this place.

I literally live here when I travel to Vegas. This place is AWESOME! I find it very hard to eat while I travel do to my diet. This place has some amazing options. Not to mention the staff is always so helpful and nice. A must try!

First you walk in thinking its an office building.... And once inside super delightful. Warm, friendly the entire staff is amazing. David - I just couldn't get enough of him (I think he's the owner )  We got the "LGBTQ" sandwich.... Freakin amazing. And for dessert strawberry vegan cheesecake. Yup!!!! And it was honestly one if the best cheesecakes I have ever had. 
The only suggestion for being open so early is to provide a breakfast sandwich. 

You must go!!!!

Bronze Cafe always give the best service and by far the best healthy food Vegas has to offer! The smiley and always so welcoming staff is the reason why the good tastes so good!! 
I recommend everything on the menu !!!!

One of my favorite healthy food spots in town! Kind of hard to find at first, it's located inside "The Center" across the 7-11. Their salads were amazing and their drinks were delicious. When I went about a month ago, they had this mouth-watering RAW GREEN TEA CHEESECAKE!!! Omg.. Bliss in your mouth!!! Going again.. Hopefully they still have it!
Wow! Once again I'm blown away with fresh ingredients and layers of taste.  Go now and ask for the David Special! You're welcome.

There was a seminar being held at my daughter's college about a month ago, and this cafe made an appearance, offering free sandwiches and desserts. My daughter was able to taste their "What What?" sandwich and one of their cookies. She loved it so much! She'd been raving about their food for an entire month, before we decided to go last Friday.

As you may know, this establishment is a big supporter and advocate of the LGBTQ community, which, I am, as well. Their restrooms are gender neutral, allowing for men and women to access the facility simultaneously (there are multiple stalls). 

The Bronze cafe, is, I'm my opinion, located in a rather hidden spot. You could drive by the place as I did and miss it because nothing screams- Gourmet Sandwich spot! The building, itself is pretty nice. The inside is very clean and cozy. There are sofas, cushioned, single chairs, as well as dining tables throughout the place. Computers and a sizeable library is also located within the premises of the restaurant. 

So, on to the food. I mentioned above that my daughter suggested the 'What what?" sandwich. It comes with turkey, pepperoni, red onion, tomato, greens, basil Aoli, oregano vinaigrette, and it's served on toasted ciabatta bread. We both ordered one, however I requested avocado be added to mine. The addition was an extra $1 charge. I'm not used to eating sandwiches without mayo, so I asked if they had any, and I was told that they had a vegan mayo. I decided to just go without it.

My daughter and I chose to sit in the sofa area to wait on our food. We waited only a few minutes before being told our order was ready. Awesome!!!! We opened the bag containing our sandwiches and they had been placed in these cute little brown boxes!!! Different. Unique.

I go to eat my sandwich and about 1/4 of the way through, I bite down on something hard. It's a toothpick, but in looking at the sandwich up close, you can't see it. And I know that toothpicks are often placed in sandwiches, burgers and the like, to hold them together. But, I felt it should have been visible prior to eating. Anyways, because I couldn't see how the toothpick was placed (I'd already pulled it out when I bit into the sandwich) I thought maybe it was just misplaced. But, then my daughter began to eat her sandwich and she too bit down on it, unaware of there being a toothpick in it. I continued to eat and there was a total of 4 (hidden) toothpicks. So, this is just a heads up. Also, with the sandwich comes a small side of greens (possibly green leaf lettuce?) which tasted so fresh and delicious with the side of vinaigrette they give you.

In summary, we loved the sandwiches. Soooo good! Would definitely recommend and I'd go out of my way to go again. Great, fast customer service, friendly employees, fresh, good tasting and neatly presented food equals a place worth visiting!

PROTIP: Check in on yelp for $1 off each sandwich or the Bizness meal (as of 3/9/2014)!!

Located inside the Center on Maryland and Clark. Best spur-of-the-moment find ever! They offer scones, cheesecake, cookies, healthy bars, sandwiches, salads, smoothies, lattes, coffees, and quinoa sides. They have flavored agave packs here! Skinny tubes of it for less than $1. Very cool. Offers vegan, vegetarian, and meaty options. Now that's what I call: choices! 

NOTE: They do delivery here! $3 charge for orders less than $30. Free for over that price. Great idea for DTLV residents or for company lunches.

Goodwich was closed by 3pm on sundays. Thought we could make it, but we were an hour late! Curse you daylight savings! But really, if we didn't forget, we would have not found this place sooner.

I pulled up the yelp app looking for nearby eats and they directed me to the Bronze Café located in the Center. I did not expect this place to be so good! The guys working here were AWESOME. Love them. They made excellent recommendations. 

While we were waiting for our food, he gave us spoon samples of their chocolate cheesecake, strawberry, and pecan. Amazingly high-quality. Fresh. Housemade and NOT bought from a distributor. Bronze Café, for sure, is the real deal.

We ordered the kale, banana, apple vegan smoothie. Yummy. Not bitter and the perfect amount of sweet! Refreshing for a perfect spring/summer day. Comes in two sizes. 14 oz. ($4-5ish) and 24 oz. ($5.75). Get the bigger size. So worth the health.

There was extra smoothie in the blender so our server gave us the rest in another cup (See pic). Now that was really, really thoughtful. Seriously. It was a lot of juice! More than what I can say about Jamba Juice (you just know those jamba jerks have extra but won't give it to you!) 

To start we had the HUMMUS: chickpeas, tahini, olive oil, cumin, paprika, lemon juice. I could have sworn it had roasted red pepper too... Comes with warm pita. ($3.95) kinda small for the price but it's only $2.25 if you ordered a sandwich/salad. Great for a small lunch/snack size. Creamy, smooth, fresh. Ridiculously tastes like tacos to me. The spices they used and the freshness just got to me. I wish I bought a tub to take home. Waaayyy better than store-bought hummus. Must-try!

My friend and I also ordered the Tree of Life (vegan) and I ordered the LGBTQ sandwich. 

Tree of Life sandwich ($9.95): roasted red peppers, avocado, mixed greens, tomato, housemade pickled onions, housemade vegan cashew creama, brazil nut crumbles, mango cilantro vinaigrette on a pita flatbread. Comes with a small side salad of mixed greens in the vinaigrette. 
LOVED this. The crunch of the nut went surprisingly well with the avocado and the veggies. What the heck. These guys know how pair flavors! Who knew vegan could taste so good. (They make sure to note that pita bread isn't vegan, but this was so good).

LGBTQ sandwich ($9.95): housemade bacon jam, maple-glazed bacon, mixed greens, tomato, cucumber, basil aioli, lemon vinaigrette on ciabatta bread.
Obviously not vegetarian. Comes with a small mixed green salad with vinaigrette as well. So freakin' bomb. The right amount of salty from the bacon without being overwhelming. Balanced out perfectly by the cucumber and tomato. Bacon was NOT greasy and complemented the veggies amazingly. And for Jesus's Chrysler sake, this has bacon jam in it. Bacon jam. I wanted to cry, confess, and break down in food-heaven convulsions right then and there. 

Going to try their scones next time. Reasonably priced and way better-looking than starbucks' overpriced frozen sweets. Ranges from $1.75-$4ish. Big portions for pastries/scones/bars.

I think I found my new lunch spot. It's also a chill place to kick back and read a book or bring your laptop. I believe there is free wi-fi and a few outlets. There's a reason why this place has 5 stars and I can definitely see why. 

Checking out The Center was on my to-do list forever, and it's an absolute gem to find this awesome café here. Character, culture, and no gimmicks. The service, well-thought out fresh menu, and the options are fantastic. My favorite surprised find by far!! Next time you're in the area, you have to stop by here! One of the perfect places to grab lunch in DTLV.

One of my favorite stops in Las Vegas.  The cold pressed coffee and vegan treats are out of this world. My favorite is the Davids special or the trial vegucated sandwich. The lemon vin that puy on everything is insanely good.

I'm so glad that the LGBTQ Center made the move to their new digs or else Bronze Cafe wouldn't have been possible! I have been a part of the Center through volunteer programs and trainings and after a few times in the place I realized I needed to try the food that the cafe had to offer. 

I tried the beet salad which was delicious, very fresh and flavorful which made me so sad when my little plate was empty. With the salad I tried the LGBTQ sandwich which is such a great play on the well-known favorite, BLT. Unfortunately, this sandwich at the cafe has now and forever ruined my BLT experience! I loved it too much and I'm pretty sure not even Pinterest can cure the cravings! I'll just have to settle for trying again some time, but I don't want to miss out on all the other delicious things the cafe has to offer. What made this sandwich particularly delicious was the maple bacon jam...SERIOUSLY! Maple Bacon Jam. Amazing, enough said. All their ingredients are so fresh and they damn well feel like they are made with love.

The cafe also provides so many vegan and vegetarian options which I believe is so hard to find when surrounded by meat-eater locations. The next time I'm there I really wanna try the Tree of Life Pita (I've heard great things about it) and maybe some of their slow drip iced coffee. Oh, and they have desserts! Vegan cheesecakes, cookies and cakes! There's just so many things I want to try there and the best part is that I leave without feeling like I just ate a ton of fried bar food that will be killing me later. Their food and especially their fun fruit water drinks are so health conscious and yummy that you can't go wrong. 

Give the Bronze Cafe a try!
The Bizness Salad is the way to go! Curried Quinoa, Broccoli, and Brussels Sprouts all day! I love everything at Bronze Cafe.

My new favorite health/ vegan food spot. I live down the street so I'll be eating here alot ! I had the green goddess chicken salad sandwich and it was delicious. My drink was the matcha superconducting blend. Bomb.com.
I've been back several times to try the other vegan options. All awesome. Also Norton gave incredible service... Thank you!!
Yummmmm, great service and delicious vegan Sammie's! Groupon made it affordable, love the pastries esp the brownie, so good couldn't take a pic lol

Coffee, service and sandwiches are all on point!
*Bathrooms are gender neutral,*
 this was my first experience with one, caught me a bit off guard but obviously they are perfectly fine and clean!
WiFi is hit or miss until march when they update their system

This is my most frequented place to eat or drink! I have there excellent iced coffee at least 5 days a week along with the blueberry boy bait, which I call blue boy! I'm always greeted with warmth and sincerity! The food is incredible! The business with crispy bacon, lentils and chick peas is my #1 item. If I'm feeling like being carb friendly I get the LGBTQ! That sandwich is a masterpiece! Thanks David and Peter for opening an authentically friendly, healthy and delicious spot!!!

I'd heard so many great things about The Bronze Cafe, I had high expectations for my first visit. I was not disappointed. 

Each of the fresh water/juices I sampled was delicious as refreshing. I choose the watermelon with chia seeds - healthy and tasty. For my lunch I had the Good Earth pita sandwich - again, healthy, very tasty, and filling. For dessert (I had to) the matcha green tea vegan cheesecake was flavorful, lighter than regular cheesecake, and not too sweet. 

I would gladly eat here regularly.

Holy Mackerel!

Listen, just go there and order the 'Business' salad or whatever it's called. Avocado, massaged kale, hemp seeds, quinoa, etc. It's amazing. Heaven in a box is what they should have called it. 

The cafe also has a great staff. Friendly, attentive and quick. 

Don't forget the tip jar!

Hands down Bronze Café is one of my favorite places in town.  This wonderful café is nestled in The Gay & Lesbian Community Center of Southern Nevada (The Center) on Maryland Parkway.  The café is a small part of The Center, but supports and furthers the mission of the space so well: "[The Center]...promotes activities directed at furthering the well-being, positive image, and human rights of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer community, its allies..." 

This café focuses on fresh and wholesome ingredients with an emphasis on minimal animal protein through a wealth of vegan offerings. The emphasis on whole foods and vegetables speaks directly to The Center's focus on the "well-being" of the LGBTQ community and its allies. In the past few years more establishments that focus on vegan fare have been becoming popular in the valley. And this place is certainly a fan favorite. There are always lines during lunch and the dessert options are limited later in the evening, but those are my only two negative observations. Not complaints. Who can complain about flavorful and varied food options that do not include meat? 

And, make no mistake, the food is delicious. The thing that stands out to me about the many selections I've tried is that they are so well seasoned. These favorites include: the bizness, tree of life, beet salad, Brussels sprouts, hummus, and tonight, the tofurky sandwich. Many of my favorite dishes tend toward a bright citrusy flavor profile and that makes me happy. They just know how to work with textures and flavors and quality ingredients to make simple food sing.  The sandwiches are prepared with high-quality bread and there is a wealth of vegetables--either on or accompanying--the sandwich options I have eaten (see above) or eaten. 

It's a café, but it's also a place that people are willing to go out of their way to visit on a regular basis because everything about this place feeds them. I want to eat well, but when I can do it in an environment that is community-centered and positive, it is a pleasure.  The Center and Bronze Café honor the communities they serve. The Center continues to be one of my favorite places in the Valley. In part because someone had the foresight to create an eating space that feels like the best parts of Vegas.  For my money, it is what so many other places in this town strive for.  I am so much less interested in "hipster" and "modern" than I am in community advocacy, delicious vegan fare, and free HIV testing. I could not be a bigger fan.
Great service, fantastic/ unique food!! Best oatmeal ever, and the Bizness is delicious!!
This place has amazing food! And great coffee (which is a plus for me). Plus, they have books at your disposal to enjoy. The ambience is laid back and perfect for a lazy Sunday.

The gem of Downtown Las Vegas' food scene, Bronze Cafe is my go-to over and over. For first timers, I would recommend the 'What What' sandwich, Kale-Apple-Banana smoothie, and the roasted pepper hummus. 

A MUST TRY in Las Vegas.

OK, I get what all the hype is about.  I really enjoyed my lunch, everyone was very friendly.  It is so nice to just have what seems like a healthy meal option that is well made and perfectly seasoned.  I will have to try some of the other options.

This place is a gem. Hubby and I recently tried it for the first time with a couple friends. We were really impressed with the food. Plenty of healthy, vegetarian-friendly choices. We shared the Tree of Life sandwich and the beet salad, along with a coconut almond blended drink. All were delicious. The prices are decent, especially for the quality of the food. Someone who worked there came to our table with several samples of goodies. You just can't beat that kind of service. Our side of town badly needs more places like this. We definitely plan on becoming regulars here.
Bronze Cafe is a healthy and delicious choice for a quick lunch in the downtown area.  The food is extremely fresh and very well made.  The Tree of Life is one of the best sandwiches I have ever had!

I wish I could give it 4.5 stars because that's what I want to give because I really liked this place. The food is interesting and their fruit juices hit the spot. The staff is overly friendly, which isn't a bad thing in the slightest. It's just a little expensive and not in the greatest area of town. BUT, the food is made up of really great quality vegetables, so the price point can be expected. If I'm in the area again, I'll surely be back.
Just get 'David's Special' and all will be well in the world. They have free delivery over $30, so living in Vegas we sometimes order a bunch for the week. Healthy and tasty. Nom nom...

Next time you go in, ask for the guac and mole. It's literally the best sandwich I've had in Vegas. The Center itself has a nice atmosphere and the restrooms are actually gender free which is pretty cool! Customer Service is over the top and will most likely leave you a smile on your face when you're done ordering.

I got The What What sandwich and not only was it tasty everything was also fresh,  the ciabata bread was soft and crunchy on the outside.  I also got the pineapple with chia fruit juice and it was  really refreshing. To top it all off the customer service was excellent they are friendly, cheerful,  and welcoming.  A place to come to since the place has a great atmosphere. I plan to go again for lunch since I am in the area for a training seminar. Thank you everyone for the reviews since I got to find this hidden gem.

Absolutely love this place!!!!

Biz salad, almond blend and vegucated order are too die for!!!

I have to confess: I hated Vegas. I like urban tourism, visiting big cities, enjoying everything, even I preffer nature, I love cities. But not Vegas. It's not for me. I didn't feel comfortable at any place, but then... I found this café thanks to Yelp :) 

It's strange the first time you got there because it seems you're entering a hospital or similar. But trust me: go inside. You will find a place to eat very healthy tasty food, even veggie and vegan; delete with handmade refreshing drinks and coffee which tastes like real coffee! ;)

People there are super nice, they treat you like if you were at home with some friends. We knew by asking them that the center was to support and help lesbian, gays, bisexual, transexual and, actually, every single person who needs help. The work they do there is amazing, with a lot of love and care. With your visit, you're supporting the cause too, let's go :)
Went this morning had the best sandwich ever! The flavors were sensational then had a hot strawberry tart cookie that honestly was the best sweet I've ever eaten! Don't miss it lovely!!
Delicious pita sandwich, amazing desserts and plenty of clearly labeled vegan options! Lots of free parking.
LOVE the David Special and the cold brew coffee!! Nice staff!

We were driving near downtown Vegas looking for more new vegan places to try and we found the Bronze Cafe on the Happy Cow app. Located in The Center its a small cafe with a variety of vegan and non vegan items. We had the bacon chicken chop chop salad and the vegan guac & mole with a just to good for you smoothie. The salad was fresh and tasty perfect on a hot day. The Guac & Mole was so good my boyfriend didn't stop eating till it was done. The smoothie was light and healthy treat. We also had a sample of the soup of the day that was Moraccan Lentil, it was so much better than I thought it would be ( I'm not a huge fan of lentils) its perfect for a cool night out. The staff is friendly and sweet, everyone had a smile. The Center is a great place to hang out. Its a must stop for everyone.

When I first arrived at the address I was a little confused as it was the LGBT center. I reality cafe was located inside the center. The food is amazing especially the Tree of Life and the chicken salad sandwich. They have a good selection of salads and sandwiches not to mean lot of cool desserts. Service was very friendly and quick. Thee is plenty of seating, cool music free Wi-Fi and the friendly people in the LGBT center. I definitely recommend this place especially for vegetarians.

We were searching for an amazing salad and sandwich place in Vegas and we found it! We ordered the bacon chop chop salad and it was so huge and filling, with lots of delicious nuggets of flavor throughout. She ordered an extra side of croutons that are torn pieces and packed with tons of flavor and a little kick. I ordered the what what sandwich. The combo of turkey and pepperoni with the greens and basil aioli was so delicious. And top it off with this ciabatta bread that's crispy on the outside and soft and tender on the inside. He got the Miss Piggy sandwich, which was a chicken salad with bacon and green goddess dressing, basil aioli and lemon vinaigrette. Unbelievable combination of flavors. I tried a hot tea - maple apple cider. It was delicious. I highly recommend trying this cafe.

My husband and I visit Bronze Cafe at least once a week.  My very favorite thing they have there is the LGBTQ Sandwich (house made bacon JAM!!!, maple-glazed bacon, mixed greens, tomato, cucumber, basil aioli, lemon vinaigrette, ciabatta).  My husband's favorite sandwich is the Green Goddess Chicken Salad Sandwich (house made chicken salad with diced apples, mixed greens, tomato, red onion, basil aioli, lemon vinaigrette, ciabatta).  Both are absolutely amazing!  Lately, we've both been getting the Bacon Chicken Chop Chop Salad (Gluten Free, Romaine lettuce, chicken, bacon, tomato, cucumber, house made buttermilk ranch dressing)!  It is also wonderful.  No matter what we have to eat, we always get a couple of Vegan Kale Apple Banana Blended smoothies (Gluten free, vegan. Kale, banana, apple, house made vanilla almond milk).  Perfect beverage/dessert to cap off our always perfect meals!

Service slow did I say 
S  L. O. W.
Food had better
Pricey for mostly prepackaged.
It's located in the center. The center staff should give the bronze cafe staff training on engaging guest. They are very nice.
Will go back to the center.
Won't support café.

Bronze Cafe is a treat in the desert of Las Vegas. The food and service are spectacular. Healthy, friendly, lovely place. I went with my family of 7, and everyone was able to get what they wanted from bacon to vegan. I won big points with my family finding this gem. My only suggestion for improvement is to have real plates and eating utensils rather than paper and plastic.

Ordered delivery. Website says $3 delivery fee, they charged $8. Salad is very small, veggies are frozen, taste bad. Cucumbers with hummus: Cucumbers are also frozen. Very disappointed. Will not order from Bronze Cafe again.

Honestly what can you possibly complain about? This cafe is in the LGBTQ community center, so there's plenty of people always hanging out in the library or on the computers. There's an area of tables dedicated to the cafe so you can chill and eat their goodies. 
The menu is perfect if you're trying to eat cleaner, healthier. They have fruit juices, vegan options, salads, sammies, smoothies, desserts. The complicated order is by far the best sandwich & the vinaigrette on their side salads are TO DIE FOR mmmm
Everyone is super friendly, I highly recommend. Whether you're apart of the LGBTQ community or not, it's so welcoming.

Nestled inside The Center, which serves the LGBTQ community here in Vegas, is this gem of a restaurant, which serves everyone a healthy and tasty meal. We stopped in for a bite this afternoon, and I left feeling full and refreshed.

My husband ordered the LGBTQ sandwich, which is one of the best sandwiches I have ever eaten. LEMON vinaigrette, mixed GREENS, BACON jam, TOMATO, and Q-CUMBER on ciabatta. You can't go wrong with that!

I would have ordered the same thing (and I will next time I go), but I wanted to try something else, so I ordered the The Bizness, which is a kale salad topped with your choice of three items. I got the brussel sprouts, beet/quinoa, and spiced chickpeas. This was one tasty salad, don't get me wrong, but after having a bite of the LGBTQ, all I could do was stare longingly at it while I munched on my veggies.

Each of our choices was $9.95, which seems a little pricey for my salad but is a steal for the LGBTQ. We'll be back!

I love love LOVE this place. I only go for the vegan options, but I've never eaten anything I didn't LOVE here. I crave the Tree of life daily, and The Good Earth is a great sandwich when I feel like I need to mix it up. The sides are all pretty great, but my fave is the agrodolce Brussels sprouts. Of course, no trip down is complete without one of their amazing coffees or a fresh brewed tea and a treat. 
The treats... Where do I start? Our family's fave is the Strawberry cookie, but the boy baits all are totally amazing as well. The raw cheesecakes are also excellent, and the flavors seem to change weekly. 
Finally, the staff is incredible and the atmosphere is comfortable. I bring my 6yo down with me and she always enjoys herself. 
So, fresh ingredients, delicious recipes, great service, and comfortable atmosphere does in fact equal 5 stars!

Are you heading down yet?

Where to start? It's located in a secluded strip mall type building (very nice tho) in nearly North Vegas. It is also a LBGTQA community center so the cafe type seating is an open area with computers on the wall and a kiosk near the entrance. Can't believe this little cafe type place puts out such magnificent good and drinks! 

Got the complicated order, the Thai peanut salad soup of the day which was coconut curry, a Strawberry lemongrass Chai water (Freshly squeezed) and a Ghirardelli Mocha Frap. With the Groupon I paid just over $32 and saved 8 bucks, hey that's gambling money ;) The fruit waters are made fresh daily and 

To the food: Mine was the Complicated order, practically a fresh tossed salad, fresh turkey, bacon, bacon bits and guac all on a freshly made Chibatta bun crispy on the outside fresh on the in. The sandwich was ginormous.. but most of all just straight bomb. Com took about 5 mins from order to table, and from the begging the servers were over the top courteous and kind! And my mocha, forget about it put of this world!! No need to even ask for no whip they know not to disrespect you that way ;) This is seriously a Vegas gem! Our first stop on the trip and won't be the last time we visit!!
WOW! Beyond impress with its service! Who knew a small little cafe would have the best service and food! First time customer tried the turkey California and loved it! Sure will return to this cafe.

The Bronze Cafe at The Center is a great find in downtown Las Vegas.  There are only so many options in the downtown area and this is a great addition.  The cafe is located in the LGBTQ Center but is a little difficult to find on the first visit.  There is a parking lot on the side and in the front of the building.  You'll want to in the landscaped entrance.  Once you enter you'll be in a library area and the cafe will be right in front of you.  There are a few small tables and one large table where it is community seating.  

The cafe itself is small but they are quick and able to serve a lot of people.  The day I went they were busy but we made it there and back within our lunch hour.  

I had the The California Turkey Sandwich ($8.95) (turkey breast, avocado, mixed greens, tomato, red onion, basil aioli, lemon vinaigrette, Ciabatta).  I am not exactly an adventurous eater but the combination of flavors was delicious!!!  The lemon vinaigrette added a nice kick to sandwich without taking away from the avocado and tomato.  I was on a healthy eating kick at the time and the staff was nice enough to give me water with free refills :)  I know it is just a little thing but some of the others at my table had purchased bottled water so I appreciated the effort.

Two words... Refreshingly delicious! I've been here a few times with my mother an have left feeling so satisfied and looking forward to my next visit. Definitely recommend this place if you haven't already tried it.

Located inside the LGBTQ center, so don't look for a sign outside! There was a lot of sitting but small tables, not quite big enough for both my computer and my books to study (which is why I came). There were a lot of younger people there (student's?) talking among themselves so bring headphones if it disrupts your focus.  I didn't stay long and had I, I might have given them a further look over. The Barista's were helpful and really fast to make the drinks, I had ordered a iced Chai Latte drink and it was overly milky for me and a tad bit on the sweet side. Next time I'll try it hot and possibly with a shot (dirty Chai).

Came here while in town and loved it! Had the Tree of Life pita, a mint pineapple chia juice and a vegan cookie and loved it all! Very friendly staff in a cute building. My friends all loved their food as well, including coffee, pastries and hummus.

Today a bunch of came here for lunch and everyone at the table was absolutely satisfied with their meal. I got the complicated sandwich and that was AMAZING! I love the bacon jam! I was wanting chips with my sandwich however they served a salad with the sandwich. Let me just say that the salad was soooo good. Kind of pricey but definitely worth the money. I can't wait to try some of the other things on their menu.

I love coming here for lunch. Everyone is friendly and the food is always good. I usually get "the bizzness" it's basically a salad with a base of kale. You can add 3 more ingredients/toppings. The food is always fresh and you get a good amount of food. If your ever in the area try it. There's a lot of vegan choices on the menu.

Hidden gem! You wouldn't find this place if you weren't looking for it (it's inside The Center--dont let that deter you!), and it is all sorts of awesome! The samdwiches were very filling -- the Tree of Life pita was delicious (roasted red peppers, avocado, cashew cream, greens) and the BF loved the Complicated sandwich (bacon jam, turkey). Their dirty chai hit the spot and they have yummy looking baked goods. So lots of healthy and less-than-healthy options ;) Will definitely go back if I'm in the area!

I was craving the vegan roasted vegetable pita again...LOL!

AND!!!!!!!!!  
I got my hug from Chef Peter!

I got a soy blended green matcha which was AWESOME. Hubby had the Tree of Life which was super duper good.

Chef let us try an array of raw "cheesecakes" and the strawberry one was my fav. Soooooooo good. 

We got a side of my fav golden beet quinoa salad. This food is amazing. 

GO THERE NOW :D
Carnegie deli has nothing on them! And yes they have gluten-free bread for their amazing sandwiches, and they have amazing  salads that taste super fresh! Awesome coffee too!

FREE PARKING DOWNTOWN!

Vegan, Raw Vegan, Gluten Free options available.  Carnivores, like me, can add chicken breast or turkey to veggie sandwiches and salads and there are turkey clubs & BLTs and the like available too.  The Asian Marinated Kale Salad with Grilled Chicken and the Curried Quinoa Salad are my favorites.

FREE PARKING DOWNTOWN!

The deserts are amazing and inventive; vegan strawberry cookies & hot chocolate and marshmallow cookies just to give you an idea...

FREE PARKING DOWNTOWN!

The coffee bar puts others to same.  Delicious coffee and tea options, hot and cold.  Oh, and smoothies!

FREE PARKING DOWNTOWN!

Five four top tables for outside seating and five four top tables inside and plenty of sofa seating to stay and enjoy your meal or just as easy to take away if needed.

You'll be hard pressed to find a more welcoming environment downtown or in all of Las Vegas for that matter.  Chef Peter and David succeed making a connection to everyone they meet.  They will take the time to answer questions you may have about the menu and ingredients that may be unfamiliar.  

And in case you missed it, FREE PARKING DOWNTOWN.  I hate it when I'm going to Le Thai or EAT and I finally find a parking spot just to discover I have no change for the meters.  Happy to say that will never happen here.  

Bronze Cafe is located inside the Gay and Lesbian Community Center of Southern Nevada.  The Center is a new state of the art facility serving the ENTIRE community and all are encouraged to visit.

Great food, amazing Vegetarian and Vegan options, and the people working here are quite kind and seem happy. Service is AMAZING! So many vegan, GF, and vegetarian options! 

To improve the menu, add some romaine or red or green leaf lettuce to some of the menu items so it's not all the same salad mix & dressing on most items. The salad mix used is high quality but the same mix is used for the side salads and the veggie sandwiches. So when you order one of their amazing veg sandwiches like "Tree of Life," it is topped with all the same salad greens & same dressing that fill the plate next to it. Also, add a nutritious mocha smoothie option. Competitor G&Proteins has an good one with coffee and dark chocolate and greens that you guys could totally improve upon. 

To improve the ordering process for customers, bring back the labels on the backed goods / desserts. Labels have been gone for a long time now and so you have to ask about each one of the items since they aren't on the menu. I feel bad for the employees and for the people behind me if there's a line. It's hard enough to pick a dessert from a case without looking at all these amazing options and not knowing anything about them.

To improve customer satisfaction, bring back the teacher discount you offered for years!

This is hands down my favorite cafe in town: I come here multiple times for every Vegas visit.

The food is fresh, nutritious and a delicious break from your typical Vegas food options. My personal favorite is the baconlicious Complicated Order and the Just Too Good For You kale smoothie. They also have cold brew coffee on tap and fresh french press coffee.

The ambiance is always very chill and there's bookshelves right next to the eating area if you need entertainment with your coffee.

Staff here have always been friendly and prompt as well as genuinely seeming to enjoy working there. 

In short, this place is like a little piece of my native SF Bay Area transported into the middle of the desert. I heart them.

The Bronze Cafe is definitely worth a visit. There isn't a big sign for the cafe so we drove past it but once we found the Center it was located right by the door. The menu is mostly vegan, but there are items that include chicken and turkey. We tried the Guac & Mole sand which, which they were kind enough to offer to split into two plates, and the sandwich came with a salad. Half a sandwich plus the salad were plenty for me. The lemon vinagrette was a very nice touch and the sandwich was delicious. 

I also ordered the Raw Vegan Superfood blender. You can have either have it with cacao powder or matcha green tea but they suggested the cacao since it was my first time. It was freaking delicious. Perfect blend of banana, almond milk, and avocado. Loved it. I couldn't leave without trying a cheese cake so I also bought the banana split cheese cake. I loved that as well. 

This place was pretty good, the prices are affordable and the staff was super friendly. I'm a fan.
Vegucated Sandwich, Coconut Curry Corn Soup, Rainbow Rice Crispy Treat, Supercalabazalisticexpialidocho Shake. 100% vegan. 100% amazing!

I ate here today and I was more than satisfied as usual. I'm vegan and I've tried everything vegan on the menu. It is always fresh and made to order. I love the California Tofurkey and the fresh soup of the day. I will keep coming back for more. Their desserts are made from local bakeries and include gluten free and vegan options. Thanks for the great food and friendly service !!
OH MY!  The best food I ever had.  It was sooo healthy and delicious.  I wish I could eat like this everyday but would be a expensive habit.  LOL!
This place rocks!! Everything was incredible, and they have food for vegans and their non-vegan friends! The tree of life pita was definitely a good first time choice. And they give you samples :)

Why have I never Yelped about Bronze Cafe before? It's the perfect place to get a satisfying meal that you won't feel guilty about. Everything I've ever had here is amazing. My go-to is the Tree of Life pita. The menu isn't strictly vegan, but there are many Vegan delights...including from the expansive bakery case and smoothy menu. The staff behind the counter is great and the tables in the lobby of The Center are comfortable.

We came here for an early lunch. Hubby had a buy one get one free. We almost missed this place because it is located inside a business. 

Hubby ordered me a strawberry lemon grass basil drink. It was pretty good but there was no sugar in it which is healthy for me. He also got me a California turkey sandwich with a salad. The bread on the sandwich was crunchy and fresh. Inside was turkey, avocado and lots of lettuce which included spinach. Every bite was good. Fresh ingredients inside every bite. Sandwich was good. Everything we got was pretty expensive. You get what you pay for. With the coupon, it still totaled to $27. Still not bad since everything was fresh and tasty. 

There was table service. The guy brings out your sandwiches. After we were done eating, the nice lady took away our plates. They were disposable plates and we were given plastic forks. Nice and friendly people here. I would definitely come back to try other sandwiches.

I love it here !!!! "The bizness" comes with kale massaged with lemon , roasted beets, quinoa, curried quinoa , spiced chick peas avocado and hemp seeds !!! And have a large selection of natural fruit juices ! Yayyyyyyy

After patronizing this place for over a year now, I must admit that it kinda kills me to assign 4 stars to Bronze.  So much so that I've been I've been putting off writing this review for months!  My heart says "5 stars!!!," while my yelp-reviewing objective-lawyer-brain says "3...."  Accordingly, I shall split the baby and hope that I can one day soon update this review to a full 5.

Heart:  The food is great and, importantly, has integrity.  Order one of the fantastic sandwiches or--if you're looking for a feel-good (or rather, feel-even-better) option, order the Sandwich as a Salad (better yet as a KALE salad!).  In fact, you will feel good about your meal here in almost every way, once you get it (caveat: see below).  Chef Peter is a talented and committed cook as well as a natural host with an earnest, caring demeanor.  The other staff are mostly friendly and entirely welcoming.  I have recommended this place to many colleagues, brought more than a few for lunch, and created some Bronze die-hards along the way.

Head:  Ugh, the wait.  Some of this is due to expectations:  the café setting leads one to anticipate that you can grab a quick to-go order or have a brief lunch while on break from your downtown office.  That is sometimes, but not always, possible (aside from "grabbing" a pre-made item, of course).   I have waited upwards of 20 minutes for a to-go order.  Nevertheless, the food is so good (and I feel so good patronizing a local small business), that I simply build in the possibility of a 20-minute wait into my lunch trip if Bronze is involved.  However, when the wait is supplemented by receiving the wrong order, it is frankly dispiriting...  Just yesterday, the BF--who orders along with his entire small law office--did not receive his order.  Then, when they brought it after being notified, it was incomplete :/

All that said, I will keep going back and keep recommending it to others, just with the caveat that you give yourself plenty of time and check your order before you leave.
