Overall this place is awesome! It's a small cafe but I wouldn't be surprised if they open in a space of their own soon! 

Also the service was spectacular! Thanks Carmen!!!
The food is good and the owners are amazing. Try the cookie centered brownie, it will make any bad day good

Have been wanting to try it out for a long time and happened to finally be in the area today. This place is sooooo good. Got the tree of life pita and it was amazing. My mother got the beet salad and was impressed by it as well. She also got a chai latte and it was delicious! Yummmm, will be back.

I work pretty close to the center so I decided to finally grab a to-go lunch from Bronze Cafe. I ordered the Tree of Life Pita which was flavorful, fresh, clean, and satisfying. I have been thinking about it for two whole days. I can eat that everyday for lunch. 

The employees seemed friendly and I thought it was extra cute how each time my name was called, the guy handling my order got closer and closer to the correct pronunciation. *highfive*

Seriously some of the best food in Vegas and everyone who works there is amazing...   Stop in and check it out...  It's becoming a once a week must have and having incredibly healthy tasty food is so worth it...

Food. Baby. Not kidding. I was surprised at the location, and then when I walked in, I was surprised because it has a kiosk look to it with food in to-go packaging in a case in front of it. I knew from Yelp, though, that they had excellent offerings. There were tons and tons of open tables (Saturday morning at 11:30am ish) But where is the kitchen? Who cares. We ordered the David's Special salads. The crew working were smiley, sweet, helpful, patient. It was more food than you can imagine and so incredibly delicious. I loved that the avocado was creamy and plentiful. Then we had vegan gluten free cheesecake. Then we had mint chocolate cookie balls of deliciousness. Then we had coffee. Now we need a nap. I literally have no idea how the Ikea photo got on my review. Sorry!

As someone who doesn't eat animal products, this place is a dream come true. 

If I lived closer to the Bronze Café I literally would go every day. The tree of life sandwich and the chocolate chip cookies are amazing. I can't review any other items - I haven't ordered anything else... I can't get past these two. 

Add to the delicious food the fact that the staff is the friendliest in town and I have found my favorite place to eat.

The cafe gave me flashbacks to my college days with all the books, couches, and computers. 
The cafe has many healthy options to chose from: salad, sandwiches, soups, deserts, and drinks. 
The staff was friendly and pleasant.
I had a sandwich and green drink. I just wasn't blown away enough by either to justify the price. A sandwich for 10$ better be one of the best I've ever had. It was good, but not great.

Cool little area outside. This was the only place in the area that seemed to have healthy food while was traveling through.  The kale smoothie was good, whatever food I had was pretty decent, the vegan cheesecake was disgusting and melted into a puddle.  It appeared to be an internet cafe too if you're looking for that.

I love the food at Bronze Cafe. I have been here a couple times and tried a couple of their sandwiches and they were delicious. The food taste very fresh and healthy. Luckily the great food makes up for the horrible location. There are plenty options if you are a vegetarian, vegan, or have a  gluten free diet.  I highly recommend this place!
The turkey sandwich was good but not worth the price at all... The watermelon drink was horrible!!!! Not impressed with this place at all... Waste of money

Any time I've had a scone elsewhere I've hated it, but the scones here are actually really excellent.  This is like top-notch bakery in an unexpected venue.  Nice sit-down area, kind of like a library, and quiet.

Amazing, love that the bread is vegan as well, was skeptical about that at first, but They confirmed that for me that made me come back for another one the following week! Kind of stingy on the sauce for the salad, but overall, a great vegan sandwich.
Love the Bizzness salad w Chicken, Avo, and Sweet Potato. Green goddess chicken salad also a favorite.

I have yet to have a bad experience here. Peter, you are amazing and this is my favorite cafe in Vegas. Thank you for making it so easy for me to eat here... You are beyond accommodating with my vegan needs and everything always tastes so good.

It's located on Maryland parkway and Charleston. It's pretty tiny but full of delicious food. The pastry case is always stocked with vegan and non vegan options. *the zucchini banana chocolate muffin is so ridiculously good!!! Ask them to warm it for you and it practically melts in your mouth. The "cheesecakes" have never ever disappointed. The blueberry is fabulous! Never tastes artificial and the crust is perfectly crisp! The coffee has never disappointed, made hot and fresh, and always smooth. The melon waters... The turmeric and canteloupe is by far my favorite... It is a perfect summer beverage. 

The smoothies... We've tried the cocoa super food (smooth and delicious and hearty) and the coconut almond (light, slightly sweet, and thirst quenching) I would recommend either after a lifting session or yoga. Both are full of nutrients and electrolytes. 

The sandwiches... So far we have tried the good earth pita (stocked with veggies and full vegan goodness)  and the tree of life pita (our fav) very hearty and the dressing was out of this world!! 

The salads... The Thai peanut was surprisingly very very good! I wasn't expecting it to be as savory as it was and textures all blended surprisingly well. It was a day we split the salad and a pita and we were both very very full and satisfied. THE BIZZNESS, is exactly that, the business! We always try different options. You get to choose three options over chopped kale in a perfect lemon vinaigrette. So far we have tried the hummus, the babagonoosh, roasted beet and quinoa, Brussels sprouts, sweet potatoes, spiced chickpeas, avocado... I think you get the Idea (so many options)! It's always a go to For us and is always delicious. 

Their soups are insane. The split pea and lentil are two of my favorites. I would recommend checking out their face book daily to see what the days options are. They also had a vegan tamale that was put of this world. My boyfriend said it was the best tamale he has ever eaten. If you see one make sure to grab it.

I have yet to be disappointed after the 20+ times we have eaten here. I think it's safe to say, if you haven't tried this place, you need to. It caters to vegans and non vegans alike and I guarantee you, it will not disappoint!

Loved Bronze Cafe!! My boyfriend and I recently went on a Vegan health kick, and its not easy to find Vegan food in Vegas. Bronze Cafe is located in some place called "The Center," so you might pass by it the first drive by, but its worth the U-turn, so turn around and go inside!! I had some amazing Vegan sweets, which are so hard to find! Great butternut squash soup and the mole sandwich! The three guys working the counter were super sweet and very friendly! Can't wait to go back!

Stopped in on our drive through Vegas. Well worth the detour. Everything was fresh, tasty and the service was amazing -  warm, courteous and efficient. The curry and corn soup was to die for along with the LGBTQ sandwich. My friends had The Complicated Order sandwich, very impressive. And last, my friend with peanut allergies happily ordered The Guac and Mole sandwich. All the baked goods looked delicious but we were way too full to indulge any further. Next time I'm around, I'll definitely be stopping by! Edit: we couldn't resist the baked goods. We are weak. Tried the chocolate and zucchini muffin, which they happily warmed up for us. *drool. The mint chocolate chip cookie was gone in seconds.

We just ordered for delivery. Fantastic phone experience.  Love the vegan menu. Can't wait for our dinner to arrive. Stay tuned.

Well, dinner arrived and it was absolutely delicious.  The vegan chocolate cheesecake is out of this world.  You've got to try this place. Awesome just doesn't quite capture it.

Wonderful place.  The staff was very friendly.  My friend Carl received a free drink for his birthday.  I had the watermelon chia which was DELICIOUS as well as the Tree of Life pita.  Both Vegan!  Great place...I highly recommend it!

Located within a beautiful, clean complex where they support the LGBTQ community, there is what looks like a corner café with a cold case full of salads, a very interesting contraption to make ice brewed coffee, and a small staff. There are a few tables and chairs where you can take your food after you order. Let me say - the food was great. Beyond great. We went back twice, and even got food to go for our trip home. The kids that were working were charming, smiling, friendly, helpful - everything I like in a place. 

There is an amazing tapestry of the city of Las Vegas on the wall. It took three years to weave. It is worth seeing, while you enjoy your delicious " whatever you order. " We had a good earth  pita, hummus, coffee, latte, cookies, muffins - we went several times. Loved it, and cannot wait to go back.

Know that they have a gender neutral bathroom. Anyone can use it. It was pristine clean, private, and I felt perfectly safe in there.

Ordered pick up here for the first time last night. The man on the phone was a very nice and helpful. I ordered the "whoop whoop" and my boyfriend ordered "little miss piggy". We were both pleasantly surprised :-) My sandwich was cute, simple, and delicious. Both sandwiches were a little small, if there was another solid ingredient it would've made for a whole meal, but I had to put some chips on the side when I got home. Other than that no complaints, definitely will be visiting again.

This place is amazing,  the bizness Davids special is the best salad I have had this whole year! The closest thing I can compare it to is like when you go to whole foods and make your own food bowl and mix different types of grains. The almond milk they make here is by far the richest I have ever had.  I ordered a latte with almond milk best thing! I'm a pescaterian and this place is the place to go in Vegas.

I've been getting Bronze Cafe for a while now because they deliver and have excellent sandwiches. But lately they've been messing up on my orders. Today I ordered and PAYED for a large green tea smoothie. I, instead got a small, melted and unblended green tea drink. Hoping in the future this will no longer happen!
Love it here! Amazing vegetarian food and healthy delicious options :) great for both meat eaters & vegetarians

The first time I came here I ordered the bizness salad with brussel sprouts, roasted chicken and curried quinoa. I liked every element except for the brussel sprouts. They were both bitter and too hard to eat. The curried quinoa while dry had a good flavor. No complaints with the roasted chicken, it was how chicken should be. I was also surprised at how generous the portions were. 

Now after living in LV for 4 months Bronze Cafe is the restaurant I visit most frequently because of the fresh/high quality ingredients. 

Last time I visited, I tried one of their homemade desserts. I chose the peanut butter snickerdoodle cookie, it was hard as a rock and had more of a consistency to that of a shortbread cookie. I could barely make out any cinnamon sugar and the peanut butter was also an after thought.
This place is very good for a healthy option, food can be a bit pricey.  But delicious.  Kale salad is AMAZING!  I love getting this to- go for meetings and parties.
Absolutely awesome. it was quick. It was delicious. Two unfortunate things...smoothies underwhelming and hardly any gluten free options. But the sandwiches and service were killer.

Let me begin with the warm welcome- how inviting! The Bronze Cafe is inside a center so for out of towners a bit deceiving but if you enjoy healthy versus the regular grind it is such a great find! I adored my Green Goddess Chicken Salad on a fresh Ciabatta with a fresh salad. The "Bizness" was my hubby's choice and it rocked with fresh Kale salad topped with 3 organic sides. He loved the roasted broccoli, Brussel sprouts and spiced Chic Peas! We both ordered this awesome super healthy drink that was phenomenal but a meal in itself - don't miss Bronze if you are seeking fresh and organic in Vegas with great vegan and vegetarian choices! Kudos for great service even though it is counter order we were checked on no less than 5 times at the table.

First of all, this place is not a good value at all. The food is overpriced for the portions. Granted, it is good quality food, but it is still overpriced. The coffee is terrible. I so wanted to love this place, but I can't say I do.

If you're one who is health conscience and worries about what you put into your body, or if you wanted to care about what you put into your body but were afraid to ask what, then make a stop to the Bronze Café.  Chef Peter and partner David have been feverishly working on opening just the right place to launch their healthy, gluten-free creations to those that have been craving them.  

Their menu is pure, simple and delicious featuring natural coffee's and tea's, sandwiches, salads, and pastries all made fresh and from scratch in the trendy downtown Las Vegas.

And while you get your taste on at their location inside the new LGBT Center, soon they will open a second location in the fashionable Arts District. 

Bottom line?  It's All Good at the Bronze Café.

I have to start with saying that Bronze Cafe is exactly what I was looking for. Healthy food, excellent service, close to work and they deliver. I found out about them from a fellow yelper that told me to try it out, that it's one of the best vegan cafes in town. So the next day I pulled up the menu and called to place an order.
I decided to drive there for my first time instead of having it delivered so I could feel out the vibe of the place. Right when I got there I saw a lot of the tables full which is a good sign! I was immediately greeted by the staff there. They were so friendly and willing to make my first time experience well remembered. They offered me samples of their fruit water and also gave me a 10% discount for working in the medical field. 

I headed back to work and sat down to enjoy my lunch. I ordered the tree of life pita, the complicated order, the apricot almond bar and one of their began blueberry cheesecakes. I haven't been this impressed with an easy fix for the longest time! The flavor was unbelievable! The bacon jam, basil Aoli and the lemon vinegrette alone is enough to make anyone fall in love! The desserts were absolutely delicious and I highly recommend their fruit water even though some people might think that it's too sweet. 
I've ordered from here now two days in a row and I am probably going again today. I would rate this place more stars of it was possible. I even grabbed a handful of menus to hand out to the different departments of my work. More people need to realize the different options that are available in this town and not just go to taco bell or burger King. I love you bronze cafe!
Great food.  I love their salads and all their food is healthy.   I recommend their food and their prices are reasonable.
lOVE lOVE lOVE !! I've been eating at some really great places lately and this is definitely one of them... best sandwiches best desert cant go wrong !!
I love the fresh juices, and the vegan meals. Whats not to love!

Located in the LGBTQ center: there is an amazing variety of vegan and gluten free items!  Oatmeal is amazing.  Vegan matcha smoothie is delicious. All vegan baked goods are very good.  Try the loving ms Virginia, it's a cookie baked in top of a brownie...yep you just read that. Highly recommended as a healthy alternative to Fremont street!  Yelpers get 10% when checking in!!!!

I ate here w/ my hubby and kids and everyone absolutely loved their food. My 16 year old has an appetite, he was full. He made the comment that he felt healthy full, not the uncomfortable stuffed feeling. The service was great, everyone working was personable, knowledgeable about all the food & ingredients & really friendly. I refuse to take away a star for this since I knew I was going to a community center to eat; I just wish they had a more traditional style cafe or place to eat. I felt like we were eating in a library and it was a little uncomfortable until a table opened up. The couches are great for a coffee but not a big lunch. The food is excellent, I wish there were more tables or booths. Amazing food!!! Looking forward to picking up and taking  our lunch to go next time. Please open a second location!!!

I found this place cause I was hungry in the downtown area and wanting healthy food! The employees here are nice and willing to sample stuff a lot of vegan options and if your not vegan as well you can add chicken to anything. I got the negicios or something like that with chicken. They have fruit flavored water and healthy yummy smoothies! Reasonably priced as well

Got the Negocio. Amazing salad!! Simple, and delicious flavors married well together. I appreciate that the kale was cut into nice small bite sized strips, and the salad wasn't overly dressed with sauces. Definitely one of the better salads I've had in a long time that's actually healthy.

The tree of life pita vegan sandwich is amazing. I order it about twice a week, its so good. 

Its hard for a brand new vegan to find the "good" stuff around town, but this place makes it SO easy to order healthy and delicious food. Definitely try them out!

Just ordered from Bronze cafe again love love the food!! I like vegan cheese cake more than the regular I will order a slice of vegan cheesecake every order it's the best!!I'm not a vegan nor vegetarian but  I know good food. Their food makes me want to try vegan food for a minute. 

For the first time I tried their good life sandwich oh my what a delight and for the first time I actually like eggplant,new favorite next to my beloved tree of life sandwich and David's the bizness salad. Oh and how cool are the names by the way  clever and attention grabbing, makes you notice. 

What a hidden gem this place is,that I wish I had found sooner. They deserve  the best and I wish them much success and that they can open more cafes. 
Never stop cooking with love I can taste the work, love  and dedication to providing the best food Etc possible .and to ensuring the meal is better than the last.
Even the delivery service agent is delightful they always have a smile on their face!! Everyone is just delightful they came back to give me my other two sandwiches plus another cheesecake. Never did they get angry Etc like some places do. They made it right and was kind hearted.  

It's truly refreshing  I've only had delivery but delighted  
Delighted even the more that they will deliver to my new address !! Move aside Jason's deli, Bronze cafe is my new love, you've been moved down the list.

Long life happy costumer 
Sylvia M.

This wasn't what I was expecting. It's an Internet cafe with a large influence on gay and lesbians. I could care less about that but was hoping for more of a restaurant/deli feel. The sandwich was amazing!!!! So if anything, that made the trip. Oh and the bathroom is ALL GENDER FYI.
Good sandwich and nice young lady deliver to the LV convention center. We ordered the turkey sandwich and Ms. Piggy, both were delicious and came with some green salad. We loved it!

Tree of Life pita was delicious! Such a unique menu and friendly staff/patrons. I am addicted and will be back ASAP! I received a discount on my pita because of the time of day I went..I believe it was around 7 pm, so I received $2 off. The mini beet salad is quite tasty as well.

Vegan cookies/cakes taste better than 'normal' cookies/cakes, try them! You won't be disappointed.

*They also use square. This is great because at the bottom of your emailed receipt is  a punch card that keeps track of your purchases!

I used to come here to mooch off of their wifi before I had mine installed, and of course would order something to justify that. It's safe to say I've tried a variety of things on their menu and everything is always nothing short of amazing. The quality and quantity of food matches the price, and the staff is really friendly when assisting you with an order. Albert is my favorite because he's courteous and thoughtful. They always offer if you'd like to sample the soup of the day which is a terrific way to get you since it's always tasty! 

Yesterday I came and had the What What sandwich-- it hit the spot. In the past I've David's salad and it's enough to last me for two meals. Since this place is so close to my house, they should know they've got my business for a very long time!

I have never been to The Center, and I wish I had had the time to look around a little more. The lobby area - where you will find the Bronze Cafe - has the feel of an open library, with some computers available for use against one wall, and book shelves along a longer curved wall. I really liked the atmosphere, it made me feel like I was a little bit more cool just for having been there.

The counter guy was super friendly, and offered us a sample of their lentil soup with veggies. It was very flavorful, and actually light & refreshing, which is quite an accomplishment for a bean soup.

I really like roasted veggies, so I ordered The Good Earth, and I also got an ice-brewed coffee. The sandwich had lettuce, tomato, roasted? mushrooms, roasted eggplant, alfalfa sprouts, an orange dressing of some kind, sunflower seeds, and what tasted like candied walnuts. I love eggplant, but it really wan't cooked well enough. Cooked eggplant is kind of mushy (and delicious!), but this was still pretty firm & spongy, like it was pretty raw. All the other ingredients were fantastic, and even the candied walnuts went surprisingly well with the other ingredients. But for a roasted veggie sandwich, I also would have liked to see something other than just the eggplant & possibly mushrooms. (I am not sure if the mushrooms were actually roasted. I have not heard of such a thing, but otherwise the eggplant would have been the only roasted veggie.) The pita bread was delicious.

My friend had the Tree of Life, and she thought it was awesome.

I can't really judge the ice-brewed coffee, as I have never had it before. I had heard it was much less bitter than heat-brewed coffee and so I really wanted to try it. But it pretty much just tasted like iced coffee but not as watered down. It could be the most phenomenal ice-brewed coffee ever, but it was my first taste so I can't compare it. Personally, I will stick with regular coffee in the future.

Weird, right? I didn't like my sandwich or my drink, but I still gave it four stars. I liked the atmosphere and the service, and I just feel like I happened to order the wrong thing for me. I feel confident the next visit will be a five-star experience.

Finding it: as you drive south on Maryland (one way in this area), The Center is on your left immediately after Lewis Ave. Just turn into the first parking lot you can.

The food is off the chart and I love that they feature so much local/ regional ingredients plus a great selection of vegetarian and vegan choices.  By far the best coffee in town (ice filtered through their glass Frankenstein looking still).  David and his staff are very pleasant and like to crack jokes.  I love that the location is central and that part of the revenues are going to support our local LGBTQ community center.  
I have also held an event at The Center which was catered by Bronze Cafe and everything was delicious, particularly the exotice mixed fresh juices.  The Center has a very nice board room and several large conference spaces they rent out and they offer very good discounts to local community groups and nonprofits.

Bronze Cafe is perfect for lunch.  Whether you want soup, salad, or sandwich, the prices are fair and the food delicious.  I came and had a coupon which they honored with no problem (coupons are readily available for this restaurant) and got $5.00 off the meal.  I ordered a make-your-own quinoa salad which was heated up to perfection.  I saw a few people eating around the Cafe had sandwiches which also looked delicious.  While ordering I even got to sample some of their vegetables soup, which again was very solid.

The Bronze Cafe is located inside the LGBTQ Community Center so it's a little difficult to find  but parking is easy and once you walk into the center it's straight ahead.  This would be a perfect option for a vegetarian lunch.  But they do have ample options for the non-vegetarian as well.  Come here if you're in the area.

Had a wonderful lunch. Had the Good Earth Pita! It was out of this world good!  Lots of vegetarian, vegan and gulten free salads, sandwiches, and desserts. Friends of mine had the Complicated Order and  California Turkey both were awesome. Great coffee. and extensive tea menu. Great food, super friendly and knowledgeable staff. Will be back!

Really nice place to hang out and enjoy a meal! It was pretty hard to find though, as it wasn't advertised anywhere outside the building its in. But other than that, it was a pretty good experience.

My friend and I had trouble picking what to eat because everything looked pretty good. We ended up deciding on their special sandwich, the LGBTQ (to something close to that hah) and then had a quinoa pastry and an apricot-almond pastry and some coffees, and shared it all. Sandwich was delicious; we loved the bacon jam taste! Quinoa pastry was interesting, I mean, texture and taste I have never tried before, but something different! The apricot-almond pastry was very tasty! And coffees were good. 

We were sad we didn't try this chocolate-cononut pastry that we didn't see at first, so I guess that means we will have to go back!
The food is great I had the good earth sandwich with vegan chili. The place is clean and the staff is friendly. Food is a little pricey consideri g how good and fresh it is it's worth it.

Girls day out...lets see! The results are in... Seriously good sandwiches! LGBTQ, Turkey avocado and the tree of life... We will be back! Here is my eight-year-old daughter's review in her own words: "The food was delicious!"

I've been to the center only a handful of times but I think this place is great. Easy parking lot, which is saying a lot for downtown adjacent :) I really like that they have bike rentals in the parking lot. Very cool. The food is great. Everything tastes super fresh. My most recent visit had me ordering the cilantro chicken caesar and it was very good. Cashier asked if I wanted croutons OF COURSE! They are awesome! Also, I ordered Iced Tea with extra ice and there was extra ice in my cup. It's a small thing -but super important and it's surprising how many people don't give me the ice!! It's 100 out - I want all the ice!! This place is a quick and easy place to grab a healthy lunch. Definitely, recommend to anyone in the area!

The food here was incredible. We had the tree of life. The ingredients were balanced, fresh and delicious. The pita was toasted perfectly. Soft with a slight crunch. We also got the LGBT sandwich. I didn't know what to expect with the bacon jam.....amazing!!!!  It makes the sandwich. Finally we ordered the vegan/glueten free ginger snaps.  They were wonderful as well. I have been singing the bronze cafe's praises since we left yesterday!

The staff are always so friendly and ready to tell you about anything they have on the menu. I love love love the fresh almond milk, it's amazing in an iced chai. The pastry case will be my undoing, but I can't help myself with those cookie-brownie cake-like things. They're delicious! 
A wonderful atmosphere with a friendly, inclusive vibe.
Awesome salad... got Davids Special.   the combination was incredible.   :)

They got some vegan foo so they getting all ma stars, all ma all ma stars...yeeeaaa boi, I'm talking seitan, and guacamole n mole sammich, and this pita thing called like the tree of life or something that's like going down on mother earth herself mmmm...oozing n everything. The coffee is mad strong so I had the jitters the first few times. I like the blueberry and banana nut vegan baked goods. Banana. Anana. Nana. Ana. Aaaaay.

I got the complicated order and the sandwich is amazing! It is like nothing you have had before or do not find very often!! Pricing is the only downside and if you don't know where it is, you could have a hard time finding it... Nice area to relax and eat.

Maybe I would partake in "Meatless Mondays" more often if the Bronze Cafe were closer to my work, and without a doubt I'd order The Tree of Life Pita again! 

The Tree of Life Pita is a vegan sandwich that's pretty glorious. It's delicious, flavorful, and healthy. Wrapped in a soft pita was a mixture of greens, mango cilantro ginger vinaigrette, avocado, vegan cashew cream, and pickled onions and roasted bell peppers. 

For a late afternoon snack I picked up some type of quinoa/chia seeds bar. Although, it was tasty, filling, and super crunchy, each bite let loose crumbs and seeds. 

Not only was the food I had delicious, but the prices were reasonable. 

 The Bronze Cafe is a solid lunch spot in my book.

I got "it's complicated" and it was so good. The bacon jam is amazing. I was not sure I would find anything to eat here knowing it was vegan restaurant. I was very wrong. The food is great the service is great. I will come back next time in the area.

One of my favorite places in Las Vegas! The food is always absolutely perfect. My favorite thing to order is the LGBTQ sandwich. The bread is always fresh. The bacon jam is to die for. The blended drinks are fantastic. & The young man that works the counter is cherry on top. I wish I knew his name. He makes you feel like you're old friends. I also place delivery orders and every time the order is prefect and fresh!

This place is a hidden gem. It's located at the LGBT community clinic area. You wouldn't expect a cafe to be there, let alone a good one. When my friend took me here, I was a bit skeptical, thinking it was going to be like one of those airport cafes that charge an arm and a leg for a stale old sandwich. I was proved wrong. As I skim through the menu, they had smoothies, coffees, teas, sandwiches and vegan options. The staff is so nice and chill. I chose to get the California club and she got the tree of life. As I wait patiently for my food, I contemplate if I should order a smoothie or more food, cause I'm thinking, this sandwich is going to be small and I'll still be hungry. As I am looking at the smoothies, my food comes out. Wow! It was a lot bigger than I thought (that's what she said).. It also came with a side salad that I devoured. The ciabatta bread was soft and fluffy and the sandwich had ample amounts of turkey and avacado! Yum yum yum!!! Let's just say, my plate had no survivors. The tree of life looked massive! I see my friend using a fork trying to shove everything in the bread. Haha next time, I'm definitely going to get a smoothie and try one of the vegan options. Overall, this place has awesome sandwiches and great if you want a healthy alternative and don't want to feel gross after eating. Oh, with a check in, you get 10% off!! Yay win win!
So happy we went exploring in Las Vegas and found this place for my vegetarian husband.  I plan to go back!

My vegan friend introduced me to this Cafe and I instantly fell in love!! It's right down the street from my job so it's super convenient for my lunch. The staff is really friendly and they're quick! The tree of life is favorite! I promise you meat eaters won't be disappointed.

This place had delicious, fresh, great quality ingredients and a variety of menu options for everyone. I am not a vegetarian or a vegan and I enjoy all this little gem has to offer.

Prices are a bit expensive for what you get, but expected since it's a small, local cafe. I also wish there were more breakfast options. 

Overall, the food is delicious, the place is so clean, and they are pretty great about not making you wait forever food. The service is not just fast, but friendly and attentive, too. 

Their dessert case is TO DIE FOR! You must try some of the "cheesecakes," as well. Yum!!!

Best. Ever. It was my first time eating at the Bronze Cafe and it was soooo good. I got the bizness salad with brussel sprouts, chickpeas and quinoa along with the soup of the day and brookie using a Groupon that I got a while ago. The salad alone is enough to leave you full and satisfied because of the generous portion you're given. It would be smart to eat half of everything and split it into two meals. Only thing is it would've been nice if the brookie had a nut mixed in. I like my brownies with nuts, but it was still delicious.

This is my first ever review on Yelp because I just had to share my experience.  I discovered this place during a visit a year ago when searching Yelp for vegan restaurants.  I had the Good Earth Pita which was excellent!  Being on a primarily whole-foods plant-based diet, it was a real treat to have so many choices.  Wanting to try something new this time around, I finally settled on having THE BIZNESS - DAVID's SPECIAL (v, gf).  It was without a doubt the BEST salad of my entire life!  I absolutely loved the entire thing, scooping up every last bit of kale, beet, quinoa, chickpeas, avocado, and hemp seeds.  I was hoping to have space to try one of their many great looking desserts, but no such luck as the salad managed to fully satisfy me with no room to spare.  This place is on my MUST visit list during any future visits to the Las Vegas area.  Keep up the great work!!! :)

This is my favorite cafe because of the healthy food, delicious drinks and Chef Peter and David.   I am always welcomed warmly and they are eager to share whatever yummy new dishes they are making plus they remembered my favorite drink by my 2nd visit- awesome!  Comfortable and open late hours (10pm!) it is within the LGBT Center which is a COMMUNITY center, open to the public in a neighborhood that really needs it.  You just may be inspired to volunteer yourself when surrounded by the motivated crowds usually meeting!

Favorite dishes you MUST try:
The LGBTQ sandwich
Farrow and Golden Beet side salads
"Cheesecake" any variety

The quality far surpass any chain coffeehouse and their friendly attitudes blow away any competition downtown!  Love Bronze Cafe!

I've never eaten anywhere with a more consistent kitchen. The food is always prepared quickly and perfectly not to mention every item on the menu is delicious.  My only complaint is that the sandwiches are stacked too high but that really only makes me love them more.

I'm so grateful for yelp reviews because I would of never thought to try this place out. I ordered the (bizness salad) with quinoa, hummus, kale, Brussel sprouts and lemon dressing. I think it's one of the best salads I've ever had.

The kale was amazing with the lemon dressing. I also got to try (the tree of life) which was also very flavorful. I love the vegan options. I will definitely come back again and try the rest of the menu! :)

The Bronze cafe is one of the most unique spots in the city.  I am not vegan, but I follow a a fairly rigid dietary system, and I've never had a problem with finding great food on the menu.

Exploring the menu each time I come is part of the fun. The food is fresh, healthy, and delicious, and the servers are friendly. Writing this review makes me want to go there right now!

Found this place by accident, nestled away inside the local community centre. I was blown away!  Good mix of vegetarian/vegan and non vegan option available, really friendly people and the food was really nice! Try the miss piggy if you love chicken, but if like me your a bacon fan, it has to be the complicated order!!! Yum....Yum.....Yum.....

It's Red Velvet Cafe without the side of lies and deception and I love it!   It's food and desserts cooked healthfully but not necessarily low cal.  Mostly vegan, vegetarian and gluten free choices.  With all the hype and working in close proximity downtown my coworkers and I decided to try this place.  It gets pretty crowded at lunch but worth it.  There is not a lot of seating.  Some couches, computer cubies and a few tables.   

Because I had read the reviews I immediately knew I was going to order the LGBTQ sandwich and it didn't disappoint.  We also shared a dessert,  the Loving vs. Virginia.  It  was cookie baked into a brownie.  Delicious!  I'm a little old school so I'm not a huge fan of the payment on the Ipad and receipt emailed to you.   I still feel I may have been overcharged for an item I did not order but with this payment method I couldn't verify it so next time I will bring cash.

Came here after reading all the reviews so my expectations were high. I ordered the tree of life pita and it was delicious, lots of flavor. It also comes with a small salad. They allow free samples or their sides and cheesecakes. I really liked the strawberry one, but they were all out. This place would easily be 5 stars, but the prices are a bit high. The pita was $10.

Hmmm... I'm somewhat disappointed for my  lunch choice today. My coworker is a regular here, so I always see him eat something delicious and appealing when he gets it delivered. I wanted to try this place out for myself. I didn't want a sandwich, I was craving something lighter like soup and hummus, so that's exactly what I ordered... 

Chili: very bland, overpowered by large pinches of cumin. Very meaty, which was nice, but was disappointed that it didn't come with a side of cornbread or some sort of bread. 
Hummus: also pretty bland and comes with side of pita, which I used some for the chili. I wasn't super impressed, I would recommend maybe a variety of veggies to accompany it. 

Perhaps it was just a poor choice of food that I ordered, but then again, if this place is that good, anything ordered should be delicious. I'll definitely give this place another try, maybe this time a nice salad or a scrumptious sandwich... Even now as I'm multitasking by eating and texting this review, I can't seem to enjoy my order.  Sorry, but this chili sucks!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(299/365) "Sandwiches, Salads, and Such"

We finally made our way to Bronze Cafe after getting cut at Hi-Rollers nearby. After seeing the majority of highly rated reviews by fellow Yelpers, this visit was long overdue. 

The Tree of Life was what I originally planned, but it changed in a split second like a Jedi mind trick when I saw BACON JAM and MAPLE BACON described in the LGBTQ Sandwich, a pretty BOMB rendition of the BLT. We also chose to split the Roasted Beet and Goat Cheese Salad with Candied Pecans. Service here is very pleasant and the workers even toss your salad order if you would like them to. Unfortunately, this salad was lacking in flavor and the pecans lacked that sweet toasted flavor. Their version of a Snickerdoodle was dry and crumbly. The Loving vs. Virginia (AKA Brookie) was nice, warm, chewy, and decadent.

Great spot to chill and meet up for a nice healthy lunch. I'd like to return to  try the highly raved about Tree of Life Pita and Bizness Salad because I heard it was the business...For now, it sits at a little more than A-OK for me.  ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu  3.75

I can't get enough of this place!! Everything is amazing, they are consistent with preparing it, and all staff is extremely accommodating and kinda. I've been coming here for years and love everything, I get all my company events catered and out of every restaurant I use- this one gets the most compliments. My favorite is David's special salad and tree of life pita. They also do a great job delivering drinks without spilling them and include all condiments :) #1 FAN!!

How I heard about Bronze Cafe:

These very words were said to me many times during CrossFit class by a friend: "YOU GOTTA GO TO BRONZE CAFE KEV, YOU GOTTA GO! YOU'RE AN ELITE YELPER RIGHT?!"

Ooo! I am indeed a Yelper and you're calling me out! I never took the time to drive myself out of the way to eat at a little cafe, but one day the opportunity came when I had to make a visit to the adult Disneyland, the DMV. Yelp said it was 1.2 miles way? HUH... LETS GO!

I normally don't write reviews on first visits, but it was good... really good... seriously really good. I had the Tree of Life sandwich ($9.95) to go which is VEGAN, but a bite of that gyro sandwich MASTERPIECE had me considered a vegan lifestyle for a quick second. I don't know why its called Tree of Life, maybe because you feel completely transformed, like a born again virgin. The sandwich consisted of something like pickled onions, roasted red peppers, avocados, greens, tomatoes, and MAGIC. 

Sort of a tangent, but I took a bite of my TO GO sandwich in my car (bad habit) and was so amazed that I decided to eat the whole thing in my car, go back inside and grab a fork to finish the side salad, and was late for my class and quiz. Was it worth it? You bet. 

I am excited to come back and try the soup, salads, the BIZNESS, bars, pretty much everything. 

CHECK IN AND GET $1 OFF YOUR SANDWICH OR THE BIZNESS.
I don't always eat Vegan, but when I do it's "Bronze Cafe". Delicious, guilt free, creative items that make me wanting more. Highly recommended when in Las Vegas, NV.

The best spot Downtown for lunch.  My beautiful wife brought me here for lunch.  She had the Guac & Mole sandwich.  The mole is made with sunflower seeds, raw cacao and chipotle.  It has some kick!  I had the California Turkey on ciabatta bread.  Both were very fresh and tasted great.  A good blend of flavors.

There's free WiFi here, a resource library for the community of books and movies on DVD, gender neutral bathrooms and the friendliest service in town.

We also ordered an oversized chocolate chip cookie (warmed up!) and she had the mango "cheesecake" (vegan/gluten free).  Both hits!  

Try their new drip coffee.  It tastes very smooth.  They brew it overnight cold for over 12 hours.  It makes a difference especially if love iced coffee.

Can't say enough good things about this place.  They welcome everyone, gay and straight, with fresh food, healthy treats and everything made in-house.

You really can not find any other place like it.  We like it better than vegan spots.

They do have plenty of options for those who are not vegan.  

Will be back to try more of their dessert selection and their unusual fresh waters like watermelon chia (similar to agua fresca).

As residents of DTLV, we are so happy this place opened up.  More options.  Cool!
This is the best spot for lunch in Las Vegas!  The food is fantastic.

The pineapple/mint/chia seeds juice was so refreshingly delicious on what felt like the hottest day of my life. Would go there and drink it every day if I lived there, but sadly I don't so I'll be dreaming of it 'til I return

An oasis in a land full of "carnivores;" Bronze Cafe provides scrumptious food for every hungry, hungry herbivore in the Mojave. The service here was great: the employee helping my GF and I was cheerful and gleeful. He even gave us the Monkey Bread on the house! That said, here's a breakdown of the food:

The Vegucated Order sandwich: A meat-replacement dream packed with tofurky and soy "bacon", coupled with a nice blend of coconut "bacon" jam, in between tasty ciabatta, this sandwich was both filling and tasty. However, at $13, I would definitely suggest splitting it, or saving half for another meal.

Curry soup: Personally, I like my curry thick. This curry is more liquidy. Still, good flavor and would be great to take home and devour with a bowl of nice, hot rice.

Monkey Bread: This sweet bread had a nice and soft texture; not too dry, not too wet. Nice blend of cinnamon and chocolate chips.

Pumpkin spice cookie: Tasty. Not dry.

Before heading back into the sun, they kindly filled our reusable water bottles, leaving us satisfied and satiated.

The cheesecake is made of fruit and nuts and tastes far less problematic than the fatty original found anywhere else. A slice of Bronze Cafe cheesecake is well balanced and fulfilling. The manager, Dave, kindly offered tastes of blueberry, mango, espresso. All three versions were delicious and more flavors are prepped by Chef Peter for the seasons. 

So many places in Vegas create incredible smoothies. My favorites include Greens & Proteins and (believe it or not) LVAC. Bronze Cafe is a new favorite third with it's "Too Good For You" smoothie. I drank two large glasses in the past two days. Kale, chia seeds, protein...

The sandwiches are incredible. The LGBTQ is the best BLT I've ever eaten. Not sure where Chef sourced the bread or the idea to include Q-cumbers, but the whole thing is brilliant and somehow makes me feel more like a vegan and less like a bacon-eating carnivore. I savored every bite.

I also ate the chicken salad sandwich and will eat it again and again. Lucky for me, the Bronze Cafe is only .89 miles away so I can walk off a few calories between regular trips to my new favorite downtown spot.

I came here to meet up with a large group of friends. We only ordered coffee, but next time I will try out out more menu items, I just wasn't hungry while I was here. They have a very large and open eating area- plenty of room for our large group. Lots of menu items to choose from for any dietary need: vegan, gluten free, etc. Kid friendly too! 
My only small complaint is that our coffees took a long time to come out, but we were in a large group, so it was ok. Can't wait to return!

Friendly, personal service and unbeatably healthy, delicious foods. Coffee and Pastries too!
I love the Canteloupe Tumeric Water. I never drink soda now! The Just Too Good For You smoothie is a meal replacement. The California Turkey is the best sandwich, in my thorough research. I will get the Complicated Order when I'm in the mood for some bacon. Ask for a free sample of the soup of the day, it's the best.

I have yet to have a bad experience at this cafe and I pray I never do. I love the Tree of Life pita and the cheesecakes are to die for. I enjoy coming here to eat because it is delicious but I'm not sacrificing my health on an indulgence. The staff is friendly and the first time I went in they took the time to explain the menu and help me find something I would enjoy. I would highly recommend The Bronze Cafe to anybody

I have spent quite some time trying to find a good Vegan place that's not overly priced.

Finally! I have found it. 



Super friendly staff, and amazing food.
I highly recommend getting the "Tree of Life" (amazing!)or the LGBTQ sandwich (if you dig bacon).  Any of the sides are also really tasty. 

I got the Mocha Chocolate Cheesecake to go, and was pleased. Super decadent and yummy. 

I have never been to the LGBTQ Center before. The Bronze Cafe was located directly when you walk in. The center was very quite because they were closed. It seemed like a great place to maybe kick back and do some work. They have a wall of books you can sit and read. 

Def a gem. We will be frequently stopping by!
Been coming here for awhile. The vegucated sandwhich with a side of Brussel sprouts are my favorites! I love their fruit waters and desserts too. And everyone's always friendly!

I drive 9 miles twice a month just 4 the Best Cafe in VEGAS
The food is exceptional?
There's a choice for any Foodie or pallet from chicken turkey and lots of the VEGAN Options

The Staff are the SEXY in the City

Thank you 4 making a Better Community

If you want something new with an informal setting this is the place for you! Lots to choose from and everything is unique. My favorite is the WHAT WHAT!  Give it a try, you'll be sure to return. Noon hour tends to be busier than normal, of course.

I love this place! The Guac & Mole is so amazing, I've gotten multiple people hooked on it! The mole sauce is flavorful and the sandwich is huge. I love the raspberry dressing for the salad. It also helps that there's never a wait and the staff are super friendly (& knowledgable about vegan options).
Went with my boyfriend to Bronze Cafe and I really enjoyed it :) I got a sandwich and it was delicious, the vegan desserts looked really good! I will need to try one next time.

OMG!  The ciabatta bread is so soft and fresh!  The worker said that the bread was delivered the same  morning from a nearby bakery.  The peanut butter chocolate chip vegan cheesecake is out of this world!

Excellent cafe for both vegans and non-vegans alike.  All the paper menu items are marked whether they are vegan or gluten-free.  

Don't let it scare you that the cafe is inside the LGBT Center. Everyone is friendly, even if you are straight.

Bronze has the nicest staff! Every time I eat here I know I'll have a pleasant experience. I crave the guac and mole sandwich about once a week, and my boyfriend loves the chopped chicken salad with bacon. The cold-brew coffee is a must in the summer. As for lattes, if you're adding a powder, they're a little too sweet for my taste. A plain latte or cup of coffee is perfect (they use Colorado River Roasters coffee from Boulder City). I've even had them weigh out a pound of coffee beans for me to purchase for home use. Bronze is pricey, but once a week or so it's a nice indulgence.

Ok! I freaking LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! I so wish I live in LV because I would eat here everyday. The staff was amazingly nice. The food select made me feel healthy AF but the taste was amazing. Loved the names of the food too. So fun. Go here, eat here, live here!!

Vegan cheesecake - delish
Watermelon chia water - freshingly good
It's complicated sandwich 
Mrs Piggy
Vegan chili
Cookie Brownie - vegan and DAMN good
Monkey bread

I absolutely love this place. Not only is the food amazing but the staff is exceptional. They have a great variety of food, drinks, and pastries. My favorites is the it's complicated sandwich and bacon scone. It is definitely a hidden gem.

TLDR: yelp coupon and government employee discounts; long lines most of the time; fantastic service and food handling; vegetarian and vegan friendly

This is a hidden find for visitors and locals alike. When do you ever hear, "Hey! Wanna go to the LGBTQ Center for lunch?" I hear it fortnightly if you're at my job at least. Who doesn't want house-made food at a fair price? I cannot even begin to tell you my excitement with this location. First off, get here quickly. They take customer service seriously. The con to this is potentially long lines during rush hour. But, if you can afford the time, wait in line. You need to enjoy this place, omnivores and vegans alike! From their made-from-scratch soups and salads, to their sandwiches and pitas, this place will satisfy anyone's cravings. Because it is located inside the Center, it is a shared space, so seating is limited adjacent to the gender non-specific, inclusive bathrooms.

So what do you order: Well if you're looking for color and presentation, please order the biz-ness salad. You will get your vegetable servings for the day! Want some meat in there? Try the LGBTQ and you will love the bacon jam. Want something more "adventurous" on the menu? Try the Tree of Life Pita with the vegan cashew "crema." You will not regret coming here. Just don't forget to check-in or show your government ID for a discount. I'll sure be back for more.

Here's the breakdown:
Food - 5 stars
Coffee - 5 stars

Came to get coffee and brunch one day, ordered the tree of life pita and the turkey club, both were amazing!! Fresh ingredients, healthy organic options, flavorful sauces, and beautiful presentation. The ice coffee was very good too, they brew ice coffee with the proper apparatus and the taste is perfect.

My complaint is on one female staff. While we were standing in line ordering we were disagreeing about the drinks option and this staff started to join in and started to reprimand me for my choice and lecturing me. That's extremely inappropriate and not any of her business. Then after we ordered, she was forcing me to write a tip. I'm ordering a togo order, where there's no service involved therefore I do not tip. She gave me an extreme hard time about not leaving a tip and continue to say that I can leave a cash tip. Wow! Talk about hustling! I'm not at the strip club!

I'm not sure if I wanted to come back to be hustled again no matter how good the food is.

Giving this place 5 stars partly due to the fact that I'm so pleased to have found them. Though the food certainly delivered as well. Have gone back ad nauseum for the lgblt. Exceptional blt. Located within the gay and lesbian community center. So makes for an interesting experience all around.

My husband and I are both chefs and our minds were blown by this place! We dabble in vegan/vegetarian food from time or time and this is the best we've come across. Huge kudos to the chef and the staff for making the food taste as delicious as it looks. Quality here is top notch people!

Wow my "Complicated" sandwich was delicious! I enjoyed every bite!! I will be returning here when I visit Vegas again. Also very good service! I didn't get the guys name but he was very sweet! Come try this place out you wont be disappointed!

We've been coming her since they opened over a year ago and we love it. I refer so many people to bronze. Chef Peter and David thank you for opening something healthy near our home in downtown.  I highly recommend.

Got the LGBTQ and was probably the best bacon sandwich I ever had. The ingredient were fresh and even the side salad with lite dressing was delicious. To end it, I got an ice coffee to go. Best ice coffee in town

Seriously.... Seriously.

I never feel bad after eating here and I want to take pictures of everything I eat. I don't, maybe because I would be embarrassed or maybe because I devour it before I could ever have time to photograph it. Either way, I'm in looooove.

We're fast approaching the end of 2016. Fortunately, it wasn't too late for me to visit one of Yelp's Top 100 Places to Eat in 2015.

The original Bronze Cafe (not the new one on Fremont St) is #18 on that list, and after surprisingly discovering their Groupon offer last month, I finally made my way there for lunch today. Located inside what's now simply called "The Center' (formerly The Gay & Lesbian Community Center of Southern Nevada), this all-day-but-probably-best-for-lunch spot has a menu full of vegan offerings but doesn't leave out us meat-eaters.

After presenting my Groupon, I proceeded to order a soup, a "sammich" (rather than a salad), and my choice of any pastry (but I chose a simple cookie because that's what the offer had read).

Soup of the Day (normally $4.95 w/ entree, $5.95 without): today's black eyed pea soup was actually my favorite part of the meal. It was a hot, comforting, soup with a vegan-yet-hearty broth and not-overcooked legumes and vegetables. I almost thought that the plastic container was going to deform with that heat, and I contrary to scientific pursuit, I simply opened the lid and finished the entire soup right then and there.

The Complicated Order (normally $12.90): it's rather simple if you just think of it as a super loaded BLT. It's the "LGBTQ" (another menu sandwich) plus avocado and turkey, and they anti-skimp on the turkey. For reference, the LGBTQ itself is pretty much a BLT but as follows: Lemon vinaigrette, mixed Greens (both inside and as side salad), Bacon jam (and bacon strips), Tomatoes, and "Q-Cumber," plus a basil aioli and their ciabatta bread that's pretty much all you can choose from if you're not gonna go gluten-free.

I almost felt as if I were eating a stacked pastrami deli, albeit with no pastrami and several other layers instead. It was huge, it was meaty, and I enjoyed pretty much every ingredient moderately. I've gotten more intense flavors from other sandwiches (well, one particular sandwich-specializing shop in town), but this is quite delicious for something that might be labeled as healthy.

Chocolate Chip Cookie ($2.25): this could use a crunchy exterior, but it's a very chewy cookie with a lot of oomph (read: thickness) and good chocolate flavor. It's clearly not the butter-rich cookie fresh from your grandma's oven, but it's somewhat addictive all the same. I appreciated that it's pre-sealed in plastic because I was pretty full from the other parts of lunch, so I ate this cookie just before writing the review.

I could definitely see myself coming back to Bronze Cafe for more of their take on fresh and often (but not exclusively) vegan food. The Center is a very friendly and inviting space, and they have a great parking lot, so don't let the Downtown Las Vegas location dissuade you as it somewhat did me.

LGBTQ was the best BLT ever. If you like real coffee you've got to go here. 
They have great food, coffee, smoothies and lots of other things. Worth a visit. I'll be going back soon.

This place is awesome and it caters to vegans!!! Their salads and sandwiches are fresh, healthy, and delicious! They have a unique way of brewing their iced coffee and it is delish!!! Great fresh juices, smoothies and desserts! Highly recommend this place :)

I think it had kale, chickpeas, toasted almonds, some granola, I think, and a delicious dressing, maybe more ingredients.  It was really tasty.  There was nothing special about the hummus or pita chips other than I think they made the pita chips themselves, but the flavors in the sandwich and side salad were wonderful.

I'll qualify my review by saying I don't eat lunch out much, so there might be other excellent places out there, but my boxed lunch yesterday was the best I have had in Vegas and very comparable to the delicious boxed lunches I used to get occasionally at meetings in Denver that were catered by Udi's, for anyone who is familiar with them.

Was really surprised by this place. You say why. Just wasn't expecting it in the location that it is in. I tried to find this place once and was really confused and then gave up. I guess I wasn't expecting it to be in building that doesn't look like it would house a restaurant/café such as this. 

I had the LBTQ----- I think it had one more letter but for some reason it currently escapes me. Let's just say I don't think you could put anymore bacon on the sandwich. I mean you could try but I don't think it is possible. WoW all that yummy bacon. Topped with a basil aioli, on a chabata bun with fresh veggies. This sandwich was amazing and fresh. I would never expect it to come from a place that  looks like an old library. I really wish this were a more apparent restaurant some where. The prices screem fresh and high over head which i don't think fits the local. Don't get me wrong I will be back the next time i am in the area. I just wished it were more convienent
Working conventions is fun, but the food is less than quality when at the LVCC. Bronze Cafe delivers some amazing vegan treats. Great customer service.

This place is awesome! They serve up fresh, delicious, healthy eats. Items tried and liked: The Good Earth, The Tree of Life, Cantaloupe Tumeric Fruit Water, Watermelon Chia Fruit Water and a Fruity Pebble Cookie. Everything was so flavorful & yummy! 

The staff is another reason why this place is so awesome!!! They are all so welcoming & friendly. :)  It's nice when someone is genuinely nice & caring  and not just doing their job. 

Looking forward to trying other items on the menu. My daughter and I will definitely be back! :)
This is a diamond in the rough place. Great sandwiches! For the price, you get a lot! Staff are quick and precise.

Another life saver on our road trip west. At 6 months pregnant, my body definitively rejects any variety of fast food (trust me I've tried...projectile vomiting in the Rockies? Not so fun). So have used Yelp to try to find healthy alternatives across the country. Found Bronze Cafe online and have it a try - awesome food, awesome service, lived up to the Yelp acclaims. I got the Green Goddess sandwich, and have to agree the fresh soft bread makes this sandwich. Delicious and love the salad with it with tangy lemony dressing. My husband got The Bizness David's Version and raved about it. It is possible to eat healthy and enjoy it if all the food tastes like this!

Shout out to the super friendly staff who made us feel so welcome and we waited maybe five minutes for our food at 1:30 on a Thursday so waiting not an issue. Thank you Bronze for giving us a healthy alternative to Fast Food Nation!!

This place was a really great find! It was inside a place called the center so don't go crazy trying to find a sign! They are a tad expensive but absolutely amazing. They have a 15 hour coffee drip! They have gluten free and vegan options. I had their watermelon juice and pineapple with chia. They were both great!

Their cashew sauce was probably the most delicious vegan sauce I have had. Mmmmmm 

I will return there... And they have a help offer!

The David's Special salad is the most amazing salad I have ever had. I even had it twice in one week.

I was in town for work and after hitting Shake Shack too hard, I knew it would be best if I took it easy with a salad. However, these salads are no skimpy diet meals. The salad was only $12 but the size of two meals. David's Special has so many great ingredients (kale, beets, chickpeas, quinoa, carrots, oh my) that I was full off of half. 

Check-in for 10% off. I even got a special deal for my next visit for being a first time visitor, which totally worked on convincing me to come back. Everyone was so nice and I was dying to try the rest of the menu but the salad was too good to me.

I must say I am very surprised! 


This place is anything but ordinary in every way!


Let me just start off by saying it was super packed so that's a very good sign.

And I can't forget to mention the food is FUCKING amazing!!! If you haven't tried this place you are TRULY missing out!


Especially if your looking for something new and clean and healthy!!

The good earth pita is beautifully crafted with all the different flavors it's something to consider when coming here for the first time!!

I'm def hooked and gonna be coming back for more!!  

Especially before or after a good work out this place def hits the spot!!!! 


Some where you can come and eat anything no matter what it is on the menu and feel good about it

This is by far the most healthy and delicious place in Vegas. The young Latin gentleman is an angel and won't steer you wrong. We were only in Vegas for the weekend and every meal we wanted to have here, and now regret that we didn't. True gem, great find!

The Bronze Café at the Center had delicious and nutritious food. We sampled several of the sandwiches and believe me, it was hard to choose just one.  I had the "What What" which had pepperoni, turkey, and lots of veggies...absolutely delicious.  My husband's favorite was "The LGBTQ" with house made bacon jam filled with bacon and veggies, out of this world.  For the desserts...my husband devoured the "Raw Vegan Strawberry Cheesecake" while I consumed "The Loving v. Virginia Brownie and Cookie Combination"...all I can say is, "yummy". As far as the eating area was concerned, it was spotless and the bathroom was immaculate. Being that my husband and I are very picky eaters, we were so impressed with this place having great food and a clean eating area...and let's not forget the very friendly staff who served us with a smile.

This place is like The Beat coffeehouse downtown...if The Beat weren't trying so hard to be hip, and had better food. Don't get me wrong, I appreciate the Beat for what it is...but I like this place a million times better! BONUS: there's a sizeable FREE parking lot out front, which you will not find anywhere within a 10-mile radius of the Beat (unless you count the poor El Cortez, which isn't always free).

Here, you'll find REALLY good, healthy foodie-food in a solidly unpretentious atmosphere (and a solidly unpretentious neighborhood). The staff are generous to a fault, and will let you try samples of just about everything on the menu. I've eaten here a few times, and it has always been exceptional. Sandwiches, salads, sides, pastries and desserts...plus lots of fruit juices and a full coffee and espresso bar.

The restrooms are clean (unisex--beware), the parking is ample, and there's a bike rack out front. There's also an onsite internet cafe, reading library, and general chill-out space. It's sort of like a cross between your local library and a non-annoying independent coffehouse. 

Look at the other reviews here -- all 5-star! That should tell you something...this place rocks!

The Good Earth Sammy is delish!!!!!!! My fave

Awww YEAH!!  Gluten Free, Veggie goodness, two snaps for fabulous!!  I've already been back several times and I won't stop now. 
Delish and the service was FAB (all caps)!

I will say though, I don't enjoy the iced tea, it's super wee and no free refills, grrrr! :/

I came to the Bronze Café a couple of days after missing one of the 89xxx events. Bobby Y. mentioned that the BLT was great so I was dying to try it. Also, since I work downtown and am in the public sector, the LBGT Center is very appealing to me.
Let me preface by saying I am not a big sandwich person. Additionally, lunch for me has to be hearty meal, which sandwiches are usually not. But nonetheless, a friend a I decided to check it out for lunch one day we weren't too famished. The Center is very nice, with ample parking and big, big windows. I think they could use a bit more vegetation outside, what with the white walls, white stones, white fences, etc. But it gives the place a nice, light, airy feeling. 

The Café is right at the entrance, and they have a couple of tables to enjoy your lunch at. We placed out order (LGBTQ for me) and since no tables were available, we took a seat at the lounge chairs in the back by the library. I can understand how they are trying to offer a community space to hang out at, what with the free Wi-Fi and comfy chairs, but really the tables should be for eating. People were taking their dear time, and although the chairs we sat at were comfy and there was a little table to place our food on, it would've been better to sit at a table. Just saying.

On to the food! The sandwich was THE BOMB! It was incredible! Best BLT I've ever had in my life. Period. Also, it looks like a small portion but I ended up very satisfied at the end. My only complaint would be that the tomatoes could've been a bit more ripe but other than that is was delicious and I will definitely be coming back, and often!

A healthy place to eat close to my work...I'll take it!! The Bronze Cafe is a hidden gem inside of a "center" that supports and welcomes all of our friends within the LGBT community. I'm kicking myself for not paying attention to the name of the facility, but it looks brand new and the people are very friendly. 

The menu offers a variety of sandwiches, salads, speciality dishes, and smoothies. There are definitely vegetarian and vegan options as well. I felt healthier just reading the menu. I ended up ordering The Bizness salad which is a kale based salad with your choice of three toppings. The toppings aren't just the typical salad options either, they're gourmet veggie options like Brussel sprouts (which were bomb) and spicy chickpeas (also a good choice). One of the best parts about this place is the portions. They are very generous for the amount!! I appreciated it because I was starving. 

Another cool service is that they have a delivery option for a small $3 fee (within the zip code). They did warn that they have limited drivers, but I like that the option is there in addition to the Eat 24 option for delivery. As a teacher with a short 30 min lunch break in a work place that is a beacon for junk food, I am so grateful for this new hidden treasure that can deliver healthy food to keep me on track!

This place is a gem!

Had a free afternoon and came in here to grab some lunch. I had totally spaced the fact that I had a Groupon that had expired. Right off the bat, I was greeted and they were super cool with letting me use that expired Groupon (some places can be sort of leery about using the value of the price paid, which is an actual Groupon policy) . They also have a discount for students! They asked me instead of me prompting them with that question. They also asked if I wanted a cup of water. I just really love places that offer awesome things unprompted. 

I decided on The Complicated Order without aioli. It was such a serious sandwich. I could barely take a bite! The ciabatta bread was fresh and the warm turkey was great paired with the bacon jam. I really dug that bacon jam was generously piled on and it was not super sweet as some bacon jams tend to be. Rounded out with the crisp cucumbers and lettuce, it was a great sandwich. 

Now I am about to write an entire paragraph about lettuce. I have only recently learned that I hate lettuce on sandwiches. All sandwiches seem to have a soggy piece of iceberg lettuce that wilts when it touches a warm sandwich. Or the lettuce is just a bunch of bulky filler that offers no flavor. Don't get me wrong, I am obsessed with salads and I love certain types of lettuce. But really, iceberg  is gross and maybe only serves to make someone feel better about eating a burger or something. But this sandwich has mixed greens and the greens are dressed in a vinaigrette! It works! It is the first time that I have been happy to actually eat lettuce on my sandwich. 

I plan on coming back here again to try out some of their other items. Maybe something in the opposite direction (vegan) of what I ordered.

After mentally bookmarking this place for several months, it pains me to say we were rather disappointed after making the trek over here today.
We were promptly and happily greeted by staff upon entering. It must've been obvious it was our first time (I'm sure the long pondering period and questioning glances to each other had something to do with it) and we were graciously extended help with choosing what to order which was appreciated.
 I went with the "Complicated Order" and my boyfriend chose the "Guac and Mole." We also ordered a 16oz cantaloupe/chia seed juice and a Ghirardelli mocha. We were brought these beverages first, and immediately we questioned why the cantaloupe juice was a huge 24oz. We didn't order that size. Were we unknowingly charged for that size? Did they run out of 16oz? Who knows. I already paid. And tipped, for that matter. A little too embarrassing to squabble over after the fact. 
Over 10 minutes later our sandwiches were brought to us. Seems like a little long to put two sandwiches together, but maybe that's just me. Even more annoying that once our food was set down and repeated to us, both my boyfriend and our server realized they'd gotten my boyfriend's order wrong. The sandwich was yanked away and we were left to share my own as we were both too ravenous to wait any longer. By the time his sandwich was corrected and brought to us some 10 additional minutes later, he'd already finished the other half of my own. We were given a simple "Sorry for the wait." No compensatory anything was given as retribution for putting a damper on lunch. Mind you, $40 later.
Not a good first impression left. What peeves me the most about this entire experience is the fact I tipped these people 20% prior to even receiving our food. Completely undeserved. Nobody's fault but my own, but definitely a learning experience going forward. 
We're no vegans or vegetarians, but we still appreciated the high quality of the food we received. It just wasn't good enough for us to go out of the way coming back here.

Soooooo good! Every sandwich, every salad, every drink, every dessert. ALL good!  

It's casual, very friendly service. They really care about the food they are serving. It's clean and laid back. They listen to feedback and it influences what they do. 

I tell all my vegan friends about it too because they have some killer vegan food as well, that is packed with flavor! 

Can't go wrong! Consistently uber fresh!

Seriously, I just joined yelp for the sole purpose of giving this spot five stars. It is THAT GOOD! I went here with Vegan friends and I split Tree of Life (with chicken) with my lady, which was dope. The real star  of the evening was 'The LQBTQ', a ridiculously dope Bacon sandwich with bacon spread (and fresh vegetables). It was like being punched in the mouth by a ten-foot Bacon Golem. Can't wait to get back here.

I'm going to make this as short and simple as possible. I go across town at least once a month to eat here. First of all it is located in The Center which is a beautiful and inviting building, the prices are reasonable when you consider that every thing is made fresh when ordered and the service cannot be beat.

The complicated order is by far the best sandwich I have ever eaten and also one of the biggest. The bacon jam is absolutely to die for. And don't forget dessert!

Bronze Cafe is such a wonderful place! The food, service, atmosphere, it's all amazing. 
All the waters are great, from chia watermelon to cucumber melon. The Tree of Life is the absolute best pita ever! I never get tired of ordering the same thing every time. So many delicious dessert options to choose from, and they are so big (so you can share if you like!) My favorite desserts include the peanut butter snicker doodle, the banana bar and the strawberry cookie. It's always a plus if you get to see lovely Chef Peter or David but all of their staff is super friendly and awesome!
Edit: Still love this place and while I didn't get tired of ordering the delicious Tree of Life, I tried the Bizness-David's Special and now alternate between both items since they are both so good!

This is honestly my favorite place to go to. For starters the staff are always very friendly and responsive. 
The vegetarian/vegan options are fantastic, you can order any thing on the menu and feel like you're eating healthy. From a veggie lover's perspective, this place is awesome! They aren't skimpy on their serving sizes either! I recommend this place to anyone who loves healthy and fresh food without sacrificing taste!

Great lunch place. Can't stop. Been here once weekly since I went the first time. Love the tree of life sandwich. And everyone I've brought loves it too. The staff is super friendly and make you feel at ease and help with everything they possibly can!
Don't forget to sample their flavored waters!
A great energy and a nice building!

I have to confess, I only get one thing when I come here... The Good Earth Pita is delicious! I love me some meat, rarely do I eat meals without fish or meat. The Good Earth Pita is a different story, though it's vegan, it's so damn good! The flavors, the crunch of sunflower seeds, the meatiness of eggplant... I can't get enough! Every time I come I want to try something different but I just can't! This pita just draws me in!
A friend of mine had the Tree of Life Pita and said it was delicious as well. I have no first hand knowledge though, since I can't break up wit the Good Earth. 
Bronze Café also has a variation of waters, the Watermelon Chia is yummy, as well as the Cucumber and Honeydew.
I've also tried the cookies but they were super hard, asking if the cookies are fresh might make sense.
Oh, Bronze Café is located inside the LGBTQ Center! In case you have trouble finding it.

I've been here twice so far for lunch during the week days. I'm not a vegan or vegetarian. I just came here because every once in a while, homemade food and fast food aren't working for me.

I'm so glad we came across this place! It is amazing. The people are so friendly and helpful. The food is fresh and fast.

My first visit I got the tree of life pita. This was the best thing I've ever had! Even the onions on this pita were amazing. This is a must on your first visit.

I went back on a Friday, not too hungry. I got a smoothie, and two sides. They were out of red potatoes so they offered any other side for me. The curried quinoa was so filling and so good. Even cold. Then the red pepper hummus was the substitute for the red potatoes. It came with 5 slices of warm pita slices. Very good.

This is a place everyone should come check out!

We were visiting Vegas and I was rapidly deteriorating because apparently there are no vegans in LV or maybe they just all starved to death. Anyway the SO found this place on yelp and promptly drove me over. I was in heaven. It took me 15 min to decide what I wanted and it was delightful! I don't remember what it was called but I got a huge box full of all kinds of yummy stuff I chose off the menu. My honey got the lgbtq sandwich and loved it. I wish I lived closer!
Really yummy food. The fruit drinks on the other hand were not. I ordered the strawberry lemongrass drink and it was gross. Ended up throwing it away. They aren't cheap either.
I love this place but you need to change your hours listed! Not open until 10 am instead of 7 like it says!

I've had a tough time finding healthy food options in town and came across this gem of a place purely by chance. Once here I was blown away by the staff and their friendly demeanor, the healthy food options (a big vegan menu), and the quality of the food.  In ordered the Tree of Life sandwich and was very happy with the result.  It was packed full of fresh ingredients and the overall flavor of it was astounding. I didn't feel overly full but was perfectly satisfied.  I'll definitely be coming back here for more!

Bronze Cafe...Very ambiguous impression of this cafe. I am a man of conservative views, but I can not say that everything new is alien to me. But this place shocked me, because I was there with my children. People come here with unconventional views on life, and I wanted to leave soon therefrom. But we paid for the sandwiches and waited patiently for them. After lunch we immediately left this cafe. There are not even separate toilets. The sandwiches were really tasty and salads too. The prices are high. The staff are polite! But still I will never want to be there again. The café itself is good, but the center in which it is located seemed strange to me. And strange people visit him. In general, devilry)

I love this place. I try and have something different every time I come. I have tried every vegetarian item on the menu, and they are all great. 

It is very casual and there are people coming and going. The staff are super friendly and helpful. 

Their vegan desserts are great too.

I haven't actually been inside this place, but have ordered delivery from them a few times. The food is always fresh and delicious. I love their Chicken Caesar salad, they even give you like delicious homemade croutons. Their Blended Chai or Blended Dirty Bird drinks are also my favorite things ever. Their sandwiches and other salads are great too.
They are super nice and make ordering on the phone so easy. If you're like me and hate calling places to order food like me, you'll be like wow I love them. Also they always show up to the office with our food super fast. 
Definitely my favorite place to order lunch from.
