I was invited here by a co-worker that had gotten this place as a recommendation from our boss. I was certainly a little confused when I pulled into what looked to be a community center, which it is! Very cool. 

I loved the setting. Not necessarily the best place to study (judging by the book shelves, it looks like some people do), but a great place to have a meal and a chat. 

I had a salad (tried to look up the name, but it looks like they've changed their menu since I've been there). I remember it being fantastic. Dressing was on point!!! 

The staff really stood out. They were so incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about the food they served. They even came out intermittently to let us try some samples and really took our feedback to heart.

Great food if you're a vegan looking for a cozy cafe with many food options. The coffee is not great but I recommend the California Tofurky. My friend got the Tree of Life and she was equally impressed!

The owner threw down when I walked in, stating, "We have the best bacon sandwich in Las Vegas!"  Wait, what???  

CHALLENGE!

Guess what?  They delivered!  Damn!  

I'll back VERY soon!

I might have a slight addiction to Bronze Cafe -- and by slight, I mean I think I've eaten BC three times in the last 7-10 days. The food is phenomenal, and the menu has a pretty solid range of options depending on your dietary preferences. I've only had their sandwiches (no salads or soups), but every sandwich is tasty, filling, and not something you'll find elsewhere. I'd also recommend picking up a drink and something sweet to complete the meal -- my go-to order is the Miss Piggy with a large blended chai and a strawberry oat bar (or strawberry cookie). 

The staff also deserves a shout-out, as they are always friendly, welcoming, and eager to give you the best service possible!

P.S.: When you're there, check out the gigantic yarn/woven mural of the city across from BC -- it's incredibly detailed and you'll want to stare at it for hours!

Amazing! Sooooo good!!! Being from LA and being spoiled with all the great vegan options we have there, we felt just like home! The smoothies and the sandwiches are super flavorful! The staff is friendly and welcoming! Me and my boyfriend were in Vegas for two days and we were at Bronze cafe both days! Highly recommend !

Lunch at Bronze Cafe is always a winner, the last time I went was no different.

I also think I have fallen in love with a sandwich and it couldn't have a better name... The Miss Piggy! This delicious sandwich comes with a creamy, phenomenal Green Goddess chicken salad, stuffed between a fluffy ciabatta bread. I've never had Green Goddess anything before and I have to say, it is life changing! Why haven't I been having this on EVERYTHING I eat?! Sandwich also comes with red onions, tomato, and arugula/salad mix. Plus an extra helping of salad on the side.

While here I also tried their Coconut Curry Mushroom soup (the soup of the day). Creamy, with a kick, and plump toothy mushrooms. I did not get an actual cup, but my friend liked it so much she ordered it for her lunch.

Lastly - do not overlook their baked goods because you will miss out on something delicious.

Best lunch spot EVAR!
ATTENTION DOWNTown: this place has amazing food. the complicated order sandwich, the split pea soup, delicious!!! no words to describe, if you love your tastebuds treat them to this cafe.

Found this randomly on here looking for healthy options while traveling. It's inside a community center but don't let that stop you... It's AMAZING! My friends and I all ordered something different and each one of us loved what we had. The salads in particular were fresh and delicious! Now found another Vegas favorite!

Fantastic food and service! Everything is fresh & delicious! I always get the Bizzness and my husband gets the Good Earth but you can't go wrong with any of the menu items! I also recommend their desserts!! We love the employees too! Everyone is so friendly and we love when Peter is working! The Bronze Cafe is a must every time we visit from Orange County!!!

Bronze Cafe at The Center is awesome! I went with my boyfriend and we both got the roasted veggie sandwich, with sides of hummus and babaganoosh, then shared the vegan strawberry cheesecake. Everything was delicious, and the staff were very friendly and knowledgeable.

I didn't get coffee this time, but I did try some of my boyfriend's and it was great. Bronze Cafe even makes their own almond milk!

This is a great cafe overall, but especially wonderful for vegans and vegetarians.

We wanted a light lunch near downtown and this is what we found...  It was good, very tasty chicken Caesar salad and hubby had tree of life pita that cashier said was too favorite.  Could tell very fresh ingredients were used and if you are vegan or want gluten free items this is your place.  Address easy to find but didn't realize this was inside a building and could not see any signage for it.
Had the Thai peanut salad and it blew me away. Staff was friendly great food for a little cafe.

A breath of fresh air from the Strip! If you are Vegan and are visiting Vegas (or a local) you must try this place! Downtown Las Vegas kind of makes me uneasy but I'm so glad I came here! The staff is friendly and super passionate about what they do. The food is fresh, healthy and delicious! Extremely well-priced and all of the fabulous reviews on here from fellow Yelpers are spot on! This place IS a gem. I had the Tree of Life Pita which came with a side salad and it was a lot of food for what you pay and way better than anything advertised as "healthy" on the strip! I also got a Vegan Chai cookie which was amazing. This spot is in an LGBTQ center so the atmosphere is kind of like a library cafe, but you're going here for the good eats and you definitely won't be disappointed!

Favorites:
Tree of Life Pita

This place is at the Center and it's great.  First of all, the people who work there are so friendly.  Then you see they have a great choice of sandwiches and salads, which are wonderful.  I had the BLT essentially, but they have a way cuter name for it.  Anyway, it is FULL of bacon, and a heavenly little thing called bacon jam (see my review of Honey Salt another place which supplies this wonderful condiment).  I had a latte which was awesome, and then we checked out their baked goods.  I had a loving v. virginia which is the legalization of marriage between a cookie and a brownie.  It was such a cute name I HAD to get it and it was worth the $3.95, although being a bit of a baker myself I think it could have been cooked a little less.  Now, the only reason it is not getting five stars is that there is not too many tables, but here's the thing, it's a CENTER and probably not meant to be a restaurant, but that's ok!  If you ask someone if you can sit with them, they ALWAYS let you!  I will be going back, and back, and back to this place for lunch!!

Update: I'm not happy about the new hours & mornings at the Market. The Market doesn't have as yummy of coffee as Bronze Cafe did at the Center. Also I prefer the Center's ambiance. The Market is too hipster for me. I'm only drinking almond milk lattes 1-2x/week now, but I preferred buying them at the Bronze Cafe at the Center. Plz come back. Thanks!! Oh and I do still love the Tree of Life. So much yum! 

Original Review:
My office is nearby so I've visited the Bronze Cafe lots of times. The food is great - lots of healthy, fresh veggie options & good stuff for you meat eaters too. The coffee is great as well.  

My usual is the Tree of Life Pita. Soooo yummy. The Guac and Mole is good too.  The baked treats (including vegan options) are so tempting & yummy.  They also have vegan soups every day. I tried a sample of their new black eyed pea soul today...very good and sure to be a favorite when the weather gets cooler. 

They have gluten free options too if that's a concern for you. 

Check it out...great place to grab coffee or lunch!

Love this place. The food is homemade and the staff are amazing. Unfortunately I no longer work in the area so I don't get here much but they still send me coupons. I miss their Green Goddess chicken sandwich. What I also appreciate about them is they have really yummy vegan options.

Great space!! And some of the best vegetarian options I've ever seen at a restaurant.  Delicious and fun and a phenomenal staff!! 

Also... Awesome wi-fi/workspace.  Got a ton of work done!!

Went here for the first time last week. I SO want to give this place 5 stars because holy smokes was it good! I got the Tree of Life pita and it was heaven! So flavorful! I also got a matcha green tea smoothie which was just ok. Also got a strawberry cookie which was fabulous! Also very nice staff. SO why the 3 stars? Because unfortunately there was a hair in my side salad  that came with my take out pita...yuck! That wasn't so amazing.
There are no words to describe how amazing the food and staff at Bronze Cafe are.  Truly a hidden gem in downtown Vegas. Prepare to become addicted.

Move over Red Velvet Cafe!  The Bronze Cafe is the business. The sandwiches and sides are fantastic--especially the LGBTQ and you cannot miss the fruit waters (get the peach mint before it runs out!).

Bronze Cafe is a hidden gem. The Bizness salad is totally the bizness. The "It's Complicated" sandwich gets me every time. The location (in The Center, an LGBTQ community center) is hidden away from the madness of Fremont street but still an easy walk, and very serene. Great food, great service, AND they deliver. What more could you ask for?

I was dropping my daughters car off at A 1 Carburetor for repairs and I needed to kill some time, so I checked Yelp for some place to eat while I waited. The Bronze Cafe popped up and I had it booked marked, so I figured I would give it a try.

I should have read the reviews and I could have saved myself the trouble of driving in circles looking for the place. It is located inside a LGBTQ community center. I finally figured it out and made my way in.

We ordered a couple of pita wraps. We got the tree of life and the good earth. They were both very good. The entire menu looks great. Plenty of healthy options. I am going to try the kale salad (Bizness) next time.

I would definitely frequent this place if it was in Summerlin, but I will hit it up when I am in the area from now on. The food and service was great. I definitely recommend that you give this place a try.

I love this place!  I work Downtown and this is now my favorite go-to lunch spot.  The food is delicious and fresh.  I highly recommend the California Turkey sandwich, Tree of Life and the Bizzness.  My co-workers were hesitant to join me, as they thought Bronze Cafe wouldn't have anything for their carnivorous appetites, but the Miss Piggy proved them wrong!  The Loving v. Virgina is a must for dessert, delicious warm chocolate chip cookie, nestled on top of a chewy brownie, Bloody Gorgous!  Staff are lovely and very attentive.
The staff here is super super nice. And almost all the food I've tried was good too. This is a good meeting spot for casual meetings.

I live close by and get delivery often. Almost everything I've tried from here is beyond amazing. I'm vegan and GF and there's tons of options even for me. The only reason they don't get five stars from me is because on many occasions they've messed up my order and forgot to bring a few things. They bring the items asap but don't give me a refund or anything like that. Even so it's worth it to me for their delicious food.

I'm vegan , my three boys are vegetarians and my husband is a meat eater and is quite challenging to find a place that we can all agree. This place gets a five  stars from all of us! Absolutely great food and nice/ relaxing atmosphere !!!! Definitely planing in coming back when we're town !

Stopped by to grab a sandwich for lunch - this place is awesome.  

Order the "WHAT WHAT" - mainly because when you do, they call out "Can I get WHAT WHAT?!" and it's hilarious.  

Hilarity aside, the food was great.  We had a couple dips and sandwiches and everyone (even our Gluten intolerant friend) was highly impressed.  Their gluten free bread is WAY better than most places.  

Stop by and grab a sammie, you won't be disappointed.

I have a confession: I actually made a Yelp account exclusively to write a review about the Bronze Cafe. Never have I felt so strongly about the integrity of a food establishment: light springy and flavorful kale salads, creamy smoothies filled with the kind of stuff that grew pop-eyes muscles before our eyes, and incredible baked goods that are so good they make me want to ... YELP!

Are you interested in eating healthier, or maybe trying to understand why people love vegan food so much? If so the Bronze Cafe is a place you need to bookmark, and take the time to check out. I could sit here and write paragraph after paragraph describing the Bronze Cafe's offerings, but let's just say this former Missouri cattleman who will never totally give up beef and dairy products was totally blown away by the Bronze Cafe. Two visits here literally kickstarted a dietary change for me that has inspired me to have more vegan offerings around the house. Vegan food doesn't have to suck.. the Bronze Cafe has turned my attitude towards vegan fare completely around. 

Pricing: Good food isn't cheap, but after having lunch here I've went back to work and noticed a difference in my energy levels and ability to get things done. Again...try their stuff...pay attention to what's in it...and let the Bronze Cafe show you there are alternatives out there! 

5 Stars. Yes, I hate giving out 5 Stars on Yelp reviews anymore. But it is what it is...and anything less than 5 Stars just doesn't seem appropriate.

This quaint sandwich shop is a hidden gem in Downtown Las Vegas! It is located in the LGBTQ Community Center and had me forgetting I was in Las Vegas and relaxed in no time.

I stopped by on my lunch break with a friend who is obsessed with the place (with good reason) and we both got the Green Goddess. It was fresh and light and I will be back!

I think I will try the Tree of Life or the Thai Chicken Salad next time. YUM!

We have dined here for lunch several times and almost always order the same 2 items, but I had my mind set on a nice healthy salad only to discover these are pre-made so we both ended up ordering our usual.  The Tree of Life, a vegan sandwich with roasted red peppers, avocado, mixed greens, house made pickled onions, cashew crema, Brazil nut crumble and mango cilantro ginger vinaigrette on pita flatbread for my wife.   I tossed thoughts of eating healthy to the wind and ordered the LGBTQ = house made bacon jam (Yes!), maple cured bacon (Yes!), basil aioli, mixed greens, lemon vinaigrette on a ciabatta roll.  Were these delicious?  Yes!

The staff here is amazing and I love the food! The tree of life is a must as well as loving v. Virginia. All of the pastries and vegan cheesecakes are really good too. If you're on the fence about what flavor to pick, they'll usually provide a sample. The center is a great place for lunch or to just hang out and read a book.

I had the earth pita and it was delicious.  My husband who is not a vegetarian was able to get a great turkey sandwich. I love the community vibe to the place but would not bring close-minded people since it is in a center for LGBTQ.

I went to lunch here with my mom and best friend today and we were definitely not disappointed. It's about 20 minutes away from us but well worth the drive. I had the complicated sandwich, it was sooooo good, sooo much bacon lol! The people working there were super nice and helpful as well. We will most definitely be coming back, plus they deliver any where for $1!

Great smoothies! Unfortunately they don't serve them after 10am. 
I usually get their food items delivered to my job so I don't know what their restaurant looks like. Though with delivery it can always be a little tricky, they tend to get my order wrong and they always miss their estimated delivery time.

The food overall is really great with good options.

I came here with some girl friends the other day to take a break from thrift shopping.  I remember for LGBTQ month at UNLV we had sandwiches provided by Bronze Cafe, and they were so good then.  Still the case today!

Located at The Center, this cafe serves up delicious sammiches guaranteed to leave you satiated and satisfied. One of my friends went to order and I ran to "the john" as soon as we got in, which were clean. Then out I went to get some grub.

There are so many options to choose from, and I couldn't choose one.  I knew I wanted something savory, and asked for some help from behind the counter.  The Guac & Mole was suggested which had avocado, vegan mole, carrots, cucumber, alfalfa sprouts, vegan ranch dressing and lemon vinaigrette all on ciabatta. I ordered the watermelon juice with chia seeds with it, too.  

One of my friends had got her food already and I waited patiently for mine.  My food came out and it was presented so nicely.  The sandwich was cut so perfectly and the salad looked so fresh.  I took one bite and could not stop. The mole to guacamole ratio was the bomb! Everything was paired so nice and the bread was toasted to perfection! My savory craving was met and surpassed. There is a certain temperature when eating sandwiches, sound silly, but not too cold, and not too hot like I'll be coming down with something in a few hours.  My teeth are also sensitive to extreme temps.  Luckily this was just right. I can't complain the slightest as I was completely happy with the temp. The juice was very refreshing as well.

We were all loving our sammiches! I didn't want my sammich to end, but unfortunately, all good things come to an end, and my sammich was gone. 

When we were walking out, I felt so good, like I made the right choice.  Not that heavy feeling when you eat something greasy. I can't wait until the next time I order my sammich!

I order from Bronze Cafe probably once a week because it's reliably great. I always get either the Cal Turkey or the Green Goddess Chicken Salad sandwiches. Both are great. The customer service is impeccable.

I absolutely love this place!  It's not too expensive, the food quality is really good & majority of it is healthy! I recently got transferred over to a new location for my job, & I was pretty bummed out because I had all of my "go to" lunch spots by my old store.  Luckily I came across some great reviews of the Bronze Café on yelp & I'm glad I can add this spot onto my new list of lunch spots.

The first time I came to this Café I got lost trying to find it.  I was expecting a stand alone café but it's actually inside a community center.  When you get inside, it somewhat resembles a student services center or library.

Now on to the menu, there were a ton of things I saw on the menu that I wanted to try but I went with the more popular items that were reviewed.

FOOD:

LGBTQ- A twisted version of the class BLT that we're all used to.  This one definitely takes the cake!  I love anything with bacon & this sandwich not only has strips of maple bacon, but also bacon jam spread onto their ciabatta bread.  I was a little hesitant about the cucumber but it actually compliments that sandwich and gives it that fresh little crunch when you eat it. I crave this sandwich often! (my favorite)

Green Goddess Chicken Salad Sandwich-  This sandwich was really delicious and although its chicken salad you don't feel the heaviness of a typical chicken salad in your stomach.

Hummus- Their hummus is really tasty & they serve it with warm pita bread.  It's a great side dish that only costs an additional $2.25 if you get a sandwich.  Sometimes I'll just get the hummus by itself and eat that for a light lunch.

Vegan Banana Boy Bait-  I'm not a fan of bananas or banana flavored items, but the Banana Boy Bait is an exception!  I sometimes just crave this and this alone, it could be a good snack or even a dessert.  It's not too sweet and the banana flavor isn't too overpowering.




DRINKS:

Vegan coconut almond blend-  This was the first drink I purchased here and I really liked the concept.  It's blended with coconut water and they added almond butter for texture.

But my all time favorite drink from the Bronze Cafe is the Matcha Green Tea Blended.  The drink is not too sweet and not too heavy, it's my favorite green tea smoothie I've ever had here in Vegas.
All my friends and everyone at my work told me this place is awesome and the yelp reviews are awesome too but 45 minutes for a damn sandwich and I got the wrong sandwich...far from awesome
Chef Peter is the best.  We order from here regularly and the food is always awesome!   Can't wait to go back!

This place is awesome. Got the David's Special salad and it's phenomenal, so many amazing flavors! Also the dirty bird blended, which is a Chai latte blended with espresso beans and I substituted almond milk, it's a great combination. Their soup of the day is a vegan coconut corn curry and it is also phenomenal! Great service, very friendly and fast! I'm not vegetarian or vegan but this food is great!

Awesome food and great service! Don't miss out on the 'sides'.. I got the hummus and lentils, which were both amazing. I ran out of pita bread but they were nice enough to give me more upon request. I would also highly recommend dessert.. I got some kind if strawberry bar (forgot what it was called) but it was delish.

I also ordered the good earth sandwich which had really fresh ingredients, but the flavor profile of the sauce was kind of weird for me, I think I would order it without it if I was ever to go back again (I'm not from Nevada). I also ordered the guacamole sandwich, which I liked better.. But the I would have to say the red sauce on it was too sweet for me. I split these with a friend and we both felt the same about these entrees. 

There was one other vegan sandwich option, tree of life, and I ordered all three for my boyfriend and his 2 other friends to split, and they liked the tree of life the best... So hopefully that helps!

I'm actually coming back tomorrow for lunch so of course I have nothing but great things to say.

staff is so cheerful (what what! whoop whoop!), fast, friendly, attentive service. I always get the fruity pebble rice crispy. and the many different flavors of chia pudding are a must! (Rose chia pudding??? NOM) The sides are absolutely delish too, every single one of them. Went a few weeks ago with about 5 people who had never been to Bronze and they all loved & devoured their food! Bring everyone you know! Seating is hard to come by, parking is not :)

You can get 10% off by checking in on social media

My lactose intolerant husband and I heard about this place while searching for local coffee shops and the more I read, the more we wanted to go right away! We knew what we wanted before we got there and even though they were closing in about 20 minutes (we'll never be late again, I swear!) they were happy to serve us. We ordered the LGTBQ, The Tree of Life Pita, The What What (for the kids), vegan blueberry cheesecake, watermelon chia juice and honeydew Q-cumber juice. While I didn't enjoy the watermelon juice, it's delicious, just not for me. It wasn't long before our order was served to us, the prices are pretty good and we got to experience the All Sexes Restroom! The food was excellent and my husband LOVED the cheesecake! Our family is happy to support what The Center does for the LGBTQ community and we'll be back!
The Tree of Life sandwich is amazing!  Not only is the food great but the staff is always friendly and knowledgeable.
Good healthy food. I got to tofurkey sandwich. It was good but I wish it had more tofurkey in it. Couldn't really taste it. Get vegetarian options
Tasty food and excellent service at this little cafe.  I'm impressed.
Strange location loads of street people.  Food was fairly healthy. Staff was excellent.

By far one of my favorite places in town for sandwiches, salads and great desserts. Food quality is amazing and there are vegan options that I (a non-vegan) love! The staff is always so helpful and kind. Every time I have gotten delivery they have been accurate with the order and on time. 

Be sure to try the Green Goddess sandwich and the apricot bars!

Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas! I stumbled upon Bronze Cafe a couple years ago after doing a search for "vegan" in Las Vegas, and I now eat here at least once a week. It's a great place for vegans and non-vegans as they have plenty of items with meat as well as without. Their produce as well as their baked goods are all fresh. The staff is always friendly. I'm not strictly vegan but I love vegan restaurants because they tend to have so much more flavor. Many vegan restaurants here in Vegas tend to miss that flavor boat so they tend to fail in comparison with vegan restaurants in LA (*drool). I can say with complete confidence that Bronze Cafe would do very well in LA even with the competition. 
The Tree of Life truly lives up to it's name, and if you are a meat eater, the Complicated hits the spot! All their juices are fresh with no added sugar!

First time here and I loved it :D my gf and I had The good Earth sandwich, more like a gyro and it was delicious, I had the watermelon chia water and it was really good and fresh  Definitely I'll be back soon so I can try some other good things :) 
The staff is more than friendly, they smile and make you feel comfortable, for first timers they are helpful. I really liked this place. Two thumbs up!!

Hard to find, and when you walk in might throw you off, but don't be detoured,  your moments from the best lunch in vegas I've ever had. SO coming back here for lunch tomorrow.  Five stars all the way

Great vegan option in dtlv. They also have a market that has a lot of difficult to find elsewhere products. I highly recommend the salad bar. As they say, 'they'll toss your salad if you ask nice' LOLZ!

Love Bronze Cafe at The Center for lunch! What an amazing place, the food is so good for such a small space! My favorite lunch is the Beet salad. Good healthy food that taste amazing! I love that I live so close.

This place hits the spot when I'm in the mood for something healthy yet flavorful. Not only is the food great, but the staff is always so genuinely nice. It's located downtown inside the LGBTQ community center. Not exactly the best of areas but don't let that scare you away. 

Everything I've tried has been delicious. I love the LGBTQ sandwich because, duh, bacon jam! Don't worry, the sandwich has plenty of veggies to help you curb the guilt. The vegan options are great as well. I had the tree of life pita just the other day and it was delicious. The sandwiches are served with a side of greens tossed in a lemon vinaigrette. I personally love sour but my boyfriend hates it. Even better for me because I get double the servings. Just a warning for those who hate tart flavors. Not sure if they have other options but you can always ask. 

In fact, if you're ever not satisfied, just let them know. I got one of those brownie/cookie things once, and it was rock hard. They were apologetic and happy to exchange it for something else. Love this place!

The employees are always in a good mood.  They suggest items if you have never tried them even letting me taste it to see if I like it.  Who does that?  Love the salads, all the vegan options too.   Always easy parking.  One of my fav's on the east side of town for lunch.

What a gem!  A total find in Las Vegas.  

Don't judge it by its location or easy and simple atmosphere... There's a few select items that pack an amazing punch with every bite that will blow its competitors out of the water. 

Loved the Tree of Life Pita - Even if you're not Vegan or Vegetarian, its a must try.  This is my personal favorite and go to.  The flavors are excellent together.

Thai Salad - Wonderful and yummy with great flavor

The Complicated order - If I feel like being bad, this is it.  Packed with loads of bacon (that I think are done in the oven because its not greasy) and turkey.  I couldn't put it down, but I was stuffed afterwards.

The other sandwiches were good, but the Tree of Life and Complicated order my favorites. 

Sides - some were better than others, but not because they were bad but they weren't as exciting as the sandwiches.  With flavors this good, you have a lot to live up to with each bite.  And they were great about letting us sample them. 

They also have a slow drip cold coffee device right by the register that looks fun... I don't drink coffee, but I was told it takes 8 hours to brew.

I love the service.  Even though its a simple cafe, they are great.  Super friendly and attentive.  A definite must try!  And the best part is they deliver.  

So, if you're stuck eating the nasty food at the convention center for a conference.  Just know that they deliver!

What a great place to hold an event or meeting . With the Bronze Cafe you will experience amazing and health conscious fresh food . OMG the Loving v Virginia cookie brownie is heaven , pure heaven . Don't EVEN get me started on the jalepeno cheddar scones . STOP it already . My mouth was full of loving , kind sexi , delicious cuisine . I am happy and grateful our conference was held at THE CENTER . The Bronze Cafe rocked my culinary world. ! Ty ty ty ! Best to you always . Bon Apetit. Get in here ! NOW .
This place is the BOMB! Vegetarian, vegan and meat dishes are all fabulous! Friendly and awesome staff makes the whole experience a pleasure! So happy to be a regular here!

The LGBLT is one of the best things I have ever put in my mouth! Leave your house NOW and go get one! They are always changing items, but the sandwiches stay the same, thank God!
 The service was awesome, and i would give more than 5 stars if it didn't feel like eating in a Doctors waiting room. Podiatrist, to be specific.
 The food is good, Gluten Free, Dairy free chocies, and a lot of healthy sides.
 New innovative drinks, everything we had was good.
 A little expensive, but the LGBLT!     Must.    Eat.
Had lunch here must say the Bacon chicken  chop chop salad was really good. And the staff are very friendly and nice.

Stopped her to grab a sandwich , it was very good! Even my three year old loves it , I also had a coconut almond smoothie which was very good. I def will come here again when I'm in this side of town.

Welcoming staff. Delicious sandwiches. We had the California Turkey and the Green Goddess Chicken Salad. Both were served warm on ciabatta with a lovely side of greens. The only thing I would have changed was the amount of dressing on the Green Goddess. Next time, I'll know to ask for it light.

Awesome, wholesome food in a little cute cafe tucked away in the LGBT center, I wonder how many people would miss this place because they never step into this center! 

Came here for lunch and everything was made to order. Although that is the case, service was very prompt and courteous, and the worker was able to answer any questions you would have. Tried the vegucated sandwich, which is the vegan version of a turkey bacon sandwich, with coconut bacon jam, avocado, tofurkey, vegan bacon, and lots of veggies, on a ciabatta--super delicious! It was very filling too, I actually just had a few sip of my soup and couldn't even manage more. Soup of the day was coconut curry, which was perfect for the rare rainy day we happened to be having that day.

Came here for the first time with my friend who'd been raving about it for weeks. The staff are really charming & helpful. I got the Tree of Life pita which was really flavorful and the pita bread was amazing. The vegan Coconut Almond smoothie is tasty and hydrating. This is another one of those places that make being vegan easy. 
Oh and we sang & played the Cups song with one of the staff workers!

The staff is very friendly and I've only had the Bizness salad which I give it a A+ yumm.. I'm for sure going back for the WhatWhat :) the ice coffee was good although not strong enough for me. They have a patio are that I will defiantly make sure to enjoy on a nice day :) also if it's your first time here do not look for a sign with the actual name because you're not going to find it I'll post a picture of the sign the you need to look for. I hope it helps someone.

Went there this morning with a couple friends who are locals. I encouraged us to go based on the incredible reviews and one of my friends who has gone really enjoyed it.. Needless to say we were not disappointed. 

First of all, we were warmly greeted by the manager David, who made it a point to ask us for all our names after we ordered. We came in just planning to get a few juices and smoothies, but left trying quite a few items on the menu. After ordering Raw Vegan Superfood smoothie (which is so tasty and creamy), we ended up staying for a lot longer.

First of all, the LGBTQ Sandwich - OK, I've had BLTs and I've had Bacon Jam. The housemade bacon jam is a godsend. There is nothing I've had like it, it's meaty, savory, smokey, and sweet. Get this sandwich!

David also made an off menu sandwich for us called "The Complicated Order", it's a GLBTQ crossed with "The What What" (which is a fantastic sandwich in itself). AWESOME, even better than the LGBTQ.

The scones we tried (Bacon Jam and Poblano Cheddar) as well as the Cinnamon Toast Crunch cookie and the Loving vs. Virginia (a brownie baked with a chocolate chip cookie on top) were all unique, but most importantly, incredibly tasty. 

We also sampled the Swedish Oatmeal, which was yummy along with being satisfyingly creamy and hearty.

We also had a chance to meet Paul, the chef and I made it a point to tell him how awesome everything is. Along with David, I'd definitely make it a point to stop by here whenever I'm in town. 

For a healthy or sinful snack or meal, you've got to check the Bronze Cafe out!

Hands down the best vegan food I have had to date so far. Not only was the food AMAZING and fresh and oh so yummy,  the staff was the friendliest ever! They have flavored fruit waters, desserts, coffee, salads, sandwiches and all looked so good! The owner/chef Peter was so friendly and humbled at our compliments. I can't wait to go back next time we are in Las Vegas!

Wow! Just love this place! I purchased a groupon for this cafe for a sammitch, cookie (of some sort, I got monkey bread) and a soup for 11 bucks and let me tell you that is a steal! This place is inside a LGBTQ center, when you first walk in bronze Cafe is right in your face. They have a variety of vegan/non-vegan items to eat and so my boyfriend got a turkey sammitch with bacon and I got the vegan the tree life of pita sammitch....with our mushroom soup (also vegan) and our dessert (vegan). Yeah it was pretty freakin awesome and one hella of a delicious meal! Everything was tasty and wouldn't change a thing! I really enjoyed the atmosphere of it all and especially the sharing of the restroom with everyone (yes there is stalls to do your business) but loved the place overall!

No wonder this place is five star. The food was fresh, extremely flavorful, and the staff went out of the way to accommodate us. 

 First off it was confusing pulling up to this place since we expected it to be a restaurant but it was inside of a community center. We walked in and the actual building itself was clean and modern. We ordered 2 sandwiches, which came with a side salad, and two sides. One being a spiced lentil and the other hummus with pita. No lie the entire meal was delicious. I mean we're talking almost worth driving to Vegas for. The best part is they were just sandwiches but they were prepared with such thought and proper fresh ingredients that it changed for me the idea that all sandwiches have to be boring. 

After we split a desert...amazing of course, and then ordered three more sandwiches to take back to the boys we were with. Surprise surprise they loved them too.

 I really loved the friendly staff and the truly satisfying meal. If your vegan or not everyone can enjoy this place.

Today was my second visit to Bronze Cafe at The Center.  My first trip was during a Las Vegan Eatz Dinner club event, where I (along w/ about 40 other people) enjoyed tastings of EVERY SINGLE VEGAN ITEM ON THE MENU!  I was thoroughly impressed!  While I'm a fan of chick'n & "beef" - I do also enjoy when a chef can create fabulously fulfilling delightful and flavorful food - without any of the "fake" items.

I've been meaning to go back (like every day since) but the location is a bit outside of my normal travels.  Today at work, it was "fried food" day at our company cafeteria/dining room.  I was craving something not so terrible for my diet - I wanted something FEEL GOOD.  So I decided to make the drive over to Bronze Cafe.

It was busy, but not overwhelming.  Seating inside is limited so I took my order to go and ate at the picnic tables outside.  I decided to order my favorite sandwich from my previous tasting event - which was the Guac & Mole.  People rave about it - so I just had to try it.  (PS Paul Graham from Eating Vegan in Vegas did a fantastic review on the joint (and this sandwich) - http://eatingveganinvegas.tumblr.com/post/56611156953/the-bronze-cafe-continues-to-share-the-love )

The Guac & Mole is a vegan sandwich on perfectly baked ciabatta bread (if they don't bake this stuff in house - I want to know where they get it! - filled with avocado, alfalfa sprouts, shredded carrots, cucumber, lemon vinaigrette, vegan mole, and house made vegan ranch.  I realized about half way through the sandwich that I was actually smiling while eating my meal - there you have it, my mouth was happy!

I also took two of their 'bars' to go (but quickly devoured them when I returned to my desk).  I chose the Vegan Almond Apricot Bar (crunchy, chewy, soft, gooey - all of those good things, all rolled into one!) and the Vegan Blueberry Bar (think blueberry muffin, but not greasy w/ a nice crisp top.

What's also great about this place is they also have plenty of non-vegan options for your meat eating friends!

FIVE STARS!  Fresh food, high quality products, unique offerings, and fast service!  I plan to return again and again and again and again.....

I am super insanely addicted to this place. I'm so happy my job is in downtown... it just makes it that much easier to satisfy my addiction :) I love the Tree of Life Pita - hands down it's the best thing on the menu. As a vegetarian, I'm not a big fan of just full-on vegetable sandwiches (since it's always so plain), but OMG this pita is ridiculously amazing even though it's just vegetables. I can't get enough! Paired with a carrot cake shake (that's so healthy and satisfying)... I'm in heaven! This is THE best place for breakfast, lunch or dinner, and the staff is always fantastic. I recommend trying it (if you haven't done so), even meat eaters I know enjoy their dishes (the Guac and Mole to be precise). You can also sit outside which is great during the year (I usually bring my pug if it's not too hot.. :)).

Bronze Cafe is the Bizness... er... Business.

I think Bronze Cafe may be my all-around favorite spot for a casual lunch (or dinner). Their sandwiches are out of this world. I'm a sucker for vegan/vegetarian friendly places as I'm generally not a huge meat-eater.

Their veg sandwiches are pretty great. They're more than just some vegetables slapped between some bread. They're flavorful & delicious! My favorite veg-friendly sandwich is the The Good Earth: roasted vegetables, spring mix, hummus, sprouts, lemon vinaigrette, and spicy sunflower seeds all on a soft & delicious pita. I like this over the Tree of Life Pita. My go-to non-veg sandwich here which I consider to be one of the most delicious sandwiches... well... in all of Las Vegas is called The Complicated Order. It's an LGBTQ (that's a sandwich) w/ avocado & turkey ;D That's housemade bacon jam, maple-glazed bacon, spring mix, tomato, basil aioli, and lemon vinaigrette, avo, & turkey on a toasted ciabatta. Much bun-love here. Much everything love.

They have salads and the usual cafe suspects. I really like their Bizness. It's a massaged kale salad base + any 3 sides. A little steep at $10 but it's still worth it to me. It's mighty delicious and you get a pretty healthy serving. You really can't find better vegetarian food in Vegas. It's rare and hard to come by here. This ain't LA people! My favorite sides are the beet salad, roasted mushroom, roasted potatoes. Skip the curry quinoa. But really, there's so much mix & matching possibilities just try whatever sounds good to you. Their sides menu is huge! You're bound to find something you'll like. 

In addition to their relatively large food menu, they also have some great drink selections. Pineapple Mint Chia anyone? Also have protein shakes and other blended drinks for your post-workout reward. The Real Results shake is vegan & gluten free. It's quite delicious: housemade almond milk, kale, PB, vegan protein, dates, cacao, maca, & flax. Whew, that's a mouthful. It really is. More like a meal replacement. All delicious.

Just dropped in for a quick bite with a client. Hip vibe, with a tasteful interior. Books, zines, sofas, row of laptops (for public use?) all I had was the quiche which was a single serving size popping with pesto and sun dried tomato flavor atop a delicate crust. Also had a bite of a cookie that certainly had a home made flair to it. All and all great experience.

I honestly cannot say enough good things about Bronze Cafe. I have ordered delivery from them more times than I can count (20-30 maybe? I'm in Vegas every week for work) and they've ALWAYS been wonderful. Their staff is so lovely and they always go above and beyond. The food is wonderful. I highly recommend The Bizness salad, The Green Goddess chicken salad sandwich and their superfood smoothie. It's all so so delicious and healthy :) I'm obsessed, I know..

We will definitely be coming back! I wish this place was closer to us but it is definitely worth the 25 min drive. We got two vegan and one meat sandwich and no one left anything on their plates! Best sandwich I ever had. Please come here you will not be disappointed!

Omg! I LOVE this place! It was my first time ordering from here but I was sold over the pics on Yelp and knew it was something I needed to try! I ordered the Vegucated order and I am so very please! I also had the Brussels sprouts and red potatoes and strawberry cookie! Everything perfect!

Oh my, what are these guys doing?  Ridiculous!  I am here for the weekend in LV on a business trip.  Decided to try this place out.  The food is AMAZING!! I don't even know how you can make such a delicious sandwich and side.  Wow, I am speechless.  I tried the Complicated Order Sandwich with a side of Roasted Sweet Potatoes.  I wish these guys were in Orange County, CA where I reside.  If you guys ever want to open one there, I will partner with the restaurant opening.  Great food, highly recommend this restaurant!

I've been coming to the bronze cafe for a few years now. Not very regularly, but back before they had opened their second location.

One thing hasn't changed- their consistently good for you and great tasting food, and their awesome customer service. I've never ventured outside of The Bizness but today I'm ordering the David's Special. 

My husband loves The Complicated- it's huge. You definitely get your bang for your buck here, which I always love. And I never feel guilty for ordering take out here as well. Win win! 

There are so many vegan, gluten free and veg options. There are also non vegan, gluten free and veg options. Don't forget to grab a smoothie and a treat to go :).

I've been at meetings at The Center.  Great meeting place.  With The Bronze Cafe there, we can eat great food while in the meetings.  Friendly staff, tasty food and good prices.  If I worked closer, I would use this as a lunch place for myself and a place to meet clients at.

Excellent customer service and the food was wonderful!  I got the Green Goddess Chicken Salad sandwich, and it was delicious. We also had the Tree of Life pita sandwich, which is a vegan option. It was amaze balls. 

Pro tip... Try the cold brew coffee.

I've eaten the food here several times and was a huge fan of the amazing sandwiches and ice blended drinks here. This place would normally get a solid 5 star review from me, but heres why they "generously" got a 2 star only. My friend ordered the "California Turkey" and I got the "Complicated Order" which both have turkey in it. We both got the ice blended chai as well. Then within about an hour later when we got home, we both started feeling nauseous and sick and showed signs of food poisoning... I mention also that I have a very strong stomach and don't normally ever get sick from food when other people who ate the same food has in the past. We also are not allergic to anything and Bronze Cafe was literally the only food we have had all day.

I called the cafe and wanted to just let them know we got sick from the food so they dont make anyone else sick because that would be awful. The young man who answered was very polite and said he would let the manager know. A few moments later surprisingly the manager called back and said they were going to check all the ingredients and was extremely apologitic and gave a full refund on the order ticket even though I didnt ask for it which was very nice of them. 

I can see how maybe an ingredient that was "off" might of been served to us. As some of the staff look very young (some look younger than 15 years old) they probably werent trained on proper food preparation or have the attention to detail required to safely handle food? It's a shame really, because the sandwiches here are outstanding and delicious. 

It'll take some time for us to have the courage to come back here and eat. Getting sick from eating out isnt a laughing matter and has to be taken seriously! Thankfully the manager handled it with us in a very professional and courteous manner.

Sometimes places just "get you" and Bronze is one of those places. The people behind the counter, the culture of The Center, the fantastic salads/cookies/juices/coffees, it's just all so perfect. I can't get enough. You have to love a place where they remember your name and treat you like a human, instead of a number. So much love for Bronze.
This place is my first choice for office lunches & pretty much anytime I'm downtown.  I've had nothing but delicious food & top notch service, every time!  :)

I love everyone who works here they are so friendly and welcoming! Being here today definitely made my day!!:) 

I ordered the bizness and also the green goddess what a perfect combo the meat is so good and the bizness has its nice lemon flavor. It's so healthy it's perfect. 

Definitely worth the drive!

We've visited Bronze Cafe a few times after a good workout. We love the vegan items on the menu. We had the Tree of Life Salad, chocolate and fig smoothie (it was a little too sweet for my taste), banana bread (delicious), The Bizness and a few veggie drinks for the kids. The staff has always been consistently gracious and helpful. The wait time was not too long (during lunch rush hour), and we were able to grab a few tables located within the center. The prices are comparable to the prices for vegan food in my hometown of "San Francisco", so don't be shocked with the overall tab. I guess one could never place a price tag on good, healthy food. Also, the order counter and register checkout placement is a bit oddly configured (goes from left to right - and you have to maneuver around small tables to get to the counter to order). Regardless, I'm a fan, and I love the addition to the LGBT center. 

Tip(s): 1. The smoothies can be rather large in size, so we asked someone on staff if we can split the chocolate and fig into two portions, and they gladly accommodated our request. However, this can't be done with all smoothies - not sure why, but do inquire ahead of time, 2. The cafe is located within The LGBT Center, so be sure to look out for the exterior sign which can easily be missed on a 1-way street, 3. They have a points / rewards program - just ask.
This place is great and the staff Is so friendly.  They have a lot of healthy options and a vegan menu.

"That sandwich was so good I forgot I was in Vegas." - my friend, aptly summing up our experience upon leaving Bronze Cafe

Stopped in with 2 friends for a Welcome-to-Vegas-lunch because we had a bit of time to kill before our hotel was ready for us to check in. Couldn't have been more impressed with all the options, and the staff was so welcoming I thought we might stay all day just to chat.

Between the three of us, we ordered:
-- the California turkey with the most delicious gluten free bread that has ever existed!!
-- the Complicated that comes with a bacon jam I could eat every day for the rest of my life
-- and the Guac and molé with the additional spicy jalapeño cilantro vinaigrette, which is not to be missed.

The range of breakfast and dessert items looked almost too good to pass up, but the sandwiches (which all came with a yummy side salad) were more than enough to fill up on.

The cafe is a bit hard to find, as they're not allowed to promote/have a lot of signs because of their association with a nonprofit. It is so worth it though, and once you find it, I'm sure you'll return! I will definitely be back on my next Vegas trip.

Why did no one tell me the Bronze Cafe was located inside the LGBTQ Center? Here I was circling around and around the Center looking for a stand alone establishment like an idiot. I had to pull up the Yelp app to figure out where this place was. Guess I should've read some reviews before stopping by lol. Derp :P

THE GOOD EARTH PITA ($9.95): A veggie pita that was "too healthy" for my tastes. I like grease and fried food and am probably the most unhealthy vegetarian that has ever existed, but hey, that's just me. The pita was loaded with an assortment of cold veggies and spilling over with each bite. The best parts of the pita were the sunflower seeds and hummus. 3/5   

VIBE: Reminded me of the cafeteria at a hospital. There's a few large tables seating 4+ people available and sofas further out. I would feel kind of awkward eating here by myself since Bronze Cafe seems more so geared towards groups. 

SERVICE: No complaints here. The ordering style is exactly like Starbucks. 

PRO TIP: Military & Students get a 10% discount.

Worth a Return Visit?
My fellow Yelpers obviously disagree with me here but it's unlikely that I'll return to Bronze Cafe. The prices are expensive for what you're getting. However, if you're into eating healthy and like soup, salad, and sandwich places, the Bronze Cafe is worth looking into it.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #101

Items Selected:
Vegan Kale Apple Banana Blended Shot
Double Espresso on Ice
The Fruity Pebbles Treat
The Bacon Jam Scone
The Peanut Butter Snickerdoodle Cookie
The Strawberry Cookie
The Oatmeal Craisin Cookie
The Chocolate Banana Zucchini Muffin
The Loving v. Virginia - the legal marriage between a cookie and a brownie
The Banana Flax Cake

Located within the Gay and Lesbian Community Center of Southern Nevada, a space more commonly referred to simply as "The Center," Bronze Café had long been on my list of places to visit and seeking coffee plus free WiFi near downtown on Saturday I finally decided to drop in, the smiling staff greeting me warmly as I entered while several patrons sat throughout the atrium using a bank of supplied computers or looking through literature supplied in a small library toward the back of the room.

Admittedly located in a rough part of Las Vegas, the surrounding environs largely comprised of rundown housing with no shortage of panhandlers to be found on the streets, the interior of The Center seems to act as a sort of sanctuary to those in the community and with free services available ranging from HIV-testing to prevention and sex education the environment is both open and inviting, the electronic music overhead perhaps a bit of a distracter but certainly not so loud that it cannot be ignored.

Offering a selection of soups, salads, sandwiches, baked goods, and smoothies running the gamut from mundane to esoteric with options for vegetarians, vegans, and those dining gluten free in addition to several options featuring meat, it was entirely in the pastries that my investigation of the café's goods was undertaken and treated to a vegan smoothie shot as I waited for coffee to be brewed I'll admit I was pleasantly surprised, the apple and banana with light vanilla doing an admirable job of offsetting the bitterness oft associated with the greens.

Sipping the espresso over ice, a bold brew with a nutty finish at less than half what one would pay for Starbucks on the Strip, it was with seven items plus a gifted Fruity Pebbles Treat from owner David Mozes that the tasting took place and beginning the rainbow treat a theme of strong flavors and excellent textures quickly arose, any 'artificalness' associated with the commercial cereal completely lacking in a vegan strawberry cookie with a jam center that ranks amongst the best in the city with a pudding smooth mouthfeel and light creamy top-notes.

Trying best to progress light-to-rich it was next in the slightly dry oatmeal cookie that I partook and setting this aside in favor of hopefully better things a bite of the bacon-jam scone proved to be far softer than one might expect from the British tea-time staple, though the savory jam and ample use of butter was none-the-less quite delicious beneath a light sprinkling of sugar with subtle sweetness dispersed beneath.

Entirely impressed by the peanut butter riff on a Snickerdoodle with ample cinnamon and sugar helping to mellow the otherwise rich base it was with equal balance that fruits and vegetables interacted to create the ultra-moist chocolate zucchini bread with the sort of richness that spoke to high quality cocoa, the similarly soft banana-flax cake perhaps a better choice for those desiring something more subtle with a light nuttiness from the fractured seeds coming through on the finish but not a bit of oil or bitterness to be found.

At this point seeing the soundtrack transition to upbeat Spanish dance music as a large group of teens plus a young family with grandparents in-tow sat down to breakfast it was finally in "The Loving v. Virginia" that I indulged and having previously tasted no fewer than a dozen takes on the cookie-meets-brownie including Brooklyn's famous "Brookie" from Baked I'm confident to say that the version at Bronze Café may be the very best of them all - the chocolate base reminiscing of my childhood afternoon snack while the dollop of dough at the center was just seconds short of fully set, the whole far greater than the sum of its parts and something probably best shared, or at least enjoyed with a cup of coffee, milk...or in the case of Bronze Café, perhaps some almond mylk. 

Setting aside a location that some may find a bit intimidating for any number of personal misperceptions, Bronze Café is the sort of place that is likely to go overlooked by all but those who walk through the doors of The Center, but with strong sourcing, friendly service, and a menu as inclusive as the building in which it is housed it can only be said that there is a whole lot more here than meets the eye, and a whole lot of things to tantalize the tastebuds as well.

This place is a vegan lovers dream! I wish that all the McDonald's in the world could be replaced with the Bronze Cafe. The Tree of Life pita has SO much flavor and it's extremely filling.   My husband had the Good Earth pita, which he throughly enjoyed. We were supposed to split both  'sammiches,' but neither one of us were willing to part from them.

What a treat to find somewhere to get my green smoothie fix! Super friendly and helpful staff. A welcome change of pace from the normal food offerings of vegas. I got the real results fitness smoothie and added kale it did not disappoint and tasted like a peanut butter cup! Yummy! I hope this isn't my last time at Bronze Cafe but good thing they deliver to my hotel.

Wow! My first experience at the cafe was back in November of 2014. I wanted to write a review then, but failed miserably due to 'out of sight out mind' syndrome... I am writing now because I will be back in Vegas in a few weeks and very eager to head back.
     The atmosphere and food are incredible! If you're expecting a 5 star culinary and service experience you're in luck! If you're expecting 5 star dining experience (i.e. linens, china, and metal forks) you will not experience that. However, that is the charm! You are eating extremely wonderful culinary cafe masterpieces on paper plates using plastic ware sitting on folding chairs [at the time] in the open layout lobby and library of one of the most welcoming community atmospheres I have ever experienced!
     If you are planning a trip to Vegas and looking for a beyond delightful, borderline blissful, palatable experience you must make the very small effort it takes to get there. If you are local to the area and haven't eaten there yet, what are you waiting for?!

I'm NOT Vegan or Vegetarian  ..... but this place was crazy good!! I'm in town on business and wanted to try something healthy so when this came up on my interweb search I said why not. 
It's not the easiest place to find. But worth figuring out its the building right at the intersection in the middle - 
The staff member I talked with was super helpful and offered a sample of the soup of the day - chili, yum! I got the tree of life pita and oh man was this thing good. It was so good in fact that I'm going back there again today for lunch. The apple banana date smoothie was also excellent. Price is not much more than going for a burger and fries but even though I was full I never felt heavy. You have to try this place
Tree of Life Pita!!! Just as good the second time. Also tried the watermelon water, possibly the best thing I have had in a very long time :) Thanks Chef Peter and David

Love the quality of the food, coffee and comfort of the space! This going to be a new favorite spot for healthy vegan choices!
UPDATE: 6-7-13 I have been coming here since inception and it just keeps getting better! I have dined in some of best restaurants in the world and the food here is 5 star. They owners have the magic ingredient...love.
If you are looking for the best, stop here!

Top notch service and innovative food! Delicious! Unique drinks and excellent coffee shop selections.  Some days I feel the need to go Vegan or vegetarian and I run here! Also desserts are scrumptious!

"That smoothie was so good I almost stole it from Cathy" - a very daring statement from my sister. Take my money, take my boyfriend...I'll get over it. Take my food? You want war!

After a nice morning at the gym, my sister and I finally went here after months of talking about it. I keep hearing positive comments about this place. They have vegan, gluten-free and regular options. But fear not, they have bacon if that's your thing.

Coconut Almond Blended:
I absolutely have a strong dislike of anything coconut. But with my lucky experiences of getting something I hate and ending up liking it (for the past few months) inspired me to get this. Well, I can add this to the list. It tasted like a very mild horchata. Pleasantly and surprisingly delicious! 5/5

Kale Apple Banana Smoothie:
The taste of kale reminds me of a fruit I ate when I was little, Spanish plum. So drinking kale + other fruits isn't foreign to me. This was a little sweetness to it and a nice tart flavor. 5/5

Iced Coffee:
I'm not a big coffee drinker but THIS was good. It takes them 8 hours to make. It wasn't bitter and I didn't feel the need to add anything to it. 5/5

The Hummus:
Comes with warm pita and olives on top. I ate around the olives since I'm allergic to them. Freshly made and delightful. 4/5

The Agrodolce Brussels Sprouts:
Roasted Brussels sprouts with Italian sweet and sour vinaigrette. The sprouts looked a bit overcooked but when you eat them, they still have that crunch. The vinaigrette was a bit tangy and refreshing. 5/5

The Curried Quinoa:
Quinoa, dried cranberries, almonds, parsley with sweet curry. Lots of textures and flavors. Quinoa and almonds are good non-meat protein sources minus LDL's. Cranberries are good for the ladies. 5/5

The Bizness:
Chopped kale with lemon vinaigrette. You can pick and choose 3 side items or roasted chicken / bacon / avocado to put in this salad. So, if you get a combo that sucks then, it's your fault! Accountability 101. But no worries, all the sides they have are good. 5/5

The Banana Boy Bait:
This got me singing "hey you're such a pretty boy. Hey you're such a pretty boy. You're so pretty". Banana bread with natural sweeteners. The top has a little crunch to it. They bring it to you hot. Yuuuuuummm!!! I was supposed to split this 50/50 with my sister but quickly ended up at  60/40 - she caught me before it went to 80/20. "I'm saving you from calories." 5/5

This is located inside The Center which is a LGBTQ facility. They have books and computers with internet. They have their own parking lot which is a big deal because I'm not a fan of paying for parking! I love this place!!!

Awesome sandwiches - for meat eaters as well!  Try the LGBTQ - best BLT!  Their delivery service is quite handy and prompt.  Location itself has a nice sitting area if you have time to linger.  Get any sandwich on the ciabatta - can't go wrong.  Also enjoy the strawberry cookie.

Excellent service and recommend the LGBTQ sandwich.

Food is the freshest in Las Vegas.

I travel to Vegas for work, & my first stop is Bronze Cafe. I'm obsessed with this place! What a find! The bizness salad is so fresh & incredible. Their lemon dressing makes healthy eating to die for! And since they cater to gluten & dairy-free, I always order their unique & delicious "cheese" cakes! It doesn't hurt that the staff is super sweet, too!

Thank you Bronze Café! The food is fresh, clean, flavorful and quick. In addition to great carnivore options it is a great for the plant based eater (vegan).  I had the Asian Marinated Kale Salad. I was not left wanting.  The co-owner, David, provided me with a tasting of the sides and they were delicious. There is definitely something for everyone.  I was provided a tasting of the vegan strawberry cheesecake and the vegan banana cream pie -WOW.  I now have a place to go when I am downtown for meetings or on the weekends.  Run by a Chef and it shows.  Their Grand Opening is tomorrow, April 6, 2013.  Other things of note: plenty of parking and delivery available soon to downtown businesses/locations(What a plus!), this is a grab and go location so no wait staff but some seating available inside and outside (no shade covers outside)  I have not sampled the coffees yet...headed back very soon with my soon to be husband as soon as he returns from his business trip!

Amazing. Just amazing food. Really nice staff too. Wish they had a location in North Las Vegas too! I can not say enough about this place. Every time I go, it's consistently delicious. Its very hard to find really good vegetarian and vegan food!

I think I have found myself a new place for Vegan friendly cuisine without having to feel like an outcast for eating meat on most days. The service here is quick and incredibly friendly. 

At first we were confused because we thought it would be a sit down restaurant. Instead it is more like a cafe within the new LGBTQ Center. That is not a deterrent for me to come back here. I would love to find out if they do volunteer projects here because it would be another reason to eat here again.

The roasted vegan sandwich served on wheat bread is good, but I would change it out to the pita the next time. Add a side for $2 and it is a full meal. While we were hanging out, the staff came around with samples of their green smoothie. I am a huge fan of kale in my drinks. I do not care if it is the predominant flavor. Yet this one, you will not be able to taste the leafy bitter greens. The apples and banana sweetens it up to where it is undetectable. 

Now when are we going back?

This place is wonderful. There are plenty of vegan and non-vegetarian options to go around. The sandwiches are great, the soups are always fresh and homemade, the baked goods and drinks are awesome and the staff are super-friendly and helpful. For a place to eat lunch, have a meeting or grab something to go, you can't go wrong here.

I only get to come here during the fashion trade show at the Las Vegas convention center, I really wish there was a bronze cafe in LA, I would be all over that! I love the healthy options they offer, my favorite by far is the what what sandwich! One of the best sandwich I have ever had. Love that it comes with a green salad on the side , with the best dressing ever. I even add some to the sandwich. I've also had the hummus, taste so fresh. Recommend this place to anyone.

I typically try to wait until I have a few experiences with a restaurant before jumping into a review.   So much can change from visit to visit that I always find it a bit presumptuous to assume that a place is 5 stars worth of awesome or 1 star worth of non-awesome based on one measly visit.   And yet one measly visit to the Bronze Cafe, oh, 2 hours ago, and here I am anointing it with 5 stars.   

Enter the Tree of Life.   The Tree of life stars Brad Pitt in a Malick film about the life and the universe.   Yelp/RottenTomatoes Crossover alert!   Okay so this Pita stuffed with veggies and other vegan goodies like a cashew crema and a brazil nut crumble has nothing to do with the movie, but much like I had left the theater after seeing Tree of Life, I had a lot of questions about this Tree of Life after I left Bronze Cafe.   Namely:  was that one of the tastiest pita breads I've ever had? (yes).    Did I really just enjoy a Pita stuffed without any meat products?  (yes).   Did I really just order something called "Banana Boy Bait"?  (YES)   Well how I really ordered it was I said something along the lines of "and one of those banana bread things".    Then the guy who seemed to be running the joint goes "Banana Boy Bait?!"  to which I looked around sheepishly before saying yes.   It's totally worth any stares you might receive though.   It lasted all of 3 minutes on the table.   I'm not joking when I say I plan to try every sandwich and every Vegan dessert on the menu before my own personal Tree of Life wilts away and has me feasting on dirt and worms.   

Service was friendly, quick and efficient.   The dining area was clean and there wasn't any air of pretentiousness that I think Vegan friendly places can oftentimes be stereotyped with.   In fact it was the complete opposite.

I didn't need to use the restroom so I didn't get to participate in the gender neutrality that it provides.   The thought excites me though because I've heard from some of my female friends that sometimes you all have couches in there sometimes and I'm curious how this translates here.  I've got my fingers crossed for a La-Z-Boy recliner personally.

Regular delivery orderer here and will no longer be trying to figure out ways to order $50 worth of salads and sandwiches to wait 3hours for my order and not be informed that they're running late. Thanks Bronze Cafe for the good food but horrible service. Maybe the prices should reflect a little on the service side. Whoever runs this cafe shouldn't dream of running a restaurant, because you can't run a simple cafe. Thank you.

Loved the vibe of this place. It was so peaceful and plenty of spaces to sit. Their smoothies are insanely good and you can get almost anything in them. Great for a meal on the go. They had good wifi and was a great place to work.
Awesome if you are looking for a healthy option in vegas. Delivered to our hotel room and food was great. Will order from them again if in Las Vegas.
This food is fucking incredible. The people behind the counter are always so nice. Everything is FRESH and they even offer student discounts!!! Can't recommend this place enough.

The combination of an impressively creative menu, super friendly staff and quality food makes the Bronze Cafe one of the best eateries in town.

I love their attention to detail in their recipes. Nothing is halfway done. The bacon jam is a perfect example of how they have elevated their take on a BLT (the LGBTQ) and made it an exception sandwich. I regularly crave this "bacon experience" and recently found out that you can get it in salad version. Super exciting.

Everything I have tried has been delicious. Other than the LGBTQ, I particularly enjoy the Matcha Blended Latte, the beet, quinoa and kale salad and the lentil carrot salad.

The highlight of every meal here is the sweetness of the staff. Plus there is free wifi

So so good.  We used Uber eats to have the food delivered.  My only complaint is their online menus lack descriptions of the meals.  However, if you go there in person I doubt that would be a problem.  Biz salad is soon yummy!

I love this place, they have vegan and veggie options as well as some meat plates. Everything is so fresh and yummy! The Tree of Life is by far the best dish for Vegans- but the cheesecake. Oh the cheesecake. They have different flavors all the time, so don't expect to get the one you want- the ones I have tried are the Green Tea, Chocolate, and Raspberry. They are by far the best vegan cheesecakes I have ever had. Ever.

Now for the drinks, the honeydew, watermelon, pineapple, and cantaloupe. Honeydew is the most refreshing in my opinion, not too sweet or powerfully flavorful. Watermelon is good, but sweet, and the pineapple is tasty, but also sweet. They are all really good and a great alternative to sodas or powered waters since they are fresh squeezed with no added sugar or water.

They also no have a new item, the Chocolate Ambrosia Sandwich with white chocolate raspberry bread for less than 5$ and it is to DIE FOR. GAH, it's like eating a little bit of Angel wing, if an Angel's wing tasted like AWESOMENESS. Get it, it's worth it.
OMG!! The "Tree of life is delicious! !! And I don't feel guilty at all!! Also the blueberry scone was great! Everything was so fresh. I couldn't take a picture because I ate it all too fast!

Found this place looking for vegan options while driving through Las Vegas. This place is pretty cool, located in the LGBTQ center for Nevada, off the craziness of the strip. Everyone was super friendly, and loved the no-gender bathrooms. 

The food was pretty good, though the price for what you got wasn't the best. The vegan sandwiches were around $10, and most of it was lettuce. They did put a decent amount of avocado in, and the vinaigrette and cashew crema on top were tasty, but the crema was only barely dribbled on. I was hungry again within an hour of eating. Again - really liked the sandwich, but it just was not very substantial. If they were more like $7, I'd have no complaints.

They do have nice coffee, and will refill your cup within 2 hours of purchase. They also don't charge extra for almond milk, which is amazing! They also have vegan cheesecake and some other muffins, though I didn't try any.

Overall, a nice place if you're looking for some decent vegan options as a snack in Las Vegas.

If I hadn't done the proper yelp research on this place I would never have known it was here nor would I have been able to find it. But I like it that way, this is one of those places you wanna keep all to yourself. I'm not vegan, however I really appreciate great vegan food. My friend and I came here for lunch and to begin with the staff there is amazing!!!! Everyone behind the counter was super friendly and knowledgeable and they gave us samples!! We ended sharing a tree of life pita, a cup of mushroom soup and two of their fruit chia drinks. Everything was fresh and delicious. The pita bread is even baked fresh from a local bakery. This was a great find, and I can't wait to go back and try everything else!

Found this cafe through a co-worker (shout out to Kendall) which is a little hard to spot at first since its inside "The Center" and it has not indications that there is a café inside the building. I saw people coming out the building with brown bag's so I assumed there was a café inside. Upon walking in, I was courtesy greeted and ordered a vegan Tree of Life since it was the most popular which was great when your looking for a healthy option. The order took a about 15 minutes to get out to me, and they gave me a free chia blueberry pudding for the inconvenience. On my second trip I ordered my boss, my co-workers various food from there, and have to say that I will be going back until I try out the entire menu!
This is a great place for light lunches. The people who work here are sweet and helpful. This is also a great venue for meetings.

Just got home with my delicious salad and double chocolate/peppermint (!) cookie. Grabbed a Mexican coke too (real sugar!) the gentlemen working the counter were sweet as pie and I ran into a few people I knew from the neighborhood when I was waiting a quick minute for my cookie to be warmed (?!) A super chill spot to have your snack on premises as well. Bronze Cafe is snacks
The Bizness Davids Special with TVP add and switch to peanut dressing was delicious! I look forward to trying it again when in town.

My friends and I went here because it has great vegan options for us! I ordered the Tree of Life sandwich, while my two friends ordered the Guac & Mole and The Bizness. We all also ordered a blended drink that was chai, espresso, and substituted milk for their Almond Mylk. It was delicious!!

The service was great-- it wasn't very busy at the time, and they took the time to explain the menu to us. Will be back again for brunch sometime in the future!

Superb lunch spot. Everything homemade and delicious. The soup of the day was outstanding  - one of the best soups i've ever had.  The atmosphere is cafeteria style, but who cares with food this healthy and delicious.  A real find in the glitzy and gritty streets of Vegas.

This is the vegan/vegetarian-friendly cafe you have been searching for since you got to Vegas.  Their menu is healthy, creative, and DELICIOUS.  The staff here is so warm and efficient, and the space is cozy with ample parking at The Center each time I have been here.  I love you, Bronze Cafe!

So good! I had David's salad (all veg) which I ate for lunch and dinner and he had the Complicated order. Both were so good. His sandwich was on the yummiest ciabatta which was soft and crispy and had bacon jam that was to die for. I love the location and the staff are super sweet. I will be back!
Such amazing fresh food! My favorite is the California Turkey sandwich. Their salad dressing is amazing too.

Another bookmarked place down.  I have been wanting to come here for a while and finally got the chance, meeting a gal pal for lunch.  Many tasty-sounding items on the menu, but I had my heart set on the Tree of Life pita sandwich and it did not disappoint.  We both ordered the seasonal Pumpkin Superfoods Blended, which is now renamed the SuperCALABAZAlisticexpialidocho with "..pumpkin, housemade almond mylk, banana, dates, chia seeds, flax seeds, and Chef Peter's special fall blend of warm holiday spices."  Blended together, it is one satisfying drink that tastes like the fall season.  
Chef Peter and his staff are so friendly and the food is fresh.  I've never been to the Center before, but I know I'll be back after this visit; there's so much more on the menu to try.

This place is great! Friendly service, free samples of the sides, reasonable prices and delicious vegan and non-vegan food! I had the BLT, and the bacon was absolutely perfectly cooked and had an amazing flavor! The babaganoush was a good smoky accompaniment to my sandwich. I also had the curry quinoa, which i could have eaten a bowl of, it was sweet and spicy and healthy. Finished with a warm cookie that tasted like the best cookies from home. I'm definitely coming back!

I have stopped by the Bronze Cafe a couple times and I have always had an amazing experience. The Tree of Life pita was delicious and filling. This place is truly a gem in Las Vegas. 
The espresso drinks are delicious and the beet salad was great. Everything I've tried at this cafe has been delicious. 
The customer service is also incredible. Everyone is really nice and very helpful. I will definitely be back and I recommend it to everyone. Delicious and fresh.

I didn't know what to expect when I got here. It was a bit smaller than what I expected and I wasn't sure what to get. Fortunately, one of the nice employees recommended the "what-what" sandwich, add bacon, and add bacon jam. Damn Gina sold! I don't even know what bacon jam is, how it's made, or what's in it. I don't really care I just know it was one of the best sandwiches I have had in a long ass time. I think there was a salad in the container too but I don't remember because I was too busy looking for leftover bacon bits and jam.

This cafe lives up to its hype.  Sandwiches and salads are amazing as are the green drinks and smoothies.  I recommend the Beet salad and the Good Earth pita.  Lots of vegan and vegetarian choices as well as hearty heathy breakfast items.  The modern bathroom is a trip.  Not for the homophobic.  Staff is friendly and entertaining.  A little pricey for a cafe.
Excellent employees. Groupon brought us here. Inviting environment will bring us back.

I love to eat a vegan/vegetarian meal out. I have eaten at the Bronze Cafe twice and both times I ordered .THE BIZNESS Thinly chopped kale massaged with our house-made lemon vinaigrette and topped with roasted beet/corn/curried quinoa.  Delicious! I am looking forward to trying  their sandwiches, soups and sides. I will be back for more.

From the looks of it, you probably wouldn't expect much from this cafe.  Usually the cafes you find in an office-type building are average at best.  Looking at their menu may not sway you either, since salads and sandwiches tend not to sound so exciting, especially when they're focused towards health.  Bronze Cafe will dash all your expectations in a good way.  The food here is superb.  I was lucky enough to sample various things off their menu and everything I tried was delicious.  The ingredients are fresh and the way Chef Peter brings them together is amazing.  My absolute favorite item was the David's Special; I wish I could eat this salad every day.  The Tree of Life Pita was another highlight, even as someone who usually sticks with meaty foods.  The smoothies are as amazing as the food, especially the pumpkin one.  It was delectable dessert in a cup.  And their actual desserts don't fail either, even the vegan ones (which I'm usually skeptical of).  My favorite was the peanut butter snicker doodle, I wish I was eating one right now.

I really wish there was a Bronze Cafe near me because I'd get to eat healthy, delicious food all the time.  So get yourself here as soon as you can!
I'm so glad we came here! The LGBTQ is amazing. And I've never had a salad like this before. Delicious! You have to come here to try the salads, sandwiches and the desserts!

It doesn't get any more hipster than this.  Kale salads in an LBGTQ center. 
.
