Ordered online through EAT24 and then picked up on Tuesday 2-2-16 at 5:15 PM.  This is not really a restaurant, it's more like a small cafe inside "The Center" which is located on Maryland between Charleston and Fremont St.  The center is unique in that it is very LBTGQ friendly and has gender neutral bathrooms.  
.
$26.64 got me a bizness salad, a David's special salad, and a strawberry cookie. 
.
$9.95 The bizness salad is just a bed of kale with their lemon vinagrette "massaged" into the kale and then you pick three sides to go on top of the kale.  I opted for ranch dressing instead of the vinagrette and picked roasted broccoli and hemp hearts, carrot & lentil salad, and curried quinoa.  A nice young man from the cafe called me after I placed my order and said they discontinued the carrot and lentil salad and today I see they have removed it from their menu on EAT24 so kudos to them for that.  I chose brown rice instead of the carrot salad.  When I got home I noticed the broccoli was missing but I went back and checked my order and it wasn't on there so either I forgot to checkmark the broccoli box or there was a glitch in the system.  ¯\_(?)_/¯  Their ranch dressing tastes bottled and I didn't like it but the kale was nice and tender and the quinoa was delicious.  
.
$11.95 David's special salad had thinly chopped kale massaged with their housemade lemon vinaigrette and topped with roasted beet/carrot/quinoa salad, curried quinoa, spiced chickpeas, shredded carrots, diced avocado, and hemp seeds.  The chickpeas are so tasty and have a light spice to them.  The beets are the first I've ever tried that I liked.  Truly a delicious and filling salad.  
.
$2.25 Strawberry cookie was big, soft, and very natural tasting.  You would never think this cookie was vegan because it tasted so good.  I liked the jam on top and wished there was more of it.

I loved the tree of life! The variety is awesome here! I love the location, its pretty much an awesome place for open minded people looking for great taste in food with many meatless options!! My boyfriend also enjoyed his food which did have meat in it.. can't wait to go back!!

Worth the walk!  We woke up this morning at the Plaza wondering where to go for breakfast.  We read the reviews on Yelp and as a nutritarian we were happy to see a menu that is vegan.  We arrived and were not disappointed!  The staff was amazing, gave us great recommendations, and also shared other vegan friendly stops for us to try around town.  We got the Match a superfoods smoothy,  delicious and nutritious.  We also got the good earth pita, and the tree of life pita.  They offered to split the pitas so we each got a box with half of each in it which wss thoughtful.  "So good!"  It was a healthful way to start the day but we felt that we indulged, fabulously tasty!! THEY ALSO DELIVER! We look forward to ordering more items throughout our weekend stay.  Everyone we met there was super friendly and helpful.  We highly recommend to vegan and non vegan alike!

Didn't know what to expect coming here except that they had vegan options.  It was great!  Totally casual atmosphere.
It was totally a cafe to go if you need to study, meet up with people, use a computer, or just want a quick lunch.  You go up to the counter to order and they take your name and bring it out to you.

I had The Vegucated sandwich which was one of the best, if not the best, vegan sandwich I have ever had dining out.  Also had a cup of there vegetable soup of the day and a vegan chai cookie (which was incredible).  Had the kale-apple-banana juice.  That was good too.  It was pretty busy when I was there but it sure didn't seem like it with how quick the food came out. 

They had a little table with children books and kid chairs which made my experience a lot more enjoyable with a 2 year old.

Staff was beyond helpful and friendly.

Omg! Amazing!! I wish this place was in Houston! The davids special is phenomenal! Talk about super food salad. I game here multiple times while I was in Vegas, couldn't get enough. Their hummus and cucumbers are tasty. The watermelon drink was very refreshing. Probably one of the highlights of my Vegas trip as I LOVE a good healthy, QUALITY salad! The staff here were SO accommodating and kind. A++++ bronze cafe! Side note: this location can be confusing as it is INSIDE of the center and it's hidden. Don't miss it!

Bronze Cafe, you are my "diamond cafe".  You have brought beauty to Downtown Las Vegas.  You are the 4 C's, color, cut, clarity and carat.  You are a CLEARLY friendly, inviting place.  I felt the SHINE from the warm welcome of the staff and the patrons.  You are the SLICE of vegan and vegetarian deliciousness I seek out for me and my family.  I delighted in the Carrot Cake Blended and my children devoured the Lemon Blueberry Cookie and Chocolate Zucchini Muffin.  You are the CRISP IMAGE of what I want in a community.  The Bronze Cafe provides a venue for my children and me to read, chatter, eat, and socialize. I appreciate the true feeling of community here.  You are AUTHENTIC and REAL; your carat weight is PALPABLE and PURE.

Who knew healthy could taste so good!

I had a friend in town who partied a little too hard over the weekend, so he wanted to start his week off right on a healthy note. I took him on a hike and then over here for dinner. I had previously sampled their food while volunteering at an event they catered, so I was excited to get full portions this time. First off, the bizness salad is delicious. I had this with chickpeas, beats and quinoa, but there's other topping options you can go for. I could probably eat this every day. The tree of life pita is also a great choice- packed full of veggies on a warm pita. Now maybe not the healthiest option on the menu, but the Complicated Order is a must. This has bacon, BACON JAM, avocado, turkey, tomatoes and greens, all on a perfectly toasted ciabatta bun. The bacon jam is pretty awesome, and if I had a jar at home I'd probably put it on just about everything. 

Bronze is located inside The Center, so don't get confused when you don't see a storefront. We came in on a Monday night while an open mic night was going on so it was pretty crowded. There are a bunch of tables around though so we were able to find a few open seats and watch some free entertainment. 

Even though this is a bit of a trek from my house, I'll be back!

Bronze Cafe gets a gold star

Although advertised as "vegetarian", and including many vegan and vegetarian items on the menu, Bronze Cafe swings both ways and has a nice selection of salads and sandwiches that are also omnivore-friendly.  The "sammiches" can also all be ordered as salads, and the LGBTQ is particularly tasty (bacon is the 'B' in that mouthful).

The setting is the foyer of the The Gay and Lesbian Community Center of Southern Nevada (The Center), and includes a library, comfy chairs and small and large tables; once you order your food, you can sit and it's brought out to you by people who seem genuinely happy to be working there. 

Next up - return here for breakfast (and for those of you downtown, they do both take-out & delivery).

It's a unique location to tell others about to be sure. But despite that, everyone is super friendly and the food is to die for. I would go every day if I could. They make all their baked goods, the food tastes pure and clean, and even though the prices might not be considered cheap, it's more than worth it!
The bizness David's special is amazing! But I've recently grown a custom to the complicated order!

The Food is Great! The Caring from the owners, Dave and Peter, is to the Moon!
Please come back and support healthy living and eating!

The Pitas are to die for! I love the tree of life pita. It is a great place for lunch. They always have a daily soup and offer free samples. Of course the desserts are great twists on old classics. The chai cookie is A-MAZ-ING! But it is a small place so you want to get there a little bit before the lunch crowd.
Best little cafe in town. I have eaten everything on the menu and there are no mediocre items here.

Love this place!  The food is seriously off the chain!  And I feel healthy in eating it, which is a nice bonus!  I believe they have delivery, but might call ahead and double check me on that.

Located in the lobby of The Center on Maryland Pkwy, there is plenty of seating.  There is relaxing background music and the atmosphere is laid back.  

The staff are uber friendly and helpful.  They have tea, coffee, smoothies, sandwiches, salads, soup and various sides.  Try one of the many available homemade desserts...seriously goodness in your mouth!  My favs have to be the LGBTQ sandwich (bacon jam, yes bacon jam...nuff said!), hummus and The Fruity Pebbles Cookie.  The Tree of Life Pita is also wonderful...

Even if the location is off your beaten path...it's really worth a stop.  You won't be disappointed!  I might even see on my volunteer nights at The Center!  :)
Yum! What an awesome selection of both great tasting and healthy food! Great service and an awesome discount for medical professionals!

I'm from LA with a lot of good food here, but this is the best food I've had in a long time!  We were passing through LV and looking for something healthy so we Yelped "Vegetarian" and this place came up with good ratings.  I'm so glad we stopped.

I'm not a vegetarian, but like vegetarian food (and try not to eat too much meat), so my partner and I split the Tree of Life sandwich, and the LGBTQ bacon sandwich.  Both were delicious!

On our way back home 7 days later, I made sure to time it so we could have lunch there.  This time we had the Tree of Life again (so good!) and tried the Good Earth Pita, also vegetarian and also delicious.  And, because I everything was so good, we got 2 salads (The Bizness) to go for us to have for dinner when we got home in LA a few hours later.  And yes, they were just as delicious as the sandwiches.  Oh, as was the banana bread we got for a snack for the car.

To top it off, the staff was super friendly and helpful.  We ended up meeting Peter and David, the owners, and I wish them the best of luck.  

I don't normally gush about a place like I am now, but I don't normally have delicious, healthy food at a reasonable price.  I just hope I didn't over sell it.

The Tree of Life is still my favorite for lunch.  Butternut squash vegan soup has the perfect blend of spices (I like to buy 3 or 4 and take home to freezer). Lunch crew is fast and always friendly - thank you Carmen, John, Gino and Peter!

Love this place! All the boys who work there are adorable and always go over and beyond to give great service. We came in unknowingly at closing one night - and the doors were already locked. They saw us though the glass doors, recognized us as regulars, unlocked them and allowed us to order food before they closed up for the night. Which was over and beyond for exceptional service. Besides the staff being so great, the food is also bomb! Vegan options, fresh prepped salads, juices and slow brewed coffee and close to downtown. Thumbs up for this cafe it's more than you'd expect!

The Bronze Cafe is my goto place for healthy and satisfying food.  The two items that I crave most and tend to alternate between are the vegan Thai Peanut Salad and the vegan David's Special(The Bizness Salad with all the goods ;)  ).  

The Thai Peanut Salad is my favorite pre-packaged togo salad that's perfect for popping in my fridge for work the next day.  The crisp, fresh veggies combined with the creamy peanut dressing is such a treat to have in the middle of the day.  It's the perfect amount of food and the dressing isn't too heavy or greasy so I don't feel like going into a food coma when I have so much to do still.  

The David's Special (The Bizness w/the works) is like a flavorful cornucopia of everything your parents prepared wrong for you when you were younger (sorry mom).  I HATED beets and had a weird relationship with kale before I gave them a shot in this salad. The variety of textures and flavors packed into this one salad are unbelievably good.  I like to order mine with seitan also but it's great just as is.  I've been a veg head for many years and I have never had or made a salad as good as this one.

 Having so many vegan menu options that taste so good makes it hard to decide sometimes so when I go with my friends I like to order several and share with them.  Especially the desserts, I love to get a few different flavors of the vegan cheesecakes since they change up the flavors so often. Gotta try 'em all!
Great location in the container city. Great food, great staff. Was helpful in making decisions. A must for any vegan or healthy eater
Saw reviews on Yelp. Thought it would be great last Vegas meal before going home. Checked in & got $1 off order. Saw a cookie "marriage" with brownie so had to order. Delicious!

I don't think I could of had a better experience at this little cafe.  I did circle around the building a few times before realizing it was in the building, but I'd circle around 10 more times so long as it meant eating the chicken salad sandwich I had.  The staff was super friendly, with a face like the one that greeted me how could you not leave a place happier walking out than when you walked in?  

10/10, that was the best chicken salad sandwich I have ever had.  
The menu states that there are apples in there, but do not let that steer you away from this sandwich if you are the kind of person that does not like fruit with your chicken.  Because, let me tell you, they make apples and chicken go together like peanut butter and jelly.

I kept hearing about the Tree of Life Pita vegan sandwich so I went and got one.  I am not really into sweet stuff and it was too sweet for my liking but the flavors were there and I can't wait to buy some for my friends that I know would love it.  It really is an incredible bit.  Service was terrific.  You owe it to yourself to try it.

This place is a hidden gem! Omg, I got the guac and mole with the 24oz just too good both incredibly delicious! The center is beautiful, spacious, with a chill vibe perfect for late night study sessions or a casual meet. A must check out!
